campaign.story:
The Story Engine: Deck of Worlds is a set of 240 cards for creating imagined lands, local lore, and story-driven world maps you can instantly explore through writing or roleplay.
Containing hundreds of open-ended worldbuilding prompts created by a talented international team of writers, the deck is ideal for worldbuilders, writers, loremasters, storytellers, DMs, teachers, and RPG groups of all kinds. 
The deck features 6 simple card types that work together to create complex settings with a meaningful past, present, and future. With trillions of potential combinations and open-ended scalability, you can build anything from a city full of unique districts and landmarks, to a sprawling land of diverse terrain types, ecosystems, cultures, and civilizations. 
Combine Deck of Worlds with the original Story Engine Deck to fill your world with prompted characters, encounters, artefacts, story hooks, and more. By pairing the two, you can essentially explore and play in a creatively generated world using your preferred medium or RPG system.
Along with the standalone Deck of Worlds, we have also unlocked stretch goals for 3 new expansions and 6 new booster sets for the original Story Engine Deck, which you might know from our 1430%-funded Kickstarter project with 3,500+ happy backers.
 Deck of Worlds contains 6 types of cards that you can assemble into micro-settings.  
Each micro-setting represents a unique area with its own geography, lore, features, and current events. You can organically assemble multiple micro-settings into a connected world map full of diverse cities, sprawling wildernesses, ancient secrets, vibrant cultures, multifaceted politics, and endless storytelling opportunities.
You can set the scale of your map to represent the kind of world you want to create, from an epic continent to a small city, and even use small side-maps to explore areas of interest in greater detail.
Like The Story Engine Deck, the Deck of Worlds only has two formal guidelines:
1) Don’t put the deck away until you create something. It can just be a word in a notebook or an idea in your head.
2) Ignore any card, rule, or guideline that doesn’t help you create.
But I’ve put together guiding principles to help you get as much mileage out of your deck as possible.
The 6 card types weave together threads of the area's past, present, and future to create a holistic, immersive setting.
Region Cards, Landmark Cards, and Namesake Cards establish the geography of your world.
Origin Cards, Attribute Cards, and Advent Cards provide past, present, and future lore for those locations. These cards have been contributed to by an international team of writers, including Akira Keith, Athar Fikry, A.Z. Louise, Brendon Alekseii, Cae Hawksmoor, J.D. Harlock, Juliet Kemp, Michael Barker, Pedro Galicia, Peter Chiykowski, Sarah Loch, and Shiv MacFarlane.
The text prompts written on cards are called cues. All cards except for Region Cards contain multiple cues. Whenever you draw a card with multiple cues, choose one cue from that card to use for your worldbuilding and ignore the rest.
You can create a micro-setting in less than 5 minutes.
1) Draw a Region Card. Place it on your map. This provides the underlying environment type of your micro-setting.
2) Draw a Landmark Card. Choose one cue. Tuck the card under the Region so only the chosen cue is showing. This expands your micro-setting and provides a point of interest.
3) Draw a Namesake Card. Choose one cue. Tuck the card under the Region or Landmark so that only the chosen cue is showing. The Namesake Card provides the Region or Landmark with an in-world nickname.
4) Draw an Origin Card. Choose one cue. Tuck the card under the Region or Landmark so only the chosen cue is showing. The Origin Card provides the Region or Landmark with a lore-based backstory.
5) Draw an Attribute Card. Choose one cue. Tuck the card under the Region or Landmark so only the chosen cue is showing. The Attribute Card provides the Region or Landmark with details about the area or the people who live there.
6) Draw an Advent Card. Choose one cue. Tuck the card under the Region or Landmark so only the chosen cue is showing. The Advent Card provides the Region or Landmark with an event that could change the future of the area and/or serve as a story hook.
When tucking cards, you may rotate cards and place them in any orientation that allows you to read the cue and remember which card that cue applies to. 
You may also allow more or less of the card’s surface to show to expand the area of the micro-setting.
When you are done arranging your cards, you can take as much or as little time as you like to interpret the cues that make up your micro-setting. You can make notes, or move on and create another micro-setting immediately.
You can also create a complex micro-setting by following the same set of steps, but drawing and placing 2 Landmark Cards, 2 Namesake Cards, and 2 Attribute Cards during their respective steps. For example:
Arrange your assembled micro-settings into a continuous map to build your world.
You can move card clusters, rearrange the cards inside, and switch cues as you go. The goal is for the cards to provide a simple and fluid system for assembling and workshopping the details of your world.
Here's an unscripted video of improvising a micro-setting in just a few minutes, which led to a second setting connected to the first through lore and story. Closed captions are available.
There are also multiplayer modes for collaboratively creating a shared world and its lore with other players, which is a great way to kick off a group tabletop roleplaying campaign or write stories in a shared universe.
 Micro-setting clusters give you freedom to assemble a massive world map out of connected regions, or focus on a small area in detail. 
While the artwork on the cards is not to scale, you can space card clusters to reflect a consistent scale of distance between them. You can also shift how much of each tucked card is showing to expand or contract areas to better reflect their scope, and adjust your tucking patterns to change the shape of the individual area. The deck is designed to encourage non-gridded maps with irregular shapes.
Depending on the size of the world you want to build, I recommend the following guidelines.
 To map a continent roughly the size of Middle Earth, assemble 14-20 micro-settings in a 30” x 25” space. Treat 1 inch as ~50 miles (~80 km).
 To map a country roughly the size of Thailand, assemble 9-14 micro-settings in a 25” x 20” space. Treat 1 inch as ~20 miles (~32 km).
 To map a city roughly the size of modern London, assemble 5-7 micro-settings in a 20” x 15” space. Treat 1 inch as ~1 mile (1.6 km)
I may tweak these values as playtesting continues.
Note: D&D estimates that the average character can travel 24 miles in a day without incurring penalties. Other sources estimating foot travel in the medieval period have suggested 9-14 miles.
We brought in some of our favorite authors and artists to help create some sample settings using alpha copies of The Story Engine: Deck of Worlds. 
Their original creations will be illustrated as limited-edition collector postcards available through Kickstarter as well as digital lore releases available for free on our website, but with early access for Kickstarter backers!
You'll be able to read about and explore 13 portable micro-settings. These will be created by a team of guest authors—Alina Pete, Brent Lambert, Carrie Cuinn, CL Clark, Elizabeth Aoki, Jordan Shiveley, and Victor Manibo—and a team of international artists—Angel Muro, Aysha, Beth Sparks, Cam Adjodha, Frances P., Grace P. Fong ("Fictograph"), Kuutti Terävä, Lauren Ring, Mel Uran, Megan McCurdy, Sabaa Bismil, Thaleia Demeter, and Tiago Sousa.

The core deck of 240 cards (all card stretch goals unlocked!) is designed to create imagined worlds in any genre, although it lends itself especially well to fantasy.
To explore different genres and encourage creators to focus on different aspects of their worldbuilding, we're also releasing a range of expansion sets via stretch goals (all unlocked).
 Three genre expansions are available upon launch.
The genre expansions each contain 60 cards: 8 Regions, 12 Landmarks, 12 Namesakes, 8 Origins, 12 Attributes, and 8 Advents. The Region and Landmark Cards are a mixture of entirely new cues and cues from the main deck with variant genre artwork. The Namesake, Origin, Attribute, and Advent Cards are all 100% new.
Worlds of Myth & Magic Fantasy Expansion contains evocative fantasy imagery and worldbuilding prompts.
Worlds of Chrome & Starlight Science Fiction Expansion contains imaginative sci-fi imagery and worldbuilding prompts.
Worlds of Blight & Shadow Horror Expansion contains creepy, unsettling, and uncanny horror imagery and worldbuilding prompts.
 Three cartography expansions have been unlocked!
The cartography expansions each contain 60 cards: 8 Regions, 12 Landmarks, 12 Namesakes, 8 Origins, 12 Attributes, and 8 Advents. The Region and Landmark Cards are a mixture of entirely new cues and cues from the main deck with variant artwork on specialized climates. The Namesake, Origin, Attribute, and Advent Cards are all 100% new.
Worlds of Tide & Tidings Coastlines Expansion contains prompts for developing coastal areas.
Worlds of Sand & Story Deserts Expansion contains prompts for developing dry, hot, and arid areas.
Worlds of Frost & Fable Arctic Expansion contains prompts for developing cold areas.

 Three creative expansions have been unlocked!
Shared Hearths & Common Creeds Culture Keyholes Expansion features 60 special Keyhole Cards loaded up with 240 culture-focused worldbuilding questions that act as keyholes for opening larger aspects of your setting. 
 Depending on the level of detail you want to explore your setting in, you can tuck 1-3 questions per micro-setting, answering these questions as you write your setting notes, or layering in the questions when you have completed your world map and want to know more about an area. For more details on alternate ways to use these cards and how to apply them on a deeper level, see our May 31 project update.
Fresh Ink & Ancient Song Lore Fragments Expansion features prompts for creating in-world lore fragments in a variety of media: poems, prayers, floorplans, sketches, drinking songs, campfire stories, overheard conversations, tavern jokes, and more. 
This deck allows storytellers to create prompts by combining two new card types. 
The expansion contains 30 Opus Cards that provide a specific creative challenge or medium to create in, and 30 Flourish Cards that provide optional style challenges to focus the creative process.

Heroes' Quests & Fools' Errands Adventure Prompts Expansion is a deck of 60 Adventure Cards that create customizable story hooks set in your world. They provide a simple quest/adventure framework with sockets for attaching details taken from your setting or cards drawn from The Story Engine Deck. They essentially can turn Deck of Worlds into a loosely structured solo RPG using your preferred RPG rules.

The Story Engine Deck was a breakout Kickstarter success that quickly grew into a set of genre expansions and subgenre boosters.
You can by downloading the free demo from our website, but essentially, you arrange 5 types of cards to create a bottomless supply of story prompts. 
PLAY

We are also launching 3 new expansions and 6 new boosters for The Story Engine Deck as stretch goals (all unlocked!) in this Kickstarter.
UNLOCKED! Written In Blood & Alibi Mystery Expansion contains 60 all-new cards: 12 Agents, 12 Engines, 12 Anchors, 12 Conflicts, and 12 Aspects.
UNLOCKED! Humble Roots & Epic Origins Backstory Expansion contains 60 all-new cards: 30 Engine-variant cards focused on backstory relationships, and 30 Conflict-variant cards with a focus on backstory elements causing current challenges.
UNLOCKED! Enchanted Items & Cursed Curios Unique Items Expansion contains 12 all-new  Anchor Cards featuring 8 new illustrations and 4 licensed art pieces from the team behind the EMBERWIND RPG, and 48 all-new Aspect-variant Cards that give special enchantments designed for items, but that can also apply to people and places.
UNLOCKED! Fairy Trails & Grim Tales Fairy Tale Booster contains 20 all-new cards: 4 Agents, 4 Engines, 4 Anchors, 4 Conflicts, and 4 Aspects.

The 6 new boosters will feature the same folding lotus-style reusable and recyclable packaging with multi-panel artwork. Here's an example showing the eldritch horror booster from the original Story Engine Deck.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The deck is fully designed and has been playtested using a high-quality prototype, so the project development is at a stable point. The international team of contributing writers is currently punching up the deck and expansions with some really creative and evocative prompts. 

The stretch goal expansions have all been written and many have been designed, although a few are not yet in final layout. In particular, the Lore Fragments Expansion, Culture Keyholes Expansion, and the non-image cards from the Story Engine expansions have been written (minus writer team punch-up) but not put into final layout yet. We are also still producing artwork with the EMBERWIND team for the 12 new Anchor cards in the Enchanted Items Expansion.

This is my 7th Kickstarter, and over the past decade of designing and delivering successful crowdfunding projects, I've learned many lessons about how to deliver a project despite any obstacle that might come up—and how to keep backers in the loop every step of the way.

My last project, The Story Engine Deck, overfunded 1430% and ran into unprecedented challenges like national manufacturing shutdowns in China, the COVID-19 pandemic, one nearly-shipwrecked cargo vessel, Europe snap-shutting the border mid-fulfilment, and the UK leaving the EU in the final weeks of delivery.

I communicated with my backers throughout the process and I always make sure every backer gets what they pay for. I encourage you to check out the unprompted backer comments on my previous Kickstarters as proof of the level of communication, transparency, and backer satisfaction I am for in all of my work.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
The durable reinforced box has lifelong utility and all cards have already been upgraded to 350gsm cardstock through the previous Kickstarter's stretch goals for longer-lasting cards.
Reusability and recyclability
The deck and box are 100% recyclable, but the deck is designed for endless reusability, so it's my goal to make sure you never need to dispose of them.
Sustainable Distribution
We use local fulfilment partners to minimize carbon footprint in distributing decks. Most packaging supplies are recycled and/or recyclable, with the exception of shrink wrap used around cards to keep them dry and undamaged in transit.
Something else
We routinely make copies of our creative products available to educators and community groups for free.

campaign.story:
Our intrepid author Paige Turner is back!  In Paperback Adventures, you get to play as the protagonist in one of Paige's wild brainstorming sessions. Conquer a menagerie of pulp novel characters in this solo deckbuilding word game.
Just like in the original game Paperback—and its follow up, Hardback—you will build your own deck of cards throughout the game, and those cards will have letters to help you spell words every turn. But in Paperback Adventures, instead of testing your wordsmithing wit against other players, you will use your words to defeat a series of AI enemies in "roguelike" fashion.
Paperback Adventures is a solo-focused game. It was designed from the ground up as a strategic, highly-replayable solo word game. There are also additional gameplay variants for cooperative play between two players.
Here are the stretch goals we've unlocked!
Community Stretch Goals
Part of what makes Kickstarter great is the opportunity to hear what matters most to backers. Here are some of the additions and changes we’ve made thanks to our backers’ feedback.
As the game developed and grew, we wanted every character to have their own cards and unique styles of play, but with the Fowers Games history of small box games we also wanted to keep an affordable price point for the game. So we decided on a modular system that lets you play the game whether you buy one character or several.
Here's what the Paperback Adventures core box contains:
Rulebook
Enemy Tray with Tokens (designed by Game Trayz™)
12 Enemy Cards
12 Reward Cards
7 Penalty Cards
7 Enemy Vowel and "?" Cards
26 Item Cards
26 McGuffin Cards
7 Penalty Card Sleeves
As long as you have at least one character box, the core box contains everything else you need to play the game. The core box also has space to store the bonus content from each of your character boxes (note: not all content from those boxes), allowing you to set up a new game more quickly.
So what comes in a character box? Each protagonist in Paperback Adventures plays distinctly, with different core items, starting items, and a unique 10-card starting deck. Additionally, every protagonist has their own growth deck of 50 cards that offers different paths and playstyles every game session.
But a character box doesn't only provide new content when you choose that character. Inside each character box you'll also find a few new enemies and a few new bonus items and McGuffins that go into your core box and add additional content no matter which character you pick for a given game.
Each character box has bonus enemies, items, and double-sided McGuffins (like this one!)
The more character boxes you add, the more variety and wacky combinations you get. 
Here's what comes in each character box:
Character Tray with Tokens (designed by Game Trayz™)
Character Card
6 Enemy Cards
6 Reward Cards
60 Letter Cards
6 Core Item Cards
4 Bonus Item Cards
4 Bonus McGuffin Cards
60 Letter Card Sleeves
The protagonists are not only unique from a gameplay standpoint, they also come from wildly different genres and have their own graphical style and artistic design. Here are the playable characters in Paperback Adventures:
Our final character is a Pirate—he is currently awaiting a proper name to be voted on by the backers!
Word-heavy playstyle
Barrage cards get bonuses for longer words
Can drain the enemy's life!
Can copy the effect of an item—effectively using it twice
Crew cards come back from the fatigue pile
Try out the Tabletop Simulator demo on Steam!
In a single game of Paperback Adventures, your protagonist will face off against nine randomized enemies of escalating difficulty.  To make matters worse, your health total persists from enemy to enemy. Luckily for you, each enemy also offers randomized rewards to help you power up quickly to meet the challenge. 
You'll need to beat each enemy one by one by spelling words with the cards in your hand. Each card has symbols that either damage the enemy, block the enemy's incoming damage to you, or provide you with mana so you can use your items. You'll also be able to activate the unique ability of one of your cards.
The game is divided in a trilogy structure, where you'll battle two normal enemies and a boss for each "book" in the trilogy. You can stop a game session after completing one book (~45 min) or even after any enemy through a "save game" feature that will keep your current deck, items, and rewards separate in the game's box. To beat the game, you'll need to defeat all nine enemies in the trilogy.
One goal from the outset of this game's design was to find ways to streamline the typical deckbuilding roguelike experience found in digital games for tabletop play. Two essential systems deliver the gameplay variation and combos needed for the genre while keeping player upkeep at a minimum: the splay system and the hex and boon counter system.
Your word is ready—which way will you splay?
 When you spell words each turn in Paperback Adventures, you'll need to also choose which way to splay your word, so that only one edge of each card is showing except for the top card. The only card ability visible will be on the top card, and that's the ability you activate. Here's an example of how it works:
When you splay left, you count all the icons on the left edge of each card. The top card is the last letter of the word.
When you splay right you count all the icons on the right edge of each card. The top card is the first letter of the word.
The splay system forces you to make tough choices—do you want more blocks or more hits this turn? Or maybe which card is your top card matters most. To make that decision even tougher (and to keep every battle moving), the top card also gets fatigued for the rest of the battle. You'll get it back for the next enemy, though!
Hex and boon counters allow protagonists and enemies to support a wide range of playstyles without adding too many rules and overhead for players to track. Hex counters affect the character they are on negatively, while boon counters affect the character they are on positively. So these counters are always contextual--one enemy's hex counters might cause accelerating damage, while another enemy's hex counters limit your card draw.
Here is a link to the current working rulebook for Paperback Adventures
We know that some players will want a tougher challenge, especially after completing a few runs. So we’ll be including a system called Plot Twists.
Every Plot Twist comes with two distinct challenges, one on top and one on bottom, for the entirety of your run. Here is one condition card unlocked earlier in the campaign:
Each challenge has a difficulty number assigned to it, with “1” being the lowest difficulty. Before starting a run, you can choose an overall challenge level for your run and then mix and match challenges from the various Plot Twists until the collective difficulty numbers add up to your desired challenge level. This way, you can experience brand new challenge combinations while also making the game better fit your experience and skill level.
You can splay the Plot Twists underneath your player tray, showing only the new rules from your chosen challenges so that you can quickly reference them. Those rules will stay the same throughout your run.
While Paperback Adventures was designed from the start as a solo experience, we also knew that people would enjoy playing it with others. We’ve been playtesting and working behind the scenes to bring some two player variants to the table that not only open up a seat for an additional player but also open up new ways to approach the game.
Two-Headed Giant
This cooperative mode really leans into the idea of co-op play. The two players must work in tandem using the same character, deck, and token tracker. But here’s the kicker: you split your starting items and McGuffins between the two of you. Additionally, you alternate taking turns, which means your items and McGuffins are only available half the time. Anytime you gain an item or McGuffin, you both gain one!
A lot of the fun in this variant comes from working together to find the best words and setting each other up for big turns. Don’t just take our word for it though; check out this gameplay video where we show off the mode over a couple different enemy fights.
Double Trouble
In the Double Trouble mode, each player has their own character to play! They team up against a pair of enemies, but they must coordinate their attacks and share certain resources—like the wild card!  (To make this possible, one enemy uses the tray from the unused character.)
 Paperback Playthrough with Aaron of GameEnthus and designer Skye Larsen
Playthrough from a Live Stream with Ruel Gaviola on Tabletop Tonight
Book 2 Gameplay from a Live Stream with Richmond of BramBeard Gaming
Jason Perez with One Stop Co-op Shop
You won't get too far in a roguelike without sweet loot. Reward cards for each enemy will give you two options to choose from. You have to choose which set of loot is more important to keep progressing.
Items provide powerful effects that can be used once per turn, but you'll need mana to activate most of them.  
Examples of a McGuffin and item with completed art
McGuffins are always double-sided, and you'll get to choose which McGuffin will help you more. These powerups provide modest effects, but don't require mana for use. Find the right ones for some spectacular combos!
Every character letter card is also upgradeable. When a reward says you upgrade a card, flip the card over and put it back in its sleeve. Some card upgrades add extra icons to the card, while others improve or even alter the card ability.

 Shipping will be charged in our post-campaign pledge manager after the campaign.  We ship customs friendly.
 Tim Fowers, co-designer, has piloted many successful games including Burgle Bros, Fugitive, and Paperback 
 Skye Larsen, co-designer, has finally justified his Creative Writing degree (sort of)
 Jeff Krause, development, worked with Tim on Sabotage and Burgle Bros 2

 We'd also like to thank Andrew Colin Beck for our logo design, Nate Stebbing for the animation work in our Kickstarter video, and Fernando Cunha for our gameplay animations on this page.
We will use a pledge manager to help our backers get their copy of Paperback Adventures as quickly as possible. Shipping costs will be added later through the pledge management system.
This campaign won't have any Kickstarter-exclusive components, but your pledge still means a lot! Here's how pledging now benefits both you and the game.
You will receive the game at a discount compared to after the campaign
Because the game will not go through distributors, it may not show up in your local store.
You can help guide our game's development. We will listen to our backers' thoughts and implement ideas and feedback where we can.
Finally, you'll be a big reason why we get the game to print and share it with others.

campaign.story:
The ancient world was filled with restless and powerful spirits. Two million years ago, new forces began to stir...and everything changed.

 TUKI: Fight for Fire
At the dawn of humanity, during a prolonged period of hardship and drought, three lost children meet a mysterious traveler named Tuki. Together, their search for the Motherherd of all Buffalo leads them far north through the dangerous territory of a rival species called the Habiline. The Habiline hunt and kill anyone found using fire. Tuki's reputation precedes them and soon they find themselves at the center of unwanted attention not only from Habiline warriors, but of gods and giants!
 Welcome! 
I'm Jeff and this is my first Kickstarter. Thank you for coming! I'm not sure what took me so long, since I've been self-publishing for years! 2021 is the 30th anniversary of BONE #1 which my wife Vijaya and I put out in July of 1991 through our imprint Cartoon Books. For folks who are unfamiliar with me or my comics, BONE is a single story, a fantasy epic that is sometimes divided up in nine volumes. More recently, I self-published my science-fiction noir story RASL from 2008 to 2013. Both books are still in print and going strong.  And now, to mark the birthday of BONE and Cartoon Books, we are announcing my next self-published project - TUKI: Fight for Fire! 
If we reach our goal, TUKI: Fight for Fire will be released this July, 30 years to the month of BONE #1, to be followed in October by a second volume TUKI: Fight for Family. Both books are part of this campaign. 
This campaign includes two original graphic novels 
 Book One TUKI: Fight for Fire by Jeff Smith
144 pages, 11.375 x 8.875 trade paperback, full color cover, b&w interiors 
This book is complete and ready for the printer

 Book Two TUKI: Fight for Family by Jeff Smith
144 pages (approx.) 11.375 x 8.875 trade paperback, full color cover, b&w interiors
This book is 95% finished with only the final two chapters to be inked. We will keep you updated on its progress
If funded, to be shipped as they are printed:
Book One: July 2021 (30 years after the release of BONE #1 in July 1991)
Book Two: October 2021
A Passion Project
As with my previous works, BONE and RASL, the former inspired by a love of adventure stories, comic strips and epics, the latter by science fiction, physics and noir, TUKI follows this pattern of personal passions. In this case, my interest in the fantastic heroes of pulp fiction, mythical lost realms and human evolution.
I’ve always been fascinated by evolution. I visited Olduvai Gorge in Tanzania, the famous archaeological site occupied by many early humans over time. Standing down amongst the rocks and dirt, looking up at the swaying trees above the gorge, I had a vision of multiple human species walking around and interacting with each other. It was almost like seeing an echo of something that really happened.
There was a moment, two million years ago when that actually could have happened. Two million years ago, more than one species of human existed at the same time.

A Note on Paleoanthropology 
Evolution, unlike the neat bumper sticker that shows a single line of primates slowly standing upright, is in reality much messier and more scattershot. Isolated groups evolved separately over hundreds of thousands or even millions of years. Two million years ago, many different kinds of humans were all roaming upright on two legs across  east Africa.
You will meet some of them in this story. Australopithecus, the species that the famous Lucy was from, part hominid, half human from the waist down. The Habiline people, still shaggy, but with a bigger brain who developed the stone hand axe, a precision tool. And more.
During this amazing epoch, the world was devastated by climate events that threatened to wipe out the struggling humans. Drought caused changes in the landscapes and massive migrations bringing the humans into conflict with each other. Then came the greatest upheaval yet - a new human, tall and strong, with the biggest brain of all, enters the scene bearing a power never before seen...the ability to control fire.
Here begin the terrors, Here begin the marvels.

I hope you'll join me!
REWARDS!

campaign.story:
In Hellboy: The Dice Game, you take on the role of a B.P.R.D. recruit exploring a mysterious location. As a new recruit your abilities and resources are limited so you'll need your wits about you to try and survive. Push your luck to press deeper into the unknown or play it safe and live to fight another day. The choice is yours!
The game includes a deck of rooms that you must explore. Some will contain harmless frog swarms, whereas others will hide dangerous frog monsters or even more notorious foes from Hellboy's past! The differently coloured dice represent your limited resources and you must choose carefully when selecting which ones to roll. If you run out of dice or wounds, it's the end of your turn.
 The thrilling Dice Game isn’t the only way to back this Kickstarter because we’re also funding FOUR brand-new expansions for Hellboy: The Board Game. Designed by original developers, Needy Cat Games, each of these expansions builds on the tension-packed, co-operative experience of Hellboy: The Board Game but turns the danger up to 11, thanks to the all-new optional Ragnarok mode.

That’s right, saving the world just got a whole lot tougher as enemies become stronger and more difficult to defeat. Ragnarok mode can be used to offer an additional challenge to not only these new expansions, but the core game as well. It's perfect if you've breezed through the previous Case Files and want an even tougher experience!
Please note, you will need Hellboy: The Board Game in order to play these expansions.
You’ve played through the core game, Darkness Calls and The Wild Hunt. Now it’s time to bring the saga to a close with The Storm and The Fury. Armed with a certain magical sword (no spoilers here, just in case), Hellboy must face his toughest foe yet: Nimue in her dragon form. This is the biggest miniature we’ve made for Hellboy: The Board Game and it’s not going to be easy to take her down.
3D renders of miniatures.
The Storm and the Fury includes new miniatures, an epic Case File, new Deck of Doom cards, new Encounter Cards and a new playable version of Hellboy.
Test miniatures painted by Studio Giraldez. Miniatures supplied unpainted.


HELLBOY AND THE B.P.R.D.
But that’s not all for Hellboy: The Board Game fans because with the storyline complete, it’s time to move onto a whole new chapter inspired by the B.P.R.D. graphic novels. These three new expansions focus on a different element to make your games of Hellboy more unpredictable and action-packed than ever before.
With Hellboy gone, the B.P.R.D. faces a range of horrifying new minions as the world descends into chaos. The Hell on Earth expansion introduces new minions to add to your missions. From swarming Crickets, to demons and Ogdru-Hem mutants, you’re going to wish you were only facing the Frog Monsters from the core game. This expansion includes 15 minion miniatures, the Nesting Site Case File and Encounter cards, plus all the minions can be mixed into existing missions using the previously released B.P.R.D. Archives expansion.
If only it were just the minions you needed to deal with... but they're the least of your concerns. In Pandemonium some all-new bosses are here to try and end the world. This expansion includes The Flood Case File, Enemy cards, Unexpected Threat Hammerhead card, Encounter cards and Boss Behaviour Cards.
With all that, you’re going to need some new heroes and the B.P.R.D. is here to save the day. End of Days includes new playable agents – Ted Howards, Sledgehammer, Evolved Abe Sapien and Flaming Liz Sherman – plus the Eviction Notices Case File, character-specific Deck of Doom cards and Requisition Cards. Use these new agents to tackle the new expansions or return to your favourite missions from the original game and play them again with a fresh cast of heroes.
Test miniatures painted by Studio Giraldez. Miniatures supplied unpainted.
Combined with the original Kickstarter or the core game, these new missions make Hellboy: The Board Game infinitely replayable. Please note, you will need Hellboy: The Board Game in order to play these expansions.


 Tabletop Gaming magazine plays a prototype version of Hellboy: The Dice Game.
James from Needy Cat Games and B.P.R.D. consultant Edwin, talk about what you can expect from the new expansions! Rob from Mantic's audio does get better... we promise, plus all the important stuff comes from James and Edwin anyway.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are a number of risks with any Kickstarter project, especially getting accurate timings for such complex products with so many components. With this project, the expansions are all written and approved by Dark Horse, the miniatures and game components are approved by Dark Horse. Meanwhile, the Dice Game is also approved by Dark Horse.

We predict that we will begin shipping in June 2022 - however, the exact timing is impossible to predict and there is always the potential for delay with products produced in China. We will of course keep our backers up to date as best we can once the project closes. COVID is still causing some issues with manufacturing and this could also impact the final shipping date.

To date, we’ve successfully fulfilled 17 Kickstarter campaigns: Kings of War, DreadBall, LOKA, Mars Attacks: The Miniatures Game, Deadzone, DreadBall Xtreme, Dungeon Saga, Kings of War 2nd Edition, Deadzone: Infestation, The Walking Dead: All Out War, DreadBall Second Edition, Star Saga: The Eiras Contract, Warpath, TerrainCrate, Kings of War: Vanguard, Hellboy: The Board Game and TerrainCrate 2. We currently have two outstanding Kickstarters, League of Infamy (mostly shipped) and Hellboy: The Roleplaying Game (digital rewards have been delivered, physical rewards are due to be shipped this year). 

REFUNDS
Upon request refunds may be given within 14 days of the campaign ending, including fees. Following that time, refunds may be given minus Kickstarter and payment fees. In order to request a refund you must contact support@manticgames.com

TERMS AND CONDITIONS
By backing this campaign you acknowledge that the components, artwork and game elements may change in the final edition. This means some elements may differ from those shown here following the Kickstarter campaign.

If you do not complete the pledge manager within the time specified when the pledge manager is sent, you agree that your contribution to the campaign was a donation and your pledge is fulfilled. Of course, we will use our discretion on a case by case basis. Completing the pledge manager is the ONLY way for us to confirm your shipping address and pledge details, as well as making sure we hit the production timelines.

By pledging on this Kickstarter you agree that you will pay for any shipping and any import or other duties required in your country. If you refuse to pay customs or duties and do not accept the package, it will be destroyed and you will not be eligible for a refund. You also accept that you are liable for providing us with the correct shipping details upon request and we are not responsible for items lost in transit if sending to an incorrectly provided address. We also cannot ship to PO boxes and you must provide an alternative shipping in this circumstance.

Although we are aiming to deliver the Hellboy: The Board Game expansions to Kickstarter backers before the game is available at retail, production and shipping delays can lead to delivery at the same time or following the retail release. If you do not agree to these terms, then please purchase the game once it's available at your friendly local gaming store in 2022.

BONUS STRETCH GOAL: Portfolio Pod
Adds an special envelope to all tiers (aside from the Digital Pod) which will have the exclusive prints by Palmer, Shalvey, self, as well as John Paul Leon's black and white cover artwork for TIME BEFORE TIME #1, and a further selection of artists.
Ever been curious how a creator owned comic is made? Well here's a chance to see all the nuts and bolts of how one is put together...
 My name is Declan Shalvey, an award winning artist/writer from Ireland. I've been a freelance artist for over 10 years working for publishers such as Marvel and DC Comics on characters such as Moon Knight, Wolverine, Batman, Hulk and many more. I have also developed creator owned projects at Image comics, on books such as Injection, Savage Town and Bog Bodies.

TIME BEFORE TIME is my latest creator owned series, debuting May 12th. The series begins in the year 2140, and to escape that world with no future, many turn to the  Syndicate, a criminal organization who, for the right price, will  smuggle you back in time to a better life. After working for the  Syndicate for years, out main characters Tatsuo and Oscar decide to steal one of their  boss’s time machines—but soon find that the one thing you can’t run from  is your past.

This series is a new ongoing image series from myself and the creative team behind the recent and excellent WRITE IT IN BLOOD graphic novel. The Final Order Cutoff (FOC) to order #1 is soon; April 19th. To celebrate this new project, I'm doing something a little different... I want to pull back the curtain on the creation of an original series, for process junkies everywhere.      
 TIME BEFORE TIME: Process Edition is a 48 page process book, about making the new Image series, revealing the creative process behind developing the first issue of the series.  This is not the Image comic book that will be in comic stores; this is a book about how the comic was made. It's a rare opportunity to see all the raw elements of a comic develop into a finished piece of work.
Why Kickstarter? Well, this is an experiment for me, I've often been told that I should make some process projects though I haven't been sure how to release them. I also felt a companion process book would be a great way to dig deep into process material in a way that wouldn't be possible in a regular comic or trade collection. I've never launched a project on Kickstater before (though I've backed too many to remember!) but with a new Image series, I felt it would be an unique opportunity to put out a book like this and establish a platform to do more in the future. 
 Process Edition interior pages

Our TIME BEFORE TIME: Process Edition backers get access to...     

-Interviews with creators
-Co-writing conversation, with Declan Shalvey and Rory McConville
-Art process, by Joe Palmer (including sketches, layouts)
-Script to art comparisons, with commentary by creators.
-Cover process, by Declan Shalvey

Book designed by TIME BEFORE TIME, DECORUM and IMAGE+ designer Sasha Head
Rewards include limited edition prints, stickers, trading cards and opportunities to get signed books/ sketches from Declan Shalvey and even an original piece of TIME BEFORE TIME artwork, made specifically for this campaign.

 Declan Shalvey is an award winning artist/writer from Ireland who has worked with all the the top publishers in the comics industry. He is best known for his acclaimed run on MOON KNIGHT for Marvel Comics, revamping the character for a new audience and soon to be seen in its own Disney+ TV series.
Shalvey has worked on hit titles and characters such as IMMORTAL HULK, BATMAN, DEADPOOL VS OLD MAN LOGAN, and WOLVERINE. He as also developed creator owned projects such as INJECTION and BOG BODIES from Image Comics. Twitter/Instagram
Rory McConville is  an Irish writer living in London. His work includes TIME BEFORE TIME  and WRITE IT IN BLOOD for Image Comics, as well as several series for  2000 AD, including JUDGE DREDD and DEPARTMENT K. Twitter
Joe Palmer is a comic book artist living and working in London, UK. He drew the original graphic novel WRITE IT IN BLOOD, published by Image Comics. Joe’s latest project is TIME BEFORE TIME, also with Image Comics. Twitter/Instagram
Chris O’Halloran is an Irish comic book colorist living in Cork. He's worked on  books for Marvel, DC, Image and others including ICE CREAM MAN, SCARENTHOOD, IMMORTAL HULK and WRITE IT IN BLOOD. Twitter/Instagram
Hassan Otsmane-Elhaou is a British-Algerian letterer who has worked on comics like  WRITE IT IN BLOOD, X-O MANOWAR, and FIRST KNIFE. He's also the editor of  the Eisner-winning PANELxPANEL magazine, and voice behind the STRIP PANEL NAKED series. Twitter
Heather Antos is an award-winning comic book editor and writer most known for her work on Marvel's  STAR WARS and DEADPOOL lines,  as well as one of the co-creators of GWENPOOL. Now, you can find her editing various titles at Image, Valiant, and Humanoids. Twitter/Instagram
Sasha E Head  is a branding and editorial graphic designer who works in  comics and video games. She is best known for her art direction and design work on Image Comics’ monthly publication IMAGE+ as well as her work on  Jonathan Hickman & Mike Huddleston’s series DECORUM. She is not a  time traveler, and even if she was she wouldn't admit it here. Twitter/Instagram

updates.update_content: Just shy of a month since the last update, I've been deliberately quiet as I don't want to be flooding yere inboxes. Has been a while though, so wanted to let ye know how everything is shaping up

Well, as you probably know, the campaign ended yesterday, having passed the Portfolio Pod stretch goal. I'm happy to report that all the lovely work by these great artists will be printed and sent along to many of the backers. I'm going to reveal the final Portfolio Pod piece next week, as it's a bit of a spoiler and I want you all to have time to read TIME BEFORE TIME #1.

The Process Edition Kickstarter end in a few hours.
Hi all, just an update before the campaign ends. Sasha Head has handed in the first draft of the book with all the elements designed and it looks stunning. Note; these colour elements will be in the Collector Edition only, the regular Process Edition will be all black and white.

updates.update_content: ONE WEEK LEFT in the campaign, and a new artist reveal for the Portfolio Pod... a wonderful piece by Eoin Marron!

Forbes just posted a piece about TIME BEFORE TIME, including some behind the scenes work by Joe Palmer, work that will be included in the TIME BEFORE TIME Process Edition, so it's worth a look at what ye're all in store for :)

More importantly though, I'm sad to say news broke last night that beloved artist John Paul Leon has passed away. I know a lot of the team were fans of his, especially myself, which is why I was so happy to when he agreed to draw the B cover for TIME BEFORE TIME. It's very surreal to know it's going to be printed just a few days after his death.

campaign.story:
Astor and friends hand-made eco-adventure! (Animated gif)
Discover a colorful sandbox open-world where you can farm wondrous plants, craft tools and shelter, harness the elements, and shape the land around you.

Play your own way - be clever, be creative or even be mischievous. Befriend strange beasts, dodge dangerous surprises, gather resources, and explore unique biomes to uncover the Secret of the TerraBeast.
Astor gifts a Mighty Beast their favorite treat.
You play as an Astor, a special OddFauna, whose biological imperative is to seek out TerraSeeds. You will have to form a symbiotic bond with your living world, your TerraBeast to discover the TerraSeed's location. Will you seek out the TerraSeed? That is up to you. 
The world is filled with OddFauna for you to meet.  Chat with them and get to know them. Give them their favorite treats to show you care. Earn their trust and you will receive items, recipes, or maybe even a new party member. Befriending a beast boosts your abilities and making a true friend will grant you a wearable pin which unlocks a new ability.
Many Beasts are friendly... if you know how to interact with them. Entice them with a special treat, help them to build a shelter, or even ask them to join you on an adventure!
Beware the beasts that come out at night! And watch out for the ones that may hide in bushes.


Tiny and gentle, the Sproutling help tend to the Terrabeast and are vital to a thriving ecosystem.
Transform your TerraBeast into your own adventure paradise. Your Terraform ability allows you to sculpt the ground like clay. Shape the landscape to fit your adventuring needs; create rivers and lakes to play in, raise mountains to gain a better view or create fields to farm your favorite treats. 
Sculpt the Landscape like Clay!
Go even further and alter the temperature, soil quality, and water level of biomes. Create a frozen desert, flooded forest, or arid grasslands.

Your choices have an impact on the other OddFauna. Ovoks love forests, Logurs need lots of water, and Trico's love it hot! Create a new habitat and new OddFauna will migrate and create a cozy home for themselves. 
Your growing ability allows you to craft astounding plants.  You have control over how they are shaped which grants you the freedom to use them for shelter, food, infrastructure, or just their beauty. 
Each crop has a season in which it can be grown. You will need a crop strategy to ensure that you have enough food and resources for the whole year. Being prepared for the start of the growing season will give you a head start on exploring!

Create your own unique flora by combining different seeds. Cross-pollinate to yield more fruit, improve quality, or to change the color of your plants.
Handfuls of berries, huge delicious fruit, yummy earth roots, and many more!
Gather and grow resources and craft them into handy items for your adventures.  Craft tools, sandbox toys, shelters, and accessories to adorn yourself.
Building a shelter not only replenishes your energy, but it also protects you from the creatures that lurk in the dark.
Everything in the world abides by the rules of nature. You can interact with everything you see in the world. Burn with fire or replenish with water, it is your choice. Experiment with different combinations of elements to make new discoveries.
Burn with fire & freeze with ice
Every action you take has an impact on the world. It is up to you to decide how to treat your world. You may choose to go on a fire-wielding rampage and burn down entire biomes. If you want to remedy your actions, you'll have to get your paws dirty and plant a new forest.

Allowing your TerraBeast to become unhealthy will present some tough challenges. Blight will begin to appear, spread, and destroy everything it touches. As weather events intensify, you’ll face lightning super storms, raging wildfires, and choking sandstorms, just to name a few!
A healthy TerraBeast will grow larger each season. This unlocks new areas for you to explore. New OddFauna, biomes, and crops will become available as the world grows larger. The outer rings of a fully mature TerraBeast have been known to be home to Legendary Beasts.
Astor, Trico & Mo are off to explore a newly grown forest.
Your home, a giant majestic TerraBeast
Your world is a massive living beast, called a TerraBeast. They have a very long lifespan. It's rumored they can live for millennia. Their backs are covered with a thick coat of organic material. It's a fertile land, an ideal place for life to take root. It's common for TerraBeast's organic carapace to form blight and attract unhealthy creatures. They rely upon Astors to help keep them healthy. It is unknown how TerraBeasts spawn-- it's believed that Astors may play a role.

The world of the Terrabeast is procedurally generated and will be different each time you begin a new adventure. As the world grows, your actions help to shape it. If you maintain a healthy TerraBeast, the new biomes that grow will be fertile and healthy. Do you want to create more forests? Plant lots of trees and new biomes will be forests too.

The world is divided into different biome types, Grasslands, Forest, Mountains, Desert, and many more! Each Biome attracts different OddFauna and has specific needs to remain healthy. 
OddFauna thrive in their favorite biomes.


Game Development Plan
The game is currently in Pre-Alpha and being developed for PC and will be released on Steam as an Early Access Game. (Wishlist Today!) Early Access will allow us to get it into player hands, get their feedback and have the time to use that feedback to shape the game. We are looking to our community of players to help us make the game as awesome as it can be. 

We are making Alpha & Beta Access available as reward tiers. If you want to get your paws on the game as early as possible back at those levels! Alpha and Beta members have access to special discord servers that we will be reaching out to for feedback. Alpha and Beta backers will be able to vote on certain game decisions and help steer the development of the game.

If the Kickstarter gets funded, it will allow us to port the game to the Nintendo Switch! We will be able to buy Switch dev kits and ensure the game will perform amazingly on the console. I am incredibly excited at the prospect of developing for my favorite console. It will be a lot of work, but with your support, we will make it happen. OddFauna promises to be amazing on Switch! The Switch version of the game is available as an add-on item and with an estimated delivery date of Q1 2023.
We are a husband and wife team. Emma is the Creative mastermind behind OddFauna. She has been creating the cast of characters for years now. A few years ago we started talking more and more about how great a video game would be in her world. Last year, Cliff quit his AAA game development job to make it a reality! We finally are able to expand this awesome universe, and it is such a privilege to get to partner together on this creative journey.
Our little family
Everything in the game is hand-sculpted by Emma. This gives the world a very unique style. They are then hand-painted by Emma and handed off to Cliff. Cliff Photoscans them cleans up the models. The animation style and the hand-crafted nature of the models gives the world a stop-motion type of feel, which we love.
Check out our updates for more on our process!!!
How a character gets created.
We've been developing OddFauna: Secret of the TerraBeast full-time now for a year, self-funding the project entirely with our life savings. For 2 people we have come a long way in a short amount of time. We are approximately 50% of the way through development. While we've made a lot of progress, there is still a lot of work to do. In order to continue to work and retain creative control, we need to ask for your help. We’re also hoping to build a community of passionate backers who want to be involved with the process of development. With your help, we believe we can build the best version of OddFauna: Secret of the TerraBeast that we possibly can!

"OddFauna is such a unique and beautifully handcrafted game, made by an indie developer who actively engages with their audience!" - Tiny Tay (Discord)
The vast majority of our budget goes directly into making the gameplay amazing, the visuals beautiful, and the sound gorgeous. We will expand to get assistance with the music and audio and be able to hire help for community management, QA, and marketing.

OddFauna: Secret of the TerraBeast is a true passion project of ours, and we've made a lot of financial sacrifices to get this far. We'll finish the game at a smaller scale even if this Kickstarter isn't funded, but the game will be bigger and better if we meet our fundraising goals!

Exclusive TerraBeast Hard Enamel Pin
A limited edition colorway exclusive to the Kickstarter. This hefty little friend measures 2" wide in hard enamel with shiny gold metal. We’re working with Alchemy Pins, whose products are beautifully made, with a very high attention to detail.

Exclusive TerraBeast Bandana
22" 100% cotton bandana with Emma's original TerraBeast design. Ice dyed and screen printed right here in Seattle by Ink Knife Press. Because of the nature of the dye, each one will be unique, making them extra special!


Exclusive "Ride" Collector Statue.
Designed by Emma, produced by Level 52 Studios. This limited edition high end collectible is a Kickstarter Exclusive.  3D scanned from Emma’s original sculptures, these statues will measure 8" and will be cast in Polystone. Packaged in a collectors box, they will come numbered and signed, with a certificate of authenticity.

Surprise Creature Painting!
These are original creature concept painting by Emma. Each piece measures 5x7 (or larger) and is painted in watercolor and ink on hot press cotton rag archival paper. Each piece will come signed with the name of the creature on the back. There are only 30 different character paintings up for grabs and they will be shipped out blind box style. Which one will you get?
"Flying Friends" Original Concept Art Painting by Emma SanCartier
12x17 : Signed, Watercolor & Ink on hot press cotton rag archival paper. 
Flying Friends

"Adventuring Friends" Original Concept Art Painting by Emma SanCartier
12x16 : Signed. Watercolor & Ink on hot press cotton rag archival paper. 
Adventuring Friends

 "Together" Original Concept Art Painting by Emma SanCartier
12x17 : Signed. Watercolor & Ink on hot press cotton rag archival paper.
Together
"Astor and TerraBeast" Original Concept Art Painting by Emma SanCartier
12x17 : Signed. Watercolor & Ink on hot press cotton rag archival paper.
Astor and TerraBeast

Custom Legendary Beast Sculpture
Do you want an absolutely original OddFauna sculpture? Choose a few key features of the beast of your dreams, and Emma will do the rest. She will take your idea and turn it into a beautiful (or terrifying) art sculpture that will be the envy of all your beast loving friends! Sculpture can measure up to 11" and can have the same level of detail and complexity as the Kelpie and Hoarfrost Beast seen here.
Legendary Beasts - Kelpie and Hoarfrost Beast

Our Environmental Commitment
As we grow, we plan on donating and partnering with different organizations that are working towards rebuilding healthy ecosystems. Our first step is partnering with Eden Reforestation Projects. They hire local communities to plant a variety of native tree species in deforested areas. We will plant 1 tree per copy of the game sold.


Video BG Music : "5 minutes pleasure" by Hiroki Kikuta. Licensed under CC 4.0
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are an experienced team, and we understand many of the risks we face. Here are our plans to deal with these risks.

Financial risk: We are confident that this amount of funding will allow us to deliver a solid game that meets our goals. We have put a great deal of our own funds into the development so far. It was important to us to put our own money into the project first and get the game to a solid place before reaching out for support. We will continue to fund the game if the Kickstarter is not successful, but it will not be as big and polished as we are hoping.

Schedule risk: Our timeline is short, especially with only two of us working on the game. We have been meticulous about keeping the game in scope. To make sure we hit our goal, we have a roadmap that extends beyond shipping. A successful Kickstarter will allow us to hire experts to help in areas like music, community management, etc. This will allow us to focus on what we do best: making the game.

Gameplay : With just two people it can be challenging to make any game. Proper scope, experience, and passion is the key. With your support we will make OddFauna: Secret of the TerraBeast an amazing experience. We are very excited to continue this adventure with you!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
All of the products that we will be offering as rewards will be manufactured at the highest quality. All of the higher reward tiers will be very limited and hand crafted by Emma SanCartier.
Sustainable materials
Our packaging consists of low-impact, recyclable materials.
Something else
We are partnering with the Eden Reforestation Projects and planting a tree for every copy of the game sold.
 
Additionally, we've decided to limit the physical rewards to just a few items and keep the focus on the game itself which will be available as a digital download.

updates.update_userinfo: Thank you for supporting us! Here’s What’s Next for Oddfauna 🤗
updates.update_content:
Dearest OddFauna Supporters,

Thank you so much!!!

This has been a truly awesome experience! 

Honestly, we really did not know what to expect with this Kickstarter. We didn’t want to get our hopes too high.

But then we smashed our initial funding goal in the first few hours of the first day! We almost doubled it by the end of that first day!

We’ve been overwhelmed by the love and enthusiasm for our game! We’re beyond grateful.

Maybe now you’re wondering: what happens next? We are going to take a week for some R&R. Then you will receive an update with important information about the next steps for the project. At that time a BackerKit shop will be available for everyone to upgrade or purchase any of the add-ons. Remaining physical rewards will be available to everyone, regardless of tier. Emma and I will be jumping back into full-time game development mode. For our OddFauna fans, there’s more that you can do to stay involved and up to date on the game.

Get involved on our social channels, and our We’ll be sharing lots of information and fun insights on our discord as the game develops.

Thank you for being part of our OddFauna party!

campaign.story:
The sky is darker, the tea is colder, and the worst is still to come…
This campaign includes these three gloomy goodies:
 Gloomier: A Night at Hemlock Hall standalone card game
 Gloom Grief Case deluxe storage box
 The Gloom Chronicles campaign-style mini-expansion
Misery and mysteries abound at Hemlock Hall, the imposing estate of Lord Wellington-Smythe and his eccentric family of misfits. When you’re invited inside for an evening’s entertainment, what could possibly go wrong? Will you Cuddle with Cats or Thwart a Thief? Will you Brawl Over Brandy or Fall Prey to the Plague? At Hemlock Hall, awful amusements become deadly diversions with the flip of a card.
Gloomier: A Night at Hemlock Hall is a darkly humorous stand-alone competitive storytelling card game for two to five players. To win, you make your characters suffer the greatest tragedies possible before passing on to the well-deserved respite of death.  The player with the most negative score wins. And in Gloomier, the winner gets the final word: Who was the murderer? How did the heist end? You decide!
Gloomier features transparent plastic cards, allowing a character’s score — and story — to evolve as cards are stacked on top of each other. You don’t need prior experience to play Gloomier, but Gloom fans will find that A Night at Hemlock Hall expands the storytelling aspect of Gloom with new, specially-designed story prompts. And this full stand-alone game includes 6 new Stories and 14 new Guests that can be used with any edition of Gloom. So dare to enter Hemlock Hall, and see what delightful disaster awaits!

Like all Gloom games, Gloomier: A Night at Hemlock Hall is a storytelling game. Stack transparent cards to boost your score and make your characters’ tales the most tragic — while blighting opponents with good fortune. Then, tell the story of these miserable misanthropes.
When you play an Untimely Death card on a character, they die and their negative score is locked in, but the story continues until all of one player’s characters have perished. Then, all players tally their scores.The player whose characters had the most tragic lives (and the most negative score) is the winner.
Points are important, but the best part of Gloomier: A Night at Hemlock Hall is building increasingly sad, and increasingly silly stories with your fellow players. If you like Nightmare Before Christmas, The Addams Family, or A Series of Unfortunate Events, we think you’ll enjoy the absurd dark humor of Gloomier.

Gloomier: A Night at Hemlock Hall contains:
 110 transparent plastic cards (including 14 new Guests, 6 Story cards, a new cast of Characters, and a variety of new Modifier, Event, and Untimely Death cards to bolster your tragic tales)
A 12-page, color, totally redesigned rulebook 
An attractive tuckbox 
It’s a standalone expansion, which means you can play it by itself or combine it with any other Gloom games.

Gloom fans have been asking for it for years, and it’s finally here … a box big enough for all your Gloom games!
The luxurious Grief Case is large enough to hold every Gloom game produced thus far — that’s roughly 1500 Gloom cards — plus all your rules and extras, and your darkest secrets. (It’s even got room to accommodate another four full Gloom games or eight expansions, for when you add future Gloom games to your collection.)
This case is extremely sturdy! 4mm thick laminated chipboard will make this the strongest game box in your collection, sure to hold up to a lifetime of use. Or, of course, 'til Untimely Death.
 Soft Touch finish adds a luxurious velvety-soft texture for instant tactile appeal and resistance to fingerprint marks. It also makes sliding the lid off the box both quick and satisfying.
 Spot gloss and red metallic foil add texture and shine to highlight design elements.
This deluxe box comes with its own thick acrylic dividers, so you can sort and cross-reference your games and cards in whatever way makes the most sense to you.
And more! Follow our backer updates for behind-the-scenes looks while we finalize production.
design subject to change
And don’t worry, if you’re missing a few Gloom games, we’ve made them all available as add-ons for this campaign so you can easily complete your collection!


Lots of Kickstarter campaigns (including several of ours!) have lots of different stretch goals to unlock. For this Kickstarter, we’re focusing on just one big one: The Gloom Chronicles. Chronicles is an expansion for the Gloom series, turning Gloom into a serialized, campaign-style game. It is included with all pledge levels, and has been improved through stretch goals to be the best The Gloom Chronicles it can be!
In Gloom, you and your friends weave tales of woe. But where does the story begin? Each card in The Gloom Chronicles expansion starts a new chapter for an ongoing game of Gloom, ties those games together as a serialized campaign, and adds variant rules, bringing new challenges to the story. You can choose a card at random, or you can start from the beginning and explore the ongoing chronicle of your family through an extended campaign. Your story begins with the Unhappy Birthday … but will your next game of Gloom involve a Tragic Train Ride, or will you end up at the infamous World’s Unfair?
The Gloom Chronicles is an expansion that can enhance any game of Gloom. You can use it with just one Gloom game, or let it navigate you through all the expansions. Narrative prompts give players a unified foundation for their stories, while variant rules challenge new and experienced players alike. The Unhappy Birthday awaits! What ignominious ending will your Gloom Chronicle have?

All pledge levels receive a discount on the entire Gloom line of products to complete your collection.
 The stretch goals for this campaign improved and expanded The Gloom Chronicles to its best version! Thank you for your support!
SINGLE ADD-ONS: This campaign’s Add-Ons page in checkout will let you pick up the game or two you missed, hassle free. They’re in stock and will ship very soon after the close of the campaign, before the main campaign rewards.
COMBINED SHIPPING: If you’re ordering more add-ons, visit our web store for savings on combined shipping. Just use the backer-only code posted in Update #2 when you check out. Products ordered via our web store ship immediately!

Gloom cards are plastic, and very durable, for a lifetime of play.

campaign.story:
Presenting the sixth book in our ART OF DER ORCHIDEENGARTEN series!
DER ORCHIDEENGARTEN: PERILOUS GARDEN
Prior to COVID-19 and HIV/AIDS, the last pandemic the world experienced was the devastating influenza of 1918-1920. Germany was already decimated by the First World War, and the Spanish Flu ravaged the country from border to border. It was during these unsettling years that the world's first horror-fantasy magazine was published.
Published in Munich from 1919-1921, DER ORCHIDEENGARTEN was a predecessor to the American pulp Weird Tales, and is considered the first horror-fantasy-science fiction periodical. The series collected macabre and mysterious tales from the finest European literary minds, from well-known names like H. G. Wells to now-obscure titans like Hanns Heinz Ewers. Many of the stories have been collected and translated over the years, so in this series of books we focus on the artworks, nearly all of which have remained unpublished for a century.

Grotesque medieval etchings representing the human relationship with death, strange occult woodblocks that consider what lies just beyond the veil of human understanding, and sinister Expressionist visions as tangible manifestations of anxiety.

From our current perspective of global uncertainty and the looming presence of a deadly, devastating virus, the artworks and stories of DER ORCHIDEENGARTEN -created in the same climate, a century ago– are uncannily resonant today.
Founded four years before the iconic American magazine Weird Tales launched in March 1923, Der Orchideengarten was published immediately after the First World War, when German art was at its height of decadence and debauchery. The magazine included copious illustrations of themes ranging from suspense and terror to crime and the eerily-erotic. The stories were written by the European counterparts of H. P. Lovecraft and Arthur Machen, and the artworks were by artists both well-known and painfully obscure: Heinrich Kley, for example, was Disney's inspiration for Night on Bald Mountain in his film Fantasia, and is one of the artists well-represented in the magazine. The stories have been reprinted and translated over the past century, but the artworks remain undiscovered treasures– until now.
Rewards: The Book 
PERILOUS GARDEN: The Art of Der Orchideengarten Vol. 6 is the sixth book in our 'Art of Der Orchideengarten' series, and the third of three volumes completely documenting the magnificent and macabre artworks from the year 1920 of Der Orchideengarten magazine, the legendary German supernatural horror periodical published from January 1919 until November 1921.
PERILOUS GARDEN: The Art of Der Orchideengarten Vol. 6
Paperback, 5.5" x 8.5"
80 pages
60+ illustrations
contains every artwork from issues 16-24, published in the year 1920
The magazines were printed with letterpress debossing, creating rich, dense text and images; we are capturing the artworks in ultra-high, crisp resolution for maximum detail.
Postcard Set
Set of ten 5" x 7" postcards featuring five ghastly images from PERILOUS GARDEN (two copies of each image pictured).
T-shirt
Super soft discharge print on high quality, vintage feel 100% cotton t-shirt available in sizes S-4XL (size selected in project survey). Add the t-shirt on to any pledge level for $27! 
Perfume from Black Phoenix Alchemy Lab
Our beloved friends at Black Phoenix Alchemy Lab have created a limited edition perfume inspired by the book!
PERILOUS GARDEN- A gloriously oleaginous orange perfume, slavering with bloated droplets of glowing white musk, oozing with tart neroli, blood orange rind, tuberose, and speckled with hairy little spikes of black pepper.

Full-size 5mL perfume oil in amber vial.

Perilous Garden Pin 
A 1.75" nickel pin with black rubber double-clutch

 Custom folios featuring handmade marbled paper created by Brazilian artist Renato Crepaldi, specifically designed for our Art of Der Orchideengarten series.
An extremely limited edition of 25 print folios were created for each volume (five for the complete volume sets and twenty for individual sale).
Add ons
If you missed the first five books in this series, which document the complete artworks of Der Orchideengarten magazine from the year 1919 and 1920, there are special pledge levels for you to get ALL SIX volumes - Perilous Garden, Malevolent Visions, Withering Heights, Eldritch Bloom, Sinister Harvest, and Diabolical Fantasia!

If you need to fill in specific gaps in your series collection, the PERILOUS GARDEN t-shirt and all of the books, pins, and postcard sets from Vol. 1-6 will be available as add-ons in the project survey. If you would rather increase your pledge amount now to cover the add-on items you want, please look at your total amount (initial pledge + shipping) and add $27 per t-shirt/$25 per book/$10 per postcard set/$10 per pin/$35 per Patronage Print to cover the additional items you want - then just send us a message telling us which specific items you want to receive!

 ABOUT US 
For over 20 years, Century Guild has been devoted to building and presenting an archive of important artworks that define the origins of popular culture. We've prepared the materials, and by pre-ordering a copy of the book and spreading the word, you can help us make a documentation of this very rare and very obscure magazine come to life. Der Orchideengarten gets mentioned frequently in books, at fantasy conventions, and at certain full-moon cauldron gatherings–but the same low-resolution images get shared over and over again. This book is an opportunity to explore the artworks in depth, with synopses and snippets of the stories, and high resolution scans made from a pristine collection. We love tactile experiences, and in a hyper-stimulating digital era there is nothing more meditative than thoughtfully turning the pages of a well-crafted book. With your help, we can perpetuate this romantic educational experience.
Founded in 1999 by Thomas Negovan, Century Guild has presented Art Nouveau and Symbolist Art in both their Chicago (1999-2013) and Los Angeles (2012-2018) galleries, as well as in numerous international art and antiques fairs across the last two decades- including fourteen years as a major presence at San Diego Comic Con International. Works previously in the Century Guild collection are on permanent display in a number of important institutions, including The Art Institute of Chicago, The Metropolitan Museum of Art, and The Detroit Institute of Art and have been exhibited at The Los Angeles County Museum of Art, The Minneapolis Museum of Art, and The Art Gallery of Ontario. The limited edition books published by Century Guild are desirable for their academic content, fine quality, and collectability; many out-of-print volumes command high prices on the secondary market.

Thank you for your support of our mission to document and preserve rare, obscure, and historically important artworks!
