 "This might be the best use of public domain I've seen in a video game" - Frank Cifaldi, Founder, GameHistory.org
"If you're a fan of the NES game, there'll be something here for you!" ~ Pat Contri ("Pat the NES Punk") on the Completely Unnecessary Podcast 
"If you were a big fan of Cuphead’s revival of the Fleischer brothers’  animation style, this might be a good one to check out and support." - Ian Boudreau, PCGamesN 
"The whole game looks to be a dream come true to fans of the little dreamer, and really nails the hand-drawn aesthetics of the comic." - Bryan Taylor, Big Boss Battle 
"Absolutely gorgeous drawn artwork"  - Kurt Kalata, Hardcore Gaming 101 
"Little Nemo and the Nightmare Fiends is something totally new. And from the look of it, it could be something special." - Jason Micciche,  Brutal Gamer 
Little Nemo and the Nightmare Fiends is a 2D non-linear platformer with 4 playable characters that players can freely switch between. Each character's unique powers help players explore a huge cartoon world and can be chained for wild amounts of mobility! The game features artwork inspired by the groundbreaking 1905 Little Nemo in Slumberland comic, hand-drawn keyframed animation, and a huge cast of surreal creatures and characters!
Nightmare Fiends is a game I’ve wanted to make for years after seeing the original artwork of Winsor McCay (c. 1866-71 - July 26, 1934), the creator of Little Nemo and a pioneering comics artist and animator. McCay’s world is a sprawling surreal landscape of creepy mushroom forests, glittering ice caverns, and majestic architectural wonders with tons of weird and memorable characters. The comic goes beyond a simple fantasy, featuring an intricately drafted world and innovative panel layouts; it’s beautiful, evocative, weird, and at times hugely meta. McCay himself was a massive influence on the likes of Walt Disney, Carl Barks, Art Spiegelman, and Maurice Sendak (among many others). While previous video game takes on Little Nemo exist, our goal is to create an explorable world from McCay’s original (now public domain) vision, using animation techniques that McCay himself laid the groundwork for while updating Slumberland for modern audiences.
The game plays like Shantae or Demon’s Crest with a splash of Little Samson. From Nemo's bedroom, players enter the dream world;  forests, palaces, the night sky, ice caves, and a twisted funhouse  await. Using  character's unique powers, players uncover each dream's secrets to grow in power and defeat the Nightmare Fiends once and for all.
Features
Take control of 4 characters on your trip through Slumberland! The brave Nemo, the magic-wielding Princess, the mischievous clown Flip, and the agile royal guard Peony - an original character created for this game!
Each character has unique ways to attack and explore. Players can switch between them quickly to create powerful combos and find hidden areas!
Wake Nemo up and explore his house, featuring rooms with hidden items, artifacts to make your characters stronger, and production artwork!
Explore surreal environments based on episodes from the original Little Nemo comic.
Features gorgeous hand-drawn animations as a tribute to animation and comics pioneer Winsor McCay
We are coming to Kickstarter to ask for your help funding production on the game. If we reach our goal, we will be able to bring you an exciting, inventive, beautifully hand-animated platforming game made by experienced industry designers. Going beyond our goal, though, will help make this tribute to Winsor McCay and Little Nemo the stuff of dreams! 
A major feature of the game is the extensive hand-drawn animation, done in Blender 2.9’s 2D Animation toolset. Each character requires DOZENS of hand-drawn frames. First, we sketch out each character's key poses on paper or within Blender, then draw the frames in-between in rough form to refine movements (also known as "pose to pose"). We put these rough frames onto the in-game characters to make sure that they  work during gameplay, at which point we apply ink and paint.
We make thumbnails and rough sketches to plan out our characters' motion, poses, and timing, then finish them off with clean ink and paint.
Bosco the Dragon animation (with test background)
Winsor McCay is considered by animators and historians alike to be one of the most important figures in American animation, having made groundbreaking films like Gertie the Dinosaur and The Sinking of the Lusitania. As such, we're doing our best to incorporate ideas he created (he invented what eventually became "pose to pose" animation) into our own animation. We're also playing a little bit of "what if?" by  incorporating ideas that came after McCay, such as Disney's 12 Principles of Animation or smear frames, to his characters. For some of these characters, we're the first to animate them since McCay himself.
Players switch between 4 main characters - Nemo, Peony, The Princess, and Flip - each with different abilities for attacking and navigating levels. 
Nemo glides through the air by harnessing Slumberland’s magic. This lets him cross long gaps and slow his fall. He attacks with a wooden sword attack that lets him hop off enemies in the air.
  Peony can climb walls, reaching high-up areas that other characters can’t. She attacks by placing bombs around her that explode in colorful firework displays.
Flip grapples and swings with his spring-loaded boxing gloves. He also uses these gloves for powerful attacks.
The Princess hovers straight through the air with her magic. She can also attack by charging up magical blasts.
Large, non-linear levels with multiple goals in each encourage exploration and require players to use all 4 characters to uncover all of Slumberland's secrets. When not dreaming, Nemo's house is the hub of  the game world. While awake, Nemo can explore his house to power up or find items that will help him reach new areas in Slumberland. When players are ready for another adventure, Nemo goes to bed and can select which world to dream about.
 Nemo's House - When Nemo is awake, he can explore the different rooms in his house to find  hidden items that might evoke dreams of the game's various levels. Exploring the different levels of the game will help Nemo find keys to the house's different rooms.
 The Night Sky - The first step of Nemo's journey. This level features wind-sneezing clouds, airships, and an angry moon!
 The Mushroom Forest - The wild forests that stand outside of Slumberland's gates. Nemo and friends encounter woodland giants, trees to climb, and kid-eating clowns.
 Slumberland - Slumberland is home to Morpheus's palaces, gardens, and parade grounds. Nemo and friends explore Morpheus's halls while fighting back the Fiends' attack.
 The Ice Palace - Jack Frost's Ice Palace features dazzling crystalline structures, blizzard machines, and snowball-throwing creatures. No slippery surfaces here!
If we reach specific stretch goal levels, we will be able to add these areas to the game: 
 The Fiends' Realm - Nemo and friends take the fight to the Fiends' door. Face down the nightmare creatures in their brutalist home turf.
 Befuddle Hall - A  labyrinth of surreal architecture and optical illusions! This dimensional nexus is where Slumberland is at its trippiest (and most meta!)
 Doctor Pill is Slumberland’s premiere physician. Nemo and his friends buy supplies from his traveling cart.
 Mysto is one of Slumberland’s best wizards. She will build platforms to summon the Dragon Trolley so players can travel quickly around the dream worlds!
 Bosco is a magical dragon and Slumberland’s fastest Dragon Trolley! Nemo is initially put off by the chair in his mouth…
 Mister Bunion is a wanderer who just wants to rid himself of his everyday worries, which he cares around in a briefcase labeled "Dull Care", so he tries to leave it behind in levels. What happens if you return it to him? 
 King Morpheus is the ruler of Slumberland and the Princess’s father. The Nightmare Fiends seem particularly focused on him…
 The Moon – Usually a passive observer, this sentinel of the Night Sky has been made aggressive by the Nightmare Fiends.
 The Pie Eaters – These vicious clowns already made travel through the Mushroom Forest a hassle, but the Nightmare’s power has made them even more monstrous.
 Phobetor – One of the Nightmare Fiends. He is a master of bad dreams and attacks Nemo and his friends with illusions. 
 Thanatos – Brother of Phobetor and a Nightmare Fiend. Attacks with brute strength. 
 Nyx – Queen of the Nightmare Fiends and ruler of the night. She attacks with magic and darkness. 
With more to be revealed in the stretch goals! 
We've made an original Little Nemo in Slumberland comic just for you! Help us unlock all of the panels by backing the campaign and telling your friends so we can reach all of our stretch goals (expanded descriptions of the stretch goals below the graphic.)
$70,000 - Initial Funding Goal
$75,000 - Nemo's Kitchen: Raid the pantry in Nemo's House for stat bonuses that kick in when you go to Slumberland.
$80,000 - In-game museum: We'll add a section featuring concept art and the original comics that inspired the game.
$90,000 - Expanded maps: We'll be able to build even bigger maps for more exploration! 
$100,000 - Flying bed world map: Select your level by flying among the clouds!
$110,000 - Upgradable characters: Nemo and friends will have upgradable abilities!
$125,000 - Add a developer: Extra features and polish!
$150,000 - New levels: Befuddle Hall and The Fiend's Realm will be added. 
$160,000 - Additional recipes for the kitchen: Adds additional recipes for even more stat changes. Great for extra challenges and speed runs! 
$175,000 - Added Bosses: The Nightmare Fiends will bring their full gang! 
$200,000 - Add a narrative designer: Expanded Story with alternate ending!
$225,000 - Fully realized soundtrack with more music tracks
$250,000 - Expanded art style: More artists and animators will help polish the art! 
$300,000 - Expanded animated intro: Start the game in style!
$350,000 - Console development kits: We'll be able to bring the game to additional consoles!
$700,000 - ???: What could this be? Help us reach it to find out! 
The game is in the prototype phase and planned to be released for PC, Mac, and Nintendo Switch. We are exploring partnerships to help us bring it to other platforms and potential physical releases. 
Development screenshot of Ben testing out Flip's swinging physics
The technical side is being done by Benjamin Cole of PXLPLZ, who released the games Star Saver and Robo Puzzle Smash after spending years in AAA project management and development. Ben has done a great job laying down the foundational systems for the game around which we can create content. Independent designer Adrian Sandoval has also been working hard on designing the mechanics for the game, how character states affect one  another, and prototyping them in the game’s environment.
We've used lots of tools from our toolbox to build the game's art. Blender 2.9's 2D animation tools have been indispensable for this process.
Asset generation is a huge task. It’s being handled primarily by me (Chris Totten of Pie for Breakfast Studios) in Blender 2.9’s 2D Animation toolset with some assistance on concept art and animation from interns from Kent State University’s Animation Game Design program. Each character requires dozens of hand-drawn frames. A ton has already been done, but we still need to do more enemies, additional main character and NPC animations, and the major bosses. Each level also requires tons of drawn environment art tiles and sprites so that we have lots to work with in the level design phase.
If we reach the $125,000 stretch goal, we can hire an additional developer to help further develop mechanics and elements of  the game.
If we reach $200,000 we can hire a professional writer to help us enrich the game’s story.
If we reach $250,000 stretch goal, we can hire another animator to assist with fleshing out the game’s visual identity.
We are planning for a potential release date of late 2022, but are also exploring various Early Access release options so folks can have access to a version of the game sooner and we can collect player feedback. A more solid schedule will be released for backers as the campaign progresses.
A game and world of this scope will need the help of a community. Reaching our vision and doing justice to Winsor McCay’s artistic legacy will require resources, focus, and time. The initial goal will  help us put together a fun, lighthearted action game with lots of fun references to beloved versions of Slumberland. Higher stretch goals will allow us to bring our full vision to life. This will include things like:
 Paying outside help – compensating other industry professionals for working on our passion project is a high priority for us. Working with other developers and artists, while also having access to talented writers as well as sound and musical talent will help create a better game.
 Improvements and quality assurance – we won’t be happy with a merely  functional game, we want to create a game that celebrates the artistic  contributions of Slumberland. To do that, we need to take community feedback and work with testers to iron out any bugs that can get in the way of your travels.
Our initial plan for the game is for a PC and Mac release via Steam. We are also able to bring the game to the Nintendo Switch, though the timeline for that is being evaluated to account for any additional porting development and testing required for that process. Our plan is to release for all current-generation consoles and will be actively seeking assistance in this regard. Please keep your eyes here for future updates!

Of course, none of this is possible without the inspiring work of Winsor McCay ("Silas") himself! The amount of research material we have is too much for a Kickstarter page, so we're sharing just a few sections of his original Little Nemo comics which have inspired us:
Panels from the July 26, 1908 Little Nemo in Slumberland strip, featuring the famous walking bed; considered by many to be the quintessential episode. This iconic scene has been recreated in comics, cartoons, and film.
The Dec. 3, 1905 Little Nemo in Slumberland strip where Nemo meets the Moon.
The August 5, 1906 comic featuring Bosco the dragon and his driver.
The February 25, 1906 Little Nemo in Slumberland comic, featuring the Pie Eaters.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is a huge creative endeavor and will continue to be. Many of the most difficult obstacles have been overcome (we went from “how are we going to hand animate all this?” to “how many hand-animated characters do you want?”) but there’s still lots of work left to do!

Here’s the thing: we’ve been here before. Among our team are incredibly experienced creators and game makers with combined decades of experience finishing and releasing dozens of games. Likewise, we have support networks in our online creative communities as well as our local professional game meetups and International Game Developers Association (IGDA) chapters. We also have the support of scholars and enthusiasts of the Little Nemo in Slumberland comics and other works by Winsor McCay, who have been enthusiastically letting us share our game in their communities. All in all, we are humbled and excited that so many have already put their confidence in us and want to continue to show we are worthy of that confidence.

A lot of folks have asked us about acquiring rights to Little Nemo in Slumberland. We are able to say with confidence that Winsor McCay’s original comics are in the public domain both based on our own research and consultation with experts. Since entering the public domain, multiple artists have created works based on Little Nemo, including reprints of the original comics and new comics series, but we are the among the first multimedia projects based on the IP. We are also taking great care to not violate trademarks for Nemo-related characters created post-McCay (such as those from the NES game or the 1989 anime film).

campaign.story:
Hellboy has appeared in countless graphic novels and comic books, prose novels and short story collections, acclaimed role playing games and video games, three live action films and two animated features, and has inspired toys and collectibles. Now it’s time for award-winning Hellboy creator Mike Mignola to get his turn in the spotlight in the all new documentary MIKE MIGNOLA: DRAWING MONSTERS, the definitive story of one of the most influential and important comic book creators of all time. 
MIKE MIGNOLA: DRAWING MONSTERS is a feature-length film that tells the story of how Mike Mignola came to create a world-renowned comic book universe.  The film includes never-before-seen interviews conducted with the legendary creator at his studio, drawing demonstrations, behind the scenes footage from workshops and comic book conventions, and interviews with some of the most influential people in entertainment. 
As one of the most successful independent comic book creators, Mignola has inspired generations of writers and artists. This film provides an in-depth look at his legacy, from the beginning of his career to his success with Hellboy. We are already well in to production and are here on Kickstarter asking for YOUR help to finish this film! 
"Mike Mignola has built a huge comic book universe around the character on par with what Stan Lee and Jack Kirby accomplished with Marvel Comics" - The AV Club
Featuring interviews with Mike Mignola, Neil Gaiman, Rebecca Sugar, Doug Jones, Victor LaValle, Guillermo del Toro, Vanessa Eichholz, Joe Quesada, Vita Ayala, Adam Savage, Tara McPherson, Prof. Ben Saunders, Mike Richardson, Tom Sniegoski, Katii O'Brien, Christopher Golden, Chris Roberson and more. Featuring interviews and art demos by Mike Mignola, Duncan Fegredo, Mike Oeming, Dave Stewart and Jason Shawn Alexander.
Rewards
  We want to make supporting this film a special experience for our backers, EVERY REWARD IN THIS CAMPAIGN IS EXCLUSIVE TO OUR BACKERS, except for the regular edition Blu-Ray!That's right, when we says Kickstarter Exclusive, we mean it! The only thing available to purchase after the campaign will be the Blu-Ray!

Why Back Now?
MIKE MIGNOLA: DRAWING MONSTERS is being directed and produced by Jim Demonakos (co-founder, Emerald City Comic Con and LightBox Expo) and Kevin Konrad Hanna (Director, Clockwork Girl). We love comics. We love Mignola. We are committed to making an in depth, top-shelf documentary film, and we already have over 80 hours of footage that we have shot over the last year and a half.
 Help Make The Documentary - This is the most important part - you! We need YOUR financial support to help finish this documentary by conducting additional interviews throughout the country, plus hiring a professional editor and sound designer to get the final film ready to release. By backing us now, we can use the funds you pledge to make this documentary about Mike Mignola that is truly something special.
 Exclusive Rewards - We have created all kinds of exclusives for this campaign, and except for the Blu-Ray of the film, everything else is a backer exclusive just for you! We wanted the rewards to be something special, so by backing, you'll get rewards not available at any other time!
 Join The Journey - Be the first to hear news and share your thoughts as you follow our process of creating the documentary through to its completion.
Ready join the journey? Please back now!
Timeline
Mike Mignola: Drawing Monsters  is already in production. Filming will continue and is scheduled to be done in the fall/winter of 2021, with the finished film debuting by spring of 2022! For reward fulfillment, we are working with the team at White Squirrel to make sure everything is professionally delivered to you.

campaign.story:
Mockup of how the final book will look
Mockup of A4 Hardback edition
Mockup of the special Colostle themed deck of cards - (final artwork will change)
Colostle, an impossibly massive castle, the interior of which is so large that mountains, valleys, towns, cities and even oceans fill its rooms, with the ceilings and roof so high they are beyond sight, shrouded by the misty expanse of the sky, that sits within it’s vaulted heights.
There seems to be no finding the exterior of the castle with many adventurers setting out with that as their goal. Instead, crossing continental distances, only to reach the wall of a ‘room’. Passing beyond will only bring yet another room on the other side of it, with new lands stretching off just as far again.
Although all manner of threats exist out in the wilds, such as strange animals and beasts, and other barbaric or dangerous people, the greatest dangers of all, are the Rooks. Huge, hulking stone automatons that patrol, somewhat mindlessly, out in the wilds of the Colostle’s rooms.
That is until they are disturbed. Every Rook is different, there are no two the same, and they are the only source of magic in the world. As such, they are something of a target to hunters looking for tech they can scavenge, artefacts they can sell or magic crystals to grant them strange and unpredictable powers.
That is if they can bring one down...
A 'room' stretching out before an Armed adventurer...
What is a solo RPG?
Think of it like a personal, mindful writing exercise, where the game provides you with prompts to write your own fascinating adventure in this strange world. You will be keeping a journal of your adventures, and the game system is a way to determine what you will encounter along the way, and to dictate the outcome of combat. All the book provides is prompts and inspirations, but it is up to you and your character to flesh out the details and to write about what you discover.
First you need to create a character, someone of this world. This book will guide you through this process, but it is completely up to you. Then the game provides you with an outline of your first adventure. You can decide how to interpret these prompts and what to write, there are no limits to what you can do, this is YOUR adventure.

What is in the book?
The Colostle book will be a 24 page A5 tome with all the rules required to create and play your own Colostle adventure. The book will have a thick 300gsm cover with foiled lettering, and the internal pages will be on off-white recycled paper for an otherworldly look and feel. The book will also feature black and white illustrations throughout suggesting glimpses of the world and the kind of characters you could create.
Design of the interior black and white pages (mockup)
How does the game work?
The basic principle is that of drawing cards from a shuffled deck of playing cards, and checking their colour, suit or number against tables to see what they represent for your adventure.
In the exploration phase of the game cards might stand for meeting another traveller on your journey, finding some abandoned ruins or discovering a mysterious doorway. its up to you to write in your journal what these things are and what they mean for your character. The game simply suggests things, like writing prompts, set against a fantastical world... its up to you what they all mean for your greater story. In the Combat phase, cards stand for attacks with the numbers on the cards showing their strength. Playing the right card at the right time could mean victory for your character!
As you play and write you will find ideas for what the mysteries of the Colostle might mean, just falling into your head. I don't provide the answers in the book, every player will discover their own truth and meaning of the world.
All you will need is a deck of playing cards, a pen, some rough paper for making gameplay notes and a journal to record your character's adventures in.
How to Play Colostle - Example of a typical Exploration and Combat phase in the game
3 Unique Character classes
To play Colostle you will need to create a character, and to that end there are 3 unique classes introduced in the book that will help you do that. They are; The Armed, The Followed and The Helmed. All of them use parts and pieces harvested from Rooks that give them special abilities. I don't want to give everything away, as it is only a small book (!) but you can see an Illustration of The Armed class below.
The Armed - wielders of harvested Rook arms
 Rewards + Stretch Goals Breakdown
 Cheaper Shipping Options
If you look in the rewards you will notice that some rewards have an identical twin with the added 'Cheaper Shipping' to their title. This is because I found a cheaper shipping cost later in the life of the campaign after these tiers had been already added. If you are a new backer, and you live outside the UK, please make sure you select the 'Cheaper Shipping' version of the tier you would like, to make sure you get the best deal on your shipping.
(These 'Cheaper Shipping' options only exist for the top 3 tiers, £20 or over. The lower tiers have accurate international shipping as they are, so you don't need to worry about those)
New artwork for the 'Oceans' module!
New artwork for the 'Battlements' module
Who am I?
My name is Nich Angell and I am a comic book artist, illustrator, writer and game designer. I am one quarter of the stories-and-games company Big Punch Studios, creators of comics such as 7STRING, Afterlife Inc., and Cat and Meringue and the super fun card game Sandwich Masters!
I have worked on a lot of comics and games, both from an illustrator perspective and a concept/creation one. More than anything I love creating worlds, whether thats a place to hear a story from, or a place to play a game in, making worlds is my thing! So when I found out about solo RPGs and played a few I realised what an awesome thing they were, a small tight rulebook for a brand new world.
As someone with a wild imagination I am always coming up with new ideas and Colostle is the latest setting that popped into my head. This time though, I was excited to create a more open ended world so that others can experience the joy I have creating stories, adventures and mysteries.

I have worked on many graphic novels and as such am extremely familiar with creating books and making artwork printready. I have run a great many Kickstarters both on my own and as part of Big Punch so I am highly confident in the process and know the extent of what is involved.

As with all of my Kickstarters and those I have been a part of, I believe communication is key. I know to update regularly and keep the backers informed even if unforeseen delays or problems occur.

With a small book and a small print run like this I don't foresee any issues. The kinds of things might be print delays, quality issues, and delivery but I have plans for all of these issues if and when they appear.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Reusability and recyclability
The book will not be packaged in any plastic shrinkwrap or film, and will be delivered in a fully recyclable cardboard book envelope. The book itself as it is all card and paper is fully recyclable too.
Sustainable materials
All the interior pages of this book are printed on recycled paper.
Environmentally friendly factories
The printers I have selected for this project put the environment first. They have reduced their use of solvents and other hazardous waste down to almost zero, reduced their setup waste to almost zero and recycle every offcut created during the manufacturing process.
Sustainable Distribution
The printer I use are UK based which means any UK orders will not involve costly international bulk shipping. Any international orders will be shipped via the most sustainable package delivery service I can find at the time of sending.

updates.update_content:
Roomlanders!
Sorry its been a bit quiet from me lately! This is only because everything is going so smoothly and I have nothing specific to report! That said, I do want to keep you all up to date with everything there is to know, so I thought I'd come on here with another state-of-play update.
First up, my house is full of boxes of these:

Roomlanders!
The game is out there in the world and the feedback has been amazing! Thank you for all your positivity, good vibes and enjoyment! And a few of you have posted some of your journals of your adventures and they are all without exception, EXCELLENT. I LOVE reading about what your characters are getting up to out there in the Roomlands and some of the ideas you guys are coming up with completely separate of my prompts are stunning. Really impressed. Thank you for really getting into this and making it such a fun community, you guys really are the best!
DISCORD

updates.update_content:
Roomlanders!
We're finally at the point where I can share the first Colostle rewards with you all! This is super nerve-wracking for me, but I'm also very excited. Its nerve-wracking because this thing started life as such a small project and thanks to all of you it has grown so much. It's my first venture into creating a solo RPG and I really hope it meets all of your expectations!
It represents my first step, and if you guys like it I have so many ideas for future settings, worlds and mechanics we can take this to, so this is something of a very exciting first step!

updates.update_userinfo: CHARGING CARDS and DIGITAL COPIES and BREAD ROLES!
updates.update_content:
Hey Roomlanders,
Hope you are all doing well. Sorry its been a little while since my last update, I've been going through some sad family stuff these last couple of weeks and it's distracted me a little, but I'm back and i'm focused on getting Colostle out to you as soon as possible.
Production has started on all elements but due to a very busy schedule for my Hardback printer/binder, the hardbacks won't be delivered to me until the week commencing 5th of July. Unfortunately this means everything else will be delayed by that date, as I have to send everything all together to the fulfilment company. This means the earliest you guys will probably be receiving your rewards is late July.

Roomlanders!
I am very close now to hitting the final button on the final artwork for the books and sending them off to print! Just got some hefty proof-reading and rules-reading and spell-checking left to do and then we're good. Who knew a book like this would need so many semi-colons and I would miss them all!
The cards and journals are already in production with their respective printers and the Hardback book is built, and boy howdy is it a good looking book! I'm very proud of it! They should be going over to printers today or tomorrow and then we'll be in production!

Hey Roomlanders!
Just a quick one from me to remind everyone that the Surveys and Pre-orders will lock tomorrow which means you will no longer be able to tweak your order and add or remove any add-ons you want. This also means if you still haven't yet completed your survey, you will not be able to add anything to your base pledge when you come to do it.
With some final work this weekend, all of the work on the game will be complete and I will be sending everything off to production! I will then let you know exactly when you can expect to receive the digital rewards!

Hey Roomlanders!
I am looking to lock surveys and pre-orders on the 30th of April, so that I can begin production on the various elements. This means:
1. If you have already completed your survey but are considering maybe adding another add-on or two, now is the time to do it. You won't be able to add anything to your pledge once the surveys are locked.

Hey Roomlanders,
Quick update from me just to let you know that work is progressing nicely. All the rules are now written, and laid out in the book layouts. This means that all that is left is all the illustrations to fill in all the various gaps in the book layouts and the cards! I have a master list for all remaining illustrations and there are only 16 left todo!

updates.update_userinfo: Response to previous update - and more artwork!!
updates.update_content:
Wow, what a response! Thanks so much for all your feedback guys! It really is awesome how I can chuck an idea out and hear back from so many of you on what you think, it really helps too so I super appreciate it.
There were a lot of different responses from everyone but quite a few common themes kept cropping up so I want to address those with some guarantees and promises from me.
Firstly, this was just an idea. I put it out to you all to see what you thought of it, and for you to give your feedback on. It is not something I am starting now, or intending to start anytime soon. I only brought it up this early so that I had plenty of time for various planning and feedback, if you liked the sound of it.

campaign.story:
Presenting the fifth book in our ART OF DER ORCHIDEENGARTEN series!
DER ORCHIDEENGARTEN: MALEVOLENT VISIONS 
Prior to COVID-19 and HIV/AIDS, the last pandemic the world experienced was the devastating influenza of 1918-1920. Germany was already decimated by the First World War, and the Spanish Flu ravaged the country from border to border. It was during these unsettling years that the world's first horror-fantasy magazine was published.
Published in Munich from 1919-1921, DER ORCHIDEENGARTEN was a predecessor to the American pulp Weird Tales, and is considered the first horror-fantasy-science fiction periodical. The series collected macabre and mysterious tales from the finest European literary minds, from well-known names like H. G. Wells to now-obscure titans like Hanns Heinz Ewers. Many of the stories have been collected and translated over the years, so in this series of books we focus on the artworks, nearly all of which have remained unpublished for a century. 

Grotesque medieval etchings representing the human relationship with death, strange occult woodblocks that consider what lies just beyond the veil of human understanding, and sinister Expressionist visions as tangible manifestations of anxiety.

From our current perspective of global uncertainty and the looming presence of a deadly, devastating virus, the artworks and stories of DER ORCHIDEENGARTEN -created in the same climate, a century ago– are uncannily resonant today. 
Founded four years before the iconic American magazine Weird Tales launched in March 1923, Der Orchideengarten was published immediately after the First World War, when German art was at its height of decadence and debauchery. The magazine included copious illustrations of themes ranging from suspense and terror to crime and the eerily-erotic. The stories were written by the European counterparts of H. P. Lovecraft and Arthur Machen, and the artworks were by artists both well-known and painfully obscure: Heinrich Kley, for example, was Disney's inspiration for Night on Bald Mountain in his film Fantasia, and is one of the artists well-represented in the magazine. The stories have been reprinted and translated over the past century, but the artworks remain undiscovered treasures– until now.
The excellent copies of the magazine in our permanent archive are photographed for these books; the cover for issue 12 features a sinister Black Mass with a council of mysterious, red-hooded figures.
Rewards: The Book 
MALEVOLENT VISIONS: The Art of Der Orchideengarten Vol. 5 is the fifth book in our 'Art of Der Orchideengarten' series, and the second of two volumes completely documenting the magnificent and macabre artworks from the year 1920 of Der Orchideengarten magazine, the legendary German supernatural horror periodical published from January 1919 until November 1921.
MALEVOLENT VISIONS: The Art of Der Orchideengarten Vol. 5
Paperback, 5.5" x 8.5"
80 pages
60+ illustrations
contains every artwork from issues 9-15, published in the year 1920.
The magazines were printed with letterpress debossing, creating rich, dense text and images; we are capturing the artworks in ultra-high, crisp resolution for maximum detail.
Postcard Set
Set of ten 5" x 7" postcards featuring five ghastly images from MALEVOLENT VISIONS (two copies of each image pictured).
Malevolent Visions Pin 
 A 1.75" nickel pin with black rubber double-clutch
Perfume from Black Phoenix Alchemy Lab
Our beloved friends at Black Phoenix Alchemy Lab have created a limited edition perfume inspired by the book!

MALEVOLENT VISIONS- Blood orchid, ylang ylang, bourbon vanilla absolute, rose cream, frankincense, pink pepper, clove, and opium tar accord. 
Full-size 5mL perfume oil in amber vial.
The Art of Der Orchideengarten Vol. 1-3 books + BPAL perfumes

Century Guild Patronage Prints 
 Century Guild Letterpress Prints
All five Malevolent Visions letterpress prints, shown with the custom, handmade paper folio
Five deluxe, limited edition letterpress prints
Blindstamped with the Century Guild emblem
11" x 14" on deluxe cream paper
The complete set of all five Malevolent Visions letterpress prints also includes a custom folio featuring deluxe, handmade marbled paper specifically designed for this project by Brazilian artist Renato Crepaldi 
Add ons
If you missed the first four books in this series, which document the complete artworks of Der Orchideengarten magazine from the year 1919 and the first part of 1920, there are special pledge levels for you to get ALL FIVE volumes - Malevolent Visions, Withering Heights, Eldritch Bloom, Sinister Harvest, and Diabolical Fantasia! 

If you need to fill in specific gaps in your series collection, all of the books, pins, and postcard sets from Vol. 1-5 will be available as add-ons in the project survey. If you would rather increase your pledge amount now to cover the add-on items you want, please look at your total amount (initial pledge + shipping) and add $25 per book/$10 per postcard set/$10 per pin/$35 per Patronage Print to cover the additional items you want - then just send us a message telling us which specific items you want to receive!

 ABOUT US 
For over 20 years, Century Guild has been devoted to building and presenting an archive of important artworks that define the origins of popular culture. We've prepared the materials, and by pre-ordering a copy of the book and spreading the word, you can help us make a documentation of this very rare and very obscure magazine come to life. Der Orchideengarten gets mentioned frequently in books, at fantasy conventions, and at certain full-moon cauldron gatherings–but the same low-resolution images get shared over and over again. This book is an opportunity to explore the artworks in depth, with synopses and snippets of the stories, and high resolution scans made from a pristine collection. We love tactile experiences, and in a hyper-stimulating digital era there is nothing more meditative than thoughtfully turning the pages of a well-crafted book. With your help, we can perpetuate this romantic educational experience.
Founded in 1999 by Thomas Negovan, Century Guild has presented Art Nouveau and Symbolist Art in both their Chicago (1999-2013) and Los Angeles (2012-2018) galleries, as well as in numerous international art and antiques fairs across the last two decades- including fourteen years as a major presence at San Diego Comic Con International. Works previously in the Century Guild collection are on permanent display in a number of important institutions, including The Art Institute of Chicago, The Metropolitan Museum of Art, and The Detroit Institute of Art and have been exhibited at The Los Angeles County Museum of Art, The Minneapolis Museum of Art, and The Art Gallery of Ontario. The limited edition books published by Century Guild are desirable for their academic content, fine quality, and collectability; many out-of-print volumes command high prices on the secondary market.

Thank you for your support of our mission to document and preserve rare, obscure, and historically important artworks!

campaign.story:
"Those who cannot learn from history are doomed to repeat it."

"Reading is to the mind what exercise is to the body."
When Alphonse Mucha addressed his hopes for the utopia of humankind in his 1899 icon of spiritualism Le Pater, he adorned the back cover of the book with an emblem featuring the Lilies of Purity and Wisdom above a simple and powerful injunction: 
Reading introduces us to ideas outside of our individual, personal experiences; opening our minds to think about the infinite possibilities of the world around us, and to examine the hidden depths of our inner selves. 
In December 1899, Alphonse Mucha published Le Pater as his love letter to the close of the 19th century and message of optimism to the future. Now, as we work together to push forward as a society at the close of an excruciating and tumultuous year, we can think of no message more appropriate than the one that Mucha shared 121 years ago.  

The Project:
For 20 years, Century Guild has been devoted to championing and carrying forward the work of elegant and obscure artists into the 21st century.  One of the world's leading galleries in the realm where Symbolist Art, Expressionist Art, and Art Nouveau overlap, Century Guild exhibits important artifacts from 1880-1920 and rare works on paper by early 20th century artists including Gustav Klimt, Odilon Redon, Felicien Rops, Egon Schiele, and Alphonse Mucha. We share these works through the more permanent presence of educational publishing, and by producing limited edition facsimiles of the rarest and most popular artworks in our collection. 
Alphonse Mucha's Le Pater is a beautiful study of the Judeo-Christian Lord's Prayer through a non-denominational, mystical lens. Originally published in an edition of only 510 copies in 1899, this series of rare artworks by the quintessential Art Nouveau artist was his deeply personal exploration of the Lord's Prayer. Born from a desire to create a dynamic interaction between his most important artwork and the viewer, Mucha created a multi-dimensional presence for the text that overflows with artistic metaphor, Christian mysticism, and Masonic symbolism, allowing the viewer an opportunity for deeper understanding of the spirit and intentions.
In 2019, we published a book that documents the artworks and text of Le Pater in its entirety, along with rare historical photographs and detailed analysis of the content. As we approach the December anniversaries of both the original 1899 publication of Le Pater and the 2019 publication of our book, Le Pater: Alphonse Mucha's Symbolist Masterpiece and the Lineage of Mysticism, we're celebrating with a new project to make shirts, enamel pins, and canvas book bags to help spread this important message.
The Rewards:
Metal pins
T-shirts
Soft, cotton blend t-shirts available in Vintage Black and Vintage Blue, all sizes.
 Tote bags
Sturdy canvas tote bags available in Black and Natural
Books
Le Pater: Alphonse Mucha's Symbolist Masterpiece and the Lineage of Mysticism
Le Pater: Alphonse Mucha's Symbolist Masterpiece and the Lineage of Mysticism is the most beautiful art book we have created to-date, and the most important book on metaphysical and Symbolist art in decades.  Author Tom Negovan explores mystical Symbolist art from Albrecht Dürer (1471-1528) to William Blake (1757-1827) and Alphonse Mucha (1860-1939), with stops at the Invisible College (1618) and Joséphin Péladan's legendary occult Salon Rose+Croix (1892).  Along with fascinating details from the seances and metaphysical experiments conducted in Mucha's studio, the book also has chapters devoted to Bing's salon L'Art Nouveau and the Exposition Universelle of 1900. Profusely illustrated with grand two-page spreads, featuring a number of rare artworks and photographs presented in a higher resolution than ever before.
PLAY

These large 19.5" x 27.5" out-of-print Alphonse Mucha posters featuring images from Le Pater were published in an edition of 100... they are SOLD OUT online, but the remaining proofs are being made available as part of this campaign. Printed on heavyweight glossy archival art paper and blindstamped with the Century Guild emblem.
The Original 1899 Lithograph 
"Forgive Us Our Trespasses, As We Forgive Those Who Trespass Against Us."
One of the original, antique Alphonse Mucha lithographs from 1899 - only 510 were printed on a single date, December 20, 1899, and only a fraction of those would have survived until today. Exceedingly rare and of the highest quality, approx. 10.5 in x 14.5 inches.
About Us
Since 1999, The Century Guild Museum of Art has been devoted to building and presenting an archive of important artworks that define the origins of popular culture.
Founded by Thomas Negovan, Century Guild has presented Art Nouveau and Symbolist Art in both their Chicago (1999-2013) and Los Angeles (2012-2018) galleries, as well as in numerous international art and antiques fairs across the last two decades- including fourteen years as a major presence at San Diego Comic Con International. Works previously in the Century Guild collection are on permanent display in a number of important institutions, including The Art Institute of Chicago, The Metropolitan Museum of Art, and The Detroit Institute of Art and have been exhibited at The Los Angeles County Museum of Art, The Minneapolis Museum of Art, and The Art Gallery of Ontario. The limited edition books published by Century Guild are desirable for their academic content, fine quality, and collectability; many out-of-print volumes command high prices on Amazon and eBay.

support.title: Original 1899 Alphonse Mucha
support.descp:
"Forgive Us Our Trespasses, As We Forgive Those Who Trespass Against Us"
One of the original, antique Alphonse Mucha lithographs from 1899 - only 510 were printed on a single date, December 20, 1899, and only a fraction of those would have survived until today. Exceedingly rare and of the highest quality, approx. 10.5 in x 14.5 inches. Comes with a certificate of authenticity and a copy of the limited edition "Le Pater: Alphonse Mucha's Symbolist Masterpiece and the Lineage of Mysticism" hardcover book.

campaign.story:
The Wildsea is a tabletop roleplaying game from Quillhound Studios for 2-6 players inspired by stories like Sunless Sea, Bastion, and the Bas-Lag Trilogy. Set in a world overrun by greenery, Wildsea uses a narrative, fiction-first d6 dicepool system that draws inspiration from games like Belly of the Beast, Blades in the Dark, and 13th Age. 
Clickthrough to access the Quick Start Rules!
This campaign's goal is to raise funds to produce and print a 1st edition of the Wildsea RPG. This is a production Kickstarter: after the campaign closes, we'll be using the funds raised to create a fully realized beautiful rulebook. The budget goal of $15,000 represents the minimum amount needed to bring the book to life with the resources we currently have available. 
Any additional funds will be funneled back directly into the production of the RPG, adding more content, art, professional layouts, and an offset print run to deliver a premium tabletop roleplaying book that will be a showcase for any collection. 
 Some three hundred years ago the empires of the world were toppled by a wave of fast growing greenery, a tide of rampant growth spilling from the West known as the Verdancy. 
Now chainsaw-driven ships cut their way across dense treetop waves, their engines powered by oilfruit, rope-golems, honey and pride.
You play a wildsailor, part of a motley crew consisting of humanity's weathered descendants, cactoid gunslingers, centipedal fungi, silk-clothed spiderfolk, and other, stranger things. 
With your fellow crewmembers, you'll journey across the lingin' tide discovering charts, pursuing drives, and avoiding mires of the deep. 
The Wildsea hungers and grows, roots sinking deep into the forest floor as the waves above ripple with life.  What will you discover in its depths? 



Check out our Actual Play on the Don't Forget Your Towel Podcast!
The Wildsea is a fiction-first roleplaying game with narrative and character decisions driving your interaction with the mechanics of the Wild Words engine. The game uses a d6 narrative dicepool system that constantly pushes the story forward.
At character creation, players select a Bloodline, Origin and Post, each with a variety of options to inform and customize a character's background and playstyle:
The four core bloodlines of the Wildsea: the cactuslike Ektus, Ardent survivors, hive spider Tzelicrae, and fungi Gau.
 Your Edges represent the way in which your character is most used to solving problems. Your Grace, Iron, Instinct, Sharps, Teeth, Tides, or Veils. 
Your Skills are more specific areas in which your character has training or a natural advantage. Things like Climbing, Charming, Cooking, Breaking, or Scavenging. 
You also have Aspects - gear, traits, or companions - that can be used, expended, or damaged throughout the course of play. 
 Resources are useful oddities, short term expendables used for things like whispers, scavenge, and specimens.
Your known Languages allow you to engage with different people and cultures in the diverse world of the Wildsea.  
Finally, your Drives and Mires define your personality, motivation, and long term goals. 
Each crew will also have their own ship, a vessel capable of braving the unique challenges of the lingin tide. You might cut a path with a chainsaw-ridged prow, drag yourself with hooks and grapples or scuttle from branch to branch on insectile limbs.
Customize and upgrade  your ship by designing its Size, Frame, Hull, Bite, and Engine, and outfitting  it with different Fittings. Make it your home on the waves! 
Stories and Characters develop as the crew pursues milestones, while time in the game is abstracted through three distinct phases: scenes, montages, and journeys. 
The Wildsea will initially be presented in landscape, 11.5 x 8.5'' inch (~29 x 22 cm) hardcover book with around 200 pages of mostly black and white interiors punctuated by full color spread chapter headings.  
Mockup. Artwork and Design of Physical Book not final. Design shown is a hardcover perfect bound edition that would only be unlocked should we reach certain stretch goal milestones.
As the campaign grows, so will the quality and contents of the book. Should we reach certain stretch goals, we will upgrade the physical book to a 3-piece clothbound, full colour, sewn book sure to be a centerpiece of any collection. For more information, see the Stretch Goals section below.
The initial funding goal of $15,000 represents the bare minimum for the creators to produce and print physical copies of the book and recoup the funds already expended by the creator to the artists. 

Community Copies: At Collector's Edition and above tiers, we'll include additional digital Community Copies to be claimed by the public. Community Copies provide a way for those with less means to enjoy content and are a feature of Itch.io. When our page on the platform goes live, we'll add Community Copies commensurate with the amount of backers we have at higher tiers.

Shipping is not included in the pledge levels for this campaign and will be calculated and added on when we are ready to ship via Backerkit. This is a production Kickstarter and it may be up to a year before we start shipping out physical copies. It would therefore be inaccurate  to include the shipping rates as part of the funds raised for this campaign. 
As in: you will not be charged additional VAT or Customs Taxes on your shipped goods.
Mythopoeia is currently in the process of partnering with fulfillment centers based all over the world to deliver customs-friendly shipping, including to Europe and Oceania.  According to our most recent quotes, packages for a <1kg (~2 lbs) package average around $7.50 to the USA, UK, Germany, and Netherlands and around $20 to Oceania and Canada. 

Shipping has been quite tumultuous in recent months due to the ongoing pandemic and politics. Canadian postage from the USA seems to have taken a dramatic spike over the past four years. This is a problem we are actively working on. If you know any local Canadian or Australian distributors for USA goods, we would love to hear from you!

If we reach our initial goal of $15,000, we'll include new Origins for character creation not seen in the Quickstart Rules! We'll also throw in a set of digital wallpapers and other high resolution Wildsea Artwork as part of the Kickstarter exclusive digital bonuses. 
At $17,000 we will be able to commission a full Wildsea Soundtrack from the amazing Liam P. Vaughan, composer of Thrash, Tangle, Sink, the song used in our Kickstarter video!  
At $20,000 we'll be able to afford to turn the book from mostly black and white to full colour! To do so will require us to go back and recolour about two thirds of our total art assets - a significant endeavor! 

At $25,000 we'll bring on board a Professional Layout Artist to help design the final look of the book!  We'll also produce and release Virtual Play Surfaces to facilitate online play on your favorite platforms of choice.

At $30,000 we'll be able to raise the rates of our artists as well as commission an expanded bestiary from bestiary artist Katy Shmeckerel (@schmeckerel)! 
At $32,000 we'll release the SRD for the Wild Words Engine, allowing you to hack and release your own games! To celebrate this milestone, we'll also be commissioning Creators to create new content for the Wildsea including new factions, beasts, and  ships, and perhaps even additional Reaches...
At $35,000 we'll be able to upgrade the specs of both the Standard and Collector's Edition of The Wildsea! This may include things like an offset print run, three piece clothbound hardcover, and embossed finish. 
At $37,000 we'll include a chapter on Arconautics - the study of the weird and strange. Arconautics presents an array of additional options for both players and Fireflies that want to embrace the extraordinary - alchemists, augurs, ironbound automatons, manipulators of metal and plantlife. Includes new bloodlines, origins, posts, skills, and hazards! 
At $40,000 we'll be able to spare no expense when it comes to printing the book, including being able to lower our carbon footprint by printing locally. We will also will look into more printing bells and whistles like foil stamping, endsheets, booksmarks, et. all.
At $42,000 we'll be able to bring on even more Creators to create content for the Wildsea! We'll announce if we get here, but preliminary discussions have included an appendix on gardening, and ventures deep into the undiscovered waves...
At $45,000 we'll be able to raise the rates of our artists yet again and commission more artwork for the final book. Perhaps we might even be able to include an illustrated Chart or three...
 At $50,000 we'll be able to produce a fully realized actual play of the Wildsea for your viewing enjoyment! This may include partnering with an existing show or perhaps striking out on our own. Details to come if we get here! 
At $55,000 we'll be able to add a set of ship creation options, unique hazards and Firefly guidance based around the ideas of exploring the upper skies and lower branches. Now we just have to work out what to call a submarine... 
At $60,000 we'll set aside a portion of the funds to subsidize the shipping fees for the project. This will hopefully enable us to lower shipping rates by $1-2 dollars per package, depending on a number of factors. Internally, what this means is that no matter what we will allocate a portion of our funds raised to shipping costs, which we'll then pass the savings unto you when it comes time to charge and fulfill via Backerkit.
At $65,000 we're going to pay Wildsea creator and designer Felix Isaacs more! The majority of funds raised from  the last stretch goal to this one will go directly to Felix in addition to his overall cut of the campaign and future sales.
At $70,000 we'll be able to raise the per word rate of the various designers and writers we are bringing on board to the Wildsea (which I promise we'll announce soon in a future update). Freelance game design is not exactly a lucrative profession but we're committed to building a bigger tent and providing opportunities to others when and where  we can.
At $75,000 we'll be able to design and manufacture a set of custom  wooden Wildsea Dice which will be available to purchase as an Add-On via BackerKit. This is something we wanted to have ready for the start of the campaign but alas simply ran out of time. Nonetheless, reaching this tier will give us the resources to begin the process of making these dice in earnest.
Handcrafted dice from Might Dog Games. Now available as add-ons.
At $85,000 we'll include the last content update for the core book: The Farthest Reaches. Consider this an expansion of the Arconautics chapter already unlocked detailing the furthest corners of the Wildsea. More obscure content, to be announced if we get here!

Finally, our ultimate goal at $100,000 will allow us to lower shipping rates yet again, reducing the rates by another $1-2 per package. In the interim, the funds raised to get this tier will allow us to pay the principles of the project just that little bit more :)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As a production Kickstarter, the primary risk is that the book still needs to be created in full before printing and distribution can begin. For that reason we typically like to run print Kickstarters where the product is already completed instead, but sometimes that's not possible when launching a new and amazing project like the Wildsea! 

Ray and Vince bring over six years and 13 projects worth of crowdfunding experience into this campaign. We know how to produce beautiful books and communicate with our backers and fans on every step of the process. We strive to have 100% satisfaction guaranteed when it comes our projects - ask our past backers about their experience! 

We gave ourselves a wide breadth for the campaign - almost a full year - but should we meet and exceed our goals, we will use that time to build a better world filled with gorgeous art and a handsome book you'll be proud to have on your shelves. There is always the possibility that things may be delayed further. We will do our best to deliver in a timely matter while maintaining transparency and striving always for the highest quality work possible.

Shipping is another major uncertainty heading into the year 2021. The state of global politics means that things like postal rates and customs and tariffs are in a constant state of flux. Brexit and the USA/China trade war may impact the printing and manufacturing of the Wildsea in ways we cannot foresee. Nonetheless, we will do our best to navigate these uncharted waters, just as we have done for the past four years. 

Backing this project means you're not only buying the book, but helping produce the work to make it real. For that we can't thank you enough. Together, we'll build something amazing.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Art and exploration are inseparable. I am a whimsical watercolor artist, and for as long as I can remember I've been creating and traveling the globe. This book documents my artistic journey over this past year.
As a wanderer and creative, the process of creating is tightly intertwined with the natural, and imaginary, worlds. Here you'll find lush tropical environments, fantastical characters under twisting trees, and vast cities that exist only in our imagination.
Book Details
8 x 10 Inches
Perfect bound softcover
70lb smooth white paper
34 pages of full-color images and text 
THE LIMITED EDITION PIN
Previous yearly art books I've created a limited edition pin to pair with it. The inspiration for this pin was another favorite painting from this year, "The Water Garden" and felt like the perfect design for something so special.
Pin Details:
Hard enamel with gold metal plating
1.5 inches tall
Rubber clutch & backing card
THE OPEN EDITION PIN
This is an open edition hard enamel pin inspired by my love of lanterns and tropical things. The design is based on my painting "The Bard's Song" as well as my recently illustrated novel "Naiya and the Foxdragon" and pulls some of the magical elements found within that world.
Pin Details:
Hard enamel with copper metal plating
3 inches tall
Rubber clutch & backing card
Add-ons: A Beta Kickstarter feature
This project is a part of a new beta feature Kickstarter is offering: built-in add-ons! This means you can add-on extra books and pins right here on the Kickstarter project! 
THE FULL SERIES - BOOK BUNDLE
For the past 4 years, I've been creating art books that document my journey throughout the year. This is my fifth book in that series. If you would like to collect them all simply add on the Book Bundle to get all 4 additional books at a discount.
Find out more about my previous art books (2015 "First Light", 2016 "Whispers in the Winds", 2017 "An Offering of Light", and 2018 "A New Sun Rising") on my website here.

WANT EXTRA PINS?
Add-on the open edition pin to your pledge and get it at a discount (normally $15).

Shipping
Shipping fees are collected during the live Kickstarter campaign however if your shipping address changes you will have an opportunity to adjust it before rewards are sent out. Please note, due to the COVID-19 pandemic, shipping times have been longer for some packages and international shipping prices have gone up significantly.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will be the fourth Kickstarter that I've run. My previous three were designed similarly with a project that was already complete before launching the project and both were delivered before their estimated due dates.

While there are many things I can plan out ahead of time I realize there are always unforeseen circumstances that may arise in regards to working with any project. I plan to be transparent about the status of the project along the way so backers will be the first to know if anything comes up.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

WE DID IT! Click through to read about our stretch goals.
About IndieCade
Since 2005, IndieCade has been on a mission to support and showcase the future of independent games. We do this through a series of annual international events, including our flagship festival and awards ceremony in Santa Monica, as well as our sister festival in Paris held by our IndieCade Europe team. We’ve shown over 2000 games and juried thousands more, launched incredible projects over these years, and exhibited at countless conferences. IndieCade is a dedicated member of the gaming industry and community, and we use our platform to amplify independent creators and their work.
This year, our annual awards ceremony revolves around our new online experience, ANYWHERE AND EVERYWHERE. With our friends from all over the globe, we've worked incredibly hard for months to lay the foundation of our upcoming festival this October 16-24. We’re planning nine full days of 24-hours-a-day programming, streamed for the entire world to participate, with opportunities to play, network, learn, talk, and more. 
The ability to open our doors to the world and cross boundaries, space, and time, to showcase games is an exciting new development for IndieCade. This campaign was created to sustain where we go next: we're scaling our digital platform to exist beyond just this year's festival. Here's a look at the framework for Anywhere and Everywhere:
How we share games and connect.
Why we need your support
We’re raising funds to boost our ability to showcase games, and to build the architecture for our online headquarters. Moving our entire operation to the internet has been a challenge with hard costs, but the space we’re creating will be a lasting change. We want ANYWHERE AND EVERYWHERE to be a place that the indie community can benefit from all year round. It will be a sustainable venue to experience new games, meet with developers, and see the latest updates from our network. Your support will allow us to set up our initial digital infrastructure, and to create a more rich and open platform. We’re designing this space with experience at the forefront, where genuine connections can be made.
How we'll use the money
Our first ever Game Dev Sketchbook
We wanted to make a unique reward for our backers, so we've gathered some of IndieCade's most talented alumni and friends to produce a special book of sketches and handwritten notes from game developers all over the world. The pages of the GAME DEV SKETCHBOOK will be a personal, inside look at ideas that sparked some of your favorite indie titles. We're currently collecting assets and confirming participants, but we're eyeing at least 50-100 pages in a minimalist, square-formatted book. We'll use the time between now and printing to finish gathering assets from creators, finalize print details, and optimize the format to the highest quality. This book can't exist without your support, and backing this campaign will give us the ability to produce a rare artifact of indie games history.
 Featuring sketches from creators who made: 
JOURNEY | EXPLODING KITTENS | THE BEGINNER'S GUIDE | EVERYTHING IS GOING TO BE OK | GORAGOA | DICEY DUNGEONS | VVVVVV | MUTAZIONE | FUJII | WHAT THE GOLF | CARD OF DARKNESS | WATTAM | MYST | CREAKS | BABA IS YOU | SPELUNKY | THE ENDLESS FOREST | NUCLEAR THRONE | STORYTELLER | WALDEN, A GAME | IBB & OBB | THUNDERBIRD | MULAKA | KEEP TALKING AND NOBODY EXPLODES | COSMIC TOP SECRET | OXYGEN NOT INCLUDED | MAGIC TRICK | HEADLINER: NOVINEWS | KLEPTOCRAT: HOW TO HIDE DIRTY MONEY| AND MANY MORE! We'll be updating the campaign each week with additional confirmed contributors.
Mockup
Important note on shipping: Shipping for all physical rewards will be calculated and charged at a later date. We are working hard to find the correct printing partner that can handle distribution for us.
Off the menu rewards
We've also got a few extraordinary rewards to offer for your support. We were able to source these hard-to-acquire items from some of our favorite developers:
ABS vs THE BLOOD QUEEN Fightstick by BumbleBear
Klaxo Radio Hour by Haunted Ephemera

Attending this year's festival
We hope to see you in October! Here's a breakdown of the ticket types and experiences we're offering for this year's festival. Each week we'll be updating the campaign with news on confirmed sessions, speakers, games, and events that you can attend next month and onward.
Please note all festival tickets will be delivered October 2020, and physical rewards will follow at a later date.

Lastly, rare and limited IndieXchange tickets are available this year, exclusively through our Kickstarter campaign. IndieXchange is our festival's annual one-day track focused on advanced developer sessions and content, and is not usually open for sale to the public.

Thank you
More information is available at https://anywhere.indiecade.com.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest challenge ahead of us is finding the right printing and shipping partner for the Game Dev Sketchbook. We want to make sure the books arrive on time and are protected during transit, and that shipping costs are appropriate for every backer. Although we have done quite a bit of research already, choosing our final partner will require a second leg of followup. We think the extra time spent on this step will ultimately lead to a better product for everyone that buys the book.

The other challenge we're facing is completing the architecture for ANYWHERE AND EVERYWHERE. We have created an entire framework for our festival, but we need to continue building out the platform and figure out how to translate that to a sustainable, long lasting digital venue. We're incredibly excited for this transformation. In order to solve this puzzle we'll need both community feedback as well as lessons learned from the festival.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Wanderhome is a pastoral fantasy Role-Playing Game about traveling animal-folk, the world they inhabit, and the way the seasons change. It is a game filled with grassy fields, mossy shrines, herds of chubby bumblebees, opossums in sundresses, salamanders with suspenders, starry night skies, and the most beautiful sunsets you can imagine. You might be a tamarin who dances with small and forgotten gods, a leporine mail carrier who relies on moths to get packages where they belong, a little lizard with a big heart and a mysterious past, or a near-endless number of other thrilling possibilities. No matter what, we’re always travelers—animal-folk who go from village to village and get to see the length and breadth of all the world of Hæth. The seasons will change as we play, and we will change with them. But I can’t tell you all that will happen on our journey together, along the winding dirt road and amid the grassy fields. We’re just going to have to find that out together.
Will you join me?
The Journey Ahead
Wanderhome makes use of a unique game system inspired by the No Dice, No Masters engine, developed by Avery Alder and Benjamin Rosenbaum for Dream Askew and Dream Apart. Each player will make a character with the help of one of fifteen possible playbooks, making choices about their personality, animal-form, look, and passions. Each of these playbooks give you a radically different approach both to navigating the setting and growing over time. From the carefree Ragamuffin to the introverted Poet, from the Guardian and their young ward to the lonely Exile, from the cheerful Dancer to the moody Veteran, there is plenty of space in Wanderhome to imagine every possible world that lives in your heart.
Once you’ve created your character, you and your fellow travelers guide them through the dreamlike pastoral world of Hæth. There are no dice in Wanderhome. Instead, you can inconvenience yourself or step outside your comfort zone in order to get tokens, and then turn around and spend those tokens to tackle larger problems and help make the world a better, kinder space.
Quote from Vincent and Elliot Baker of Lumpley Games
Quote from Samuel Mui Shen Ern, Babblegumsam

As you arrive at each new place, you’ll build it together using a combination of thirty-six distinct natures, including farms, fields, lakes, ports, glens, and towers, among many, many more. Each nature gives you the tools you need to imagine and articulate both the literal and metaphorical aspects of the place you find yourself in. These places have kith, ordinary people living ordinary lives, navigating a world that is both peaceful and difficult in its own ways. Each kith is made out of traits that range from crafty and adventurous to many-faced and oracular. These traits give kith things they can do to define their personality, articulate the problems in their life, and push the journey forward (for good or for ill.) Sometimes you’ll be able to help the kith with their problems, but more often than not you’ll just spend time with them and learn more about the world.
Sketches by Kimberli Johnson, Nadhir Nor, and Letty Wilson
Wanderhome is structured with an emphasis on safety and care, built on my own work designing safety mechanics and constructing alternate safety approaches beyond the industry standards. It features a bespoke set of safety mechanics built around empowering players to guide the story however they want, which are used consistently throughout the game. It is also designed to collaboratively set the tone and articulate a version of Hæth that's perfect for your group. 
Wanderhome is a GM-agnostic game–while you can play with a Guide facilitating the world, you can also approach it without anyone in charge, where everyone takes equal part in the collaborative conversation. And while you can play Wanderhome in as little as 3-4 hours, the longer you stay with Wanderhome the more the world will grow with you. The months will pass over time and as each season concludes you’ll get to make new choices about your character, advancing them in new directions and helping them grow in ways you didn’t think was possible. If you play long enough, eventually your characters will retire or grow apart, and the journey will continue with brand-new travelers and a vast world ahead of you.
The free playkit is available on Itch now! (Art by Letty Wilson)
The World of Haeth
Wanderhome is set in the wholly-original fantasy world of Hæth, inspired by the works of Brian Jacques, Tove Jansson, and Hayao Miyazaki. The game hints at and builds a mythological language around forces like the bitter King of the Floating Mountain, the Lily Rebellion, the Slobbering God and the blade that killed her, and the fall of the great dragons of old, but refuses to elaborate or define them—leaving that exercise to the players through the journey itself. Instead, Wanderhome is focused on the lives of ordinary people, and the world that exists for farmers, merchants, and crafts-folk.
Wanderhome is a world filled with animal-folk and their buggy livestock. Unlike many worlds with animal-folk, there is no morality or judgement ascribed to the various animals of Hæth—a snake is just as capable of being a kindly farmer as a rabbit, and you can’t assume much about someone based on what animal they are. You might find a fluffy shepherd with a herd of bumblebees, a shrewish merchant riding a stag beetle the size of a house, a lonely fox riding a grasshopper from place to place, or a praying mantis that hangs out in a gecko’s pocket.
Quote from Avery Alder, Buried Without Ceremony (Art by Jennie Lindberg)
Wanderhome also features an original calendar of new months and seasons, with its own cycle of holidays and traditions. From flowery Bloommeadow to brisk Firetop to snug and quiet Snowblanket, each month is both rooted in potentially familiar natural cycles but with a unique twist. Each place you travel to has a different expression of the seasons in it - no matter how many times you travel through the year, it will always feel different. If you play Wanderhome long enough, you might even encounter unique phenomena that create a new twist on the calendar. 
The Hæth is a world full of queer love, hope, happiness, and community. It is a land that was once ravaged by violence, but is putting itself back together again. Wanderhome dares to imagine a better world, one where money and power are distant stories from a bygone age, and we can learn to begin the process of healing.
Thumbnails by Danny Kyobe and Jo Thierolf
Kickstarter
Wanderhome, like all projects, is a dream that can only be created with your help. In an industry dominated by exploitative hiring practices and low wages, I believe it’s possible to release a large-scale high-quality game where everyone is paid what they’re worth. While the funding goal is higher than most Kickstarters, I refuse to get away with underpaying or undervaluing the incredible artists, writers, designers, and creators who are willing to pour their heart and soul into this game. Wanderhome is ambitious, but the hope is to make something unlike anything else in the role-playing game space.
The final copy of Wanderhome will exist in two forms—a complete digital PDF copy of the game, and an approximately 150 page 8.5” square softcover in full color, printed by Mixam Press and published by Possum Creek Games. Wanderhome will feature a cover by Sylvia Bi, illustrations by Letty Wilson, and full-page pieces by more than a dozen different artists, each with a unique style and perspective on Wanderhome. These talents are being directed (and the book is being designed) by the one-of-a-kind Ruby Lavin, with editing by Kazumi Chin and Luke Jordan.
Here is how the budget is being distributed:
 $5,000 for game design and editing.
 $7,000 for layout and all the incredible art.
 $4,000 for printing and production.
 $800 for Backerkit, who will be handling shipping after the Kickstarter.
 $1,800 for Kickstarter and credit card fees
