The Team
Jay Dragon
Jay is a queer lyrical game designer who lives in the Hudson Valley. You can generally find Jay writing games about community, trauma, and our relationship to the land; talking about games on Twitter and Patreon; or sitting by the creek with a bunch of flowers and some zines. Jay is the founder of Possum Creek Games, and has managed three wildly successful Kickstarters before Wanderhome. Jay's first game, Sleepaway, is the winner of an ENnie Judge's Spotlight Award, and has been nominated for two IGDN Indie Groundbreaker Awards - Most Innovative and Game Of The Year.
Ruby Lavin
Ruby is a graphic designer and illustrator living in Philadelphia. She likes texture, critical theory, fantasy, and weird plants. Ruby has previously been involved in the Kickstarters for Strong Female Protagonist, Sleepaway, Venture & Dungeon, and the recently-concluded Wickedness, making this her fifth Kickstarter involvement. She is the Art Director at Possum Creek Games, and you can find her portfolio here.
Kazumi Chin

Kazumi is an educator, organizer, poet, and game designer. They are the author of Having A Coke With Godzilla, and have written a number of acclaimed indie RPGs, including (but not limited to) Malinche's Dream, Recollection, and Doggos & Doggos. They believe in a world without prisons and policing. 
Luke Jordan
Luke is a game designer, editor, and educator who writes games that are specific, sincere, spooky, and sad. They love painterly landscapes, heartfelt poetry, slice-of-life storytelling, and Watership Down (and, therefore, Wanderhome). They publish games through Games From The Wild Wood, and are known for their experience and mastery of the No Dice, No Masters engine. Games of theirs include Heaven Has No Taste; And Other True Statements, Grand Guignol, and Heaven in the Dust. 
The Artists
Sylvia Bi
Sylvia Bi is an illustrator, designer, and full time book gremlin. By day, she designs over at Random House Children's Books, but by night she collects a terrifying number of earrings, draws nostalgic worlds, and gobbles up graphic novels.
Letty Wilson
Letty Wilson is an award-winning Scottish artist who spends a lot of time thinking about moss. Her work includes an ongoing webcomic, Owl People, about fairies doing crimes; illustrations for the Choose-your-own-path book Into the Dungeon, written by Hari Conner, among other books; and comics about devils, queer insects, flowers who are also knights, and the importance of worms.
Cam Adjodha
Cam is an artist and illustrator in New York City. She loves video games, anime, and fashionable women posing in front of ornate mirrors. You can check out her website here.
Sabii Borno
Sabii is a NYC based illustrator and comic artist. They love to cook and try new food, seek out and collect cool zines and interesting artbooks, and spend time with their cat, Echo. You can find her website here. 
Geneva Bowers
Geneva is an illustrator residing in the mountains of North Carolina. She loves to combine a slice of real life with whimsy. You can check out her work on her website and in her webcomic Hovergirls. 
Juho Choi
Juho is an illustrator with a love for stars and stories, and loves to create art inspired by motion and flow. She is constantly watching aesthetic baking videos and cat videos, and one day aspires to also have  a cat. For now, she is satisfied with her thriving mint plant. You can check out her website here.
Conner Fawcett
Conner is a illustrator/artist currently living in the north-west reaches of America.  He once slept in a small cave, at the end of a narrow glacier valley along side several small bats. The bats didn’t seem to mind. You can keep up to date on their work on Twitter and Instagram.
Lauren Henderson
Lauren is an artist/illustrator living in New England dabbling in various kinds of work including pre-production/concept art, tabletop  game art, private commission and personal projects, but her work almost always includes animals or green environments. She also needlefelts, hoards dungeon synth tapes, and even goes outside from time to time on  local trail walks or hikes. You can check out her website here.
Kimberli Johnson
Kimberli is an illustrator and comic creator who loves to draw cute critters and fantasy folks. She is the author and artist for the young reader comic Emiline: Knight In Training, and you can check out her website here.
Danny Kyobe
Danny Kyobe is a visual artist/animator based in Ontario, Canada. They are a full-time student at Sheridan College and is the creator of the webcomic Burnout Dogs. When they're not making pictures happen, they can be found out in nature either camping or gardening! You can check out their website here.
Jennie Lindberg
Jennie has always been fascinated by the way art can tell powerful  stories, whether it be through comics, animation or games. She has studied illustration and graphic design, but is currently trying to  create more fairy tale inspired art, striving for a soft and magical  atmosphere. Apart from work, she has a big love for alternative fashion  and video games. You can follow along with her work on Twitter and Instagram.
Nadhir Nor
Nadhir Nor is a queer Malaysian illustrator who's into into all things otherworldly. If he's not busy getting nostalgic over Bjork's discography and villagers that left his AC island, you might find him sketching a magical boyfriend or two. You can check out his website here.
Dominique Ramsey
Dominique Ramsey is a freelance illustrator from Atlanta, GA with a passion for telling stories about animals, nature, and the whimsical-mysteries things in life. Her inspiration comes from animation, video games, music, and children’s books that have an animal focus, including the Warrior Cats book series and the Pokemon game franchise. Her work explores the spiritual connection between animals, people, and communities. You can check out her website here. 
Jo Thierolf
A meanderer of the midwest. Aside from art, Jo enjoys learning to be a naturalist, critter keeping, reading shortform fantasy and scifi, and collecting fountain pen inks. You can check out Jo's website here.

✓ $90,000 - Wanderhome Recipes Zine by Jeeyon Shim.
Jeeyon Shim is an acclaimed and incredibly talented RPG designer, who just wrapped up her very successful Kickstarter Wait For Me.  She's also a skilled outdoors educator and naturalist, and her games embody her philosophy and relationship with the land. She'll be putting together and creating a bunch of recipes inspired by the world of Haeth and its seasons, and  including a minigame you and a friend can play in-character while preparing food for the rest of your Wanderhome group. The physical zine will come with all tiers that involve a physical copy, and a PDF will accompany all tiers.
✓ $100,000 - More Playbooks and Natures by Guest Designers.
The core of Wanderhome lies in its modular and expansive nature. At 100k, these designers will each bring their own perspective to Wanderhome with a playbook and two natures.
 Adira Slattery (Twitter, Itch). Adira is a trans Jewish game designer, poet, and podcast human. Her  work spans comedy, horror, and intimacy. Adira is also the designer coordinator, who will be working with the core team to keep all the designers for this goal (and any future design stretch goals) on track.
 Jamila R. Nedjadi (Twitter, Itch). Jammi is the creative force behind Sword Queen Games and believes in the  power and magic of creative play. Their game BALIKBAYAN: Returning Home was nominated for the IGDN Indie Groundbreaker Award for best setting. They are also a co-host of The Gauntlet podcast, which focuses on games being played in the online gaming club that is The Gauntlet community.
 Taylor LaBresh (Twitter, Itch). Taylor writes weird queer games under the Riverhouse Games brand and hosts the Game Closet podcast, an informal chat show w/ rad queer/LGBT+ RPG folks. He loves going fishing!
 Viditya R Voleti (Twitter, Itch). Viditya is a QPoC game designer and writer who loves exploring the medium in several avenues! A true goblin of the community, he wears different hats from making games, consulting, Twitter worldbuilding, streaming live design nights, reading and reviewing games, and really anything he decides will be fun! All of this gets collected on his Patreon.
 Riley Rethal (Twitter, Itch). Riley is a pharmacy student, camp counselor and ttrpg designer who  likes to write games about Marxist alienation and introspection. You may know her from designing Venture, co-organizing Doikayt: A Jewish RPG Anthology, or one of her many other games.
All of these additional playbooks and natures will go in the supplemental zine.
✓ $115,000 - Hardcover!
At $115,000, we'll be able to print a hardcover edition of Wanderhome. It's going to be pricey, but we'll be sparing no expense in its production. The hardcover will have a dust jacket with alternate art by Sylvia Bi.
✓ $125,000 - Even More Playbooks and Natures by Guest Designers.
At $125,000, we'll be hiring a second set of stretch goal authors to help develop the world of Wanderhome even more. 
 Brandon  O’Brien (Twitter, Patreon). Brandon is a writer, performance poet, teaching artist and game designer from Trinidad and Tobago. His work has been shortlisted for the 2014 Alice Yard Prize for Art Writing and the 2014 and 2015 Small Axe Literary Competitions, and is published in Uncanny Magazine, Strange Horizons, Fireside Magazine, and New Worlds, Old Ways: Speculative Tales from the Caribbean, among others. He is also the poetry editor of FIYAH: A Magazine of Black Speculative Fiction.
 Luke Jordan (Twitter, Itch). Luke is the conceptual editor for Wanderhome, and will also be putting together a stretch goal for the project! They are a game designer, editor, and educator who writes games that are specific, sincere, spooky, and sad. They love painterly landscapes, heartfelt poetry, slice-of-life storytelling, and Watership Down (and, therefore, Wanderhome).
 Ajey Pandey (Twitter, Itch). Ajey is a game designer, game reviewer, lightning mage, and (by day,) a  researcher on clean energy. He’s the writer of the BOLT RPG Engine, as  well as smaller projects that try to use mechanics as a means of inducing specific emotions in players. He tries to be a healing presence  for the people around him, and he hopes he isn’t screwing that up.
 JR Goldberg (Twitter, Itch). JR Goldberg is a game designer living in Philadelphia. Some of credits include the Townes Van Zandt TTRPG collection and Doikayt. His collection of professional wrestling essays, Methlab BattlArts, is forthcoming.
 M Veselak (Twitter, Itch). M is a games tinkerer, body liberation essayist, and the author of the  soon-to-release Wickedness RPG! Her works center mythological identity, transformation and community-building. When she’s not writing, she can  most often be found lounging around like a modern day Venus of Urbino and untangling the complexities of N-dimensional gender space.
✓ $175,000 - New Art by Núria Tamarit (& Artist Pay Raise)
We have an incredible team of artists working for Wanderhome, and it would be inappropriate to not pass on the runaway success to all of them. From the beginning, our objective has been fair and equitable pay, but we're always trying to raise the bar on what is possible. If we reach $175,000, we'll get to welcome on board Núria Tamarit, and pay all of our artists even more for each piece they're working on.
Núria Tamarit
Núria is a Spanish illustrator and comic artist whose work is symbolic, mystical, and structural. She imagines dynamic and stark worlds of angular figures, intense lights, and visionary dreams. 
✓ $200,000 - Wall Scrolls 
At $200,000, screenprinted canvas wall scrolls will be added to all Pilgrim tiers with a limited quantity also available on backerkit after the kickstarter ends. This will feature a depiction of the great arc of the year by the talented Conner Fawcett and produced by Heart of the Deernicorn. Each scroll will be handmade and screenprinted on canvas, with a wooden dowel and serged edges.
✓ $225,000 - Increased Pay For Stretch Goal Writers 
At $225,000, we'll be paying our stretch goal writers even more. From the beginning, our goal has been to pay everyone what they're worth, but with this stretch goal we'll be able to set aside even more money for each of them. We'll be paying them each 50 cents a word, 5 times the recommended minimum rate for writers in RPG design. Every writer on board Wanderhome is a skilled professional in this field, and we're proud to pay them what they're worth.
$250,000 - Wanderhome Community Fund
With the Community Fund, we will bankroll and support creators who want to develop content for Wanderhome. This will empower creators to commission art, hire consultants, and set aside valuable time to work on the projects they need. We'll also provide templates and assets for creators to make their work truly shine. (Note: The Wanderhome Community Fund is not a charity, and isn't classified as such under Kickstarter rules.)
$300,000 - Merchandise
At $300,000 we'll be adding a lot of merchandise! We'll be working with Heart of the Deernicorn to provide a variety of screenprinted merchandise--posters, hoodies, shirts, or anything else that seems good to screenprint. If there's any merchandise you want, please let us know and we'll look into it. These will probably be available on Backerkit instead of through tiers, but we'll keep you posted!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Wanderhome is completely finished, and no additional content needs to be created. However, I can imagine hiccups in production, manufacturing, and distribution. While this is Possum Creek Games' fourth project with Kickstarter, it is on a scale we haven't previously worked with, and there might be issues ensuring a speedy timeline with the many artists. While we've spent the past several months preparing for the larger scale of Wanderhome, we still admit there might be logistical complexities.

Additionally, we live on a precipice right now. The world is in the midst of a series of enormous crises, and the United States that Wanderhome will be distributed in might be very different than the United States of the summer. Our timeline has already been prepared with the acknowledgement that COVID, the rise of the far right, fallout from the American 2020 election, or goodness knows what else might meaningfully and dangerously impact the project. We will keep you informed and be very upfront throughout the process.

updates.update_userinfo: Finalize Your Shipping Address For Wanderhome
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone!
It's the season of Bright, and the rain of the earlier season has given away to the lush flowers of Bloommeadow. Outside my window the fields are covered in wildflowers and dandelions, and the creek is almost blinding with motes of light reflecting from the hot sun. I am unfortunately very heat sensitive, so I'm currently hiding indoors next to the AC and getting work done while trying not to think about how next month the heat will certainly be even worse. 
This is a pretty small update, as I don't have much to say that I didn't already say a couple weeks ago. We sent the proof back, and so the books will be shipping out as soon as a month from now, which means I'm going to start locking down address on Backerkit. And I imagine a lot of you have a question for me ...

The past month has been incredibly rainy, the soft brown of Tillsoil replaced with the soaked green of the month of Monsoon. The creek outside my house has been close to overflowing, and sometimes it feels like the sky will never stop raining at all, and I'll watch the puddles form outside my office window forever.

Hi everyone, Jay here!
It's been two weeks since the PDF release, and the snow has melted away entirely. I've been sleeping with my window open, and my roommate and I cleaned most of the kitchen to the sound of the very first cicadas of the year. I'm writing this while staring out the window at the first blooming bush covered in little yellow flowers, lit by the last dregs of setting sun across the creek.
A Busy Two Weeks

Hey y'all, Jay here!
Yesterday went amazingly, I'm so grateful and appreciative of all of your support. I don't have the time or energy to reply to all the incredibly kind things y'all are saying, but I'm reading your comments and threads and feeling deeply touched. Your care and support for Wanderhome means the world to us, and I'm so glad I can finally share this game with all of you.
Typos & PDF Update

The snow has melted into the first sprouts of new grass, I'm sitting on my back porch writing this while the creek floats by, and all the windows in my house are wide open. After the many long cold months, it's finally Tillsoil here at the Possum Creek. In Wanderhome, that means the long year is finally over, and a new year has begun. We can shed the heavy detritus that has built up on our shoulders since last Tillsoil, and embrace the joy the future has to hold for us. And since New Years is such a special holiday, I figured there was only one way we could celebrate it ...

updates.update_userinfo: The Frostbite Update: Grants, Photos, Art, and a hint of what's to come ...
updates.update_content: Oh, Frostbite. The coldest month, and somehow the longest. We've left Snowblanket behind — the fluffy snow on the ground has calcified into sheets of harsh ice. I've been wrapped up tight in blankets for weeks now, my feet basically pressed up against my ineffectual radiator. The creek is frozen solid, and I can spot from my window the occasional wanderer along its barren surface. Soon the ice will crack, and the first sprouts of green will burst up out of the ground, and the new year will begin. But until then, we bury ourselves away under sweaters and gloves and get to work!

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone, it's Jay!
This is a quick update about Backerkit! As mentioned in the last update, we'll be closing preorders on Backerkit on Monday, February 15th. At that point, any preorders will switch over to our website, your orders will be unable to be modified further, and we'll place the charge on your card. It's been a huge journey, and this means that we're finally in the home stretch.

Good afternoon everyone, it's Jay here!
I'm writing this update from my office while I watch the snow tumble down. It's supposed to snow all through the next few days, and both my house and Grubby's house are barricaded down with enough rations and snacks to last a potential power outage. I'm tossing this post together to kick off February, so that's why it's going to be a little more minimal than others. Just some other projects to back, some reminders as we go into the new year, and all that stuff!

updates.update_userinfo: The Deep Chill Update: Getting Closer
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone, the month of Snowblanket came and went in a flash, and now we're stranded deep in the endless Frostbite that seems to dominate the area I live in. I can see piles of muddy snow from my window, and I've taken to getting work done under a mound of blankets in one corner of my office. This update, like all the updates before it, is going to cover project updates, administrative information, upcoming announcements, and have some art at the end. So please grab one of the mugs in the cabinet, get yourself some hot cocoa, and let's check in about Wanderhome's progress.

campaign.story:
The quickstart gives a taste of Hellboy: The Roleplaying Game. It includes pre-generated characters, a unique story and the rules required to start your adventure. Download by clicking the image below...
 Optional Extras are additional purchases that you can add to your pledge. If you would like an Optional Extra, simply increase your pledge amount by the cost of the chosen Optional Extra. After the Kickstarter has finished, the extra funds will be added to the pledge manager where you can select your chosen items.
Created by Mantic Games, the board game publisher behind Hellboy: The Board Game, and the team at Red Scar Publishing, Hellboy: The Roleplaying Game is a totally new way to experience the inspirational work of Mike Mignola.
In this standalone game, you become a member of the B.P.R.D. and build your character from the ground up. Will you be a researcher skilled in the study of the occult, a hard-nosed B.P.R.D. security agent, a rookie with hidden supernatural powers and more… the choice is yours.
Based on the hugely popular 5th Edition, we’ve made sure that Hellboy: The Roleplaying Game truly captures the experience of the graphic novels. We’ve added new mechanics – such as Doom and Ingenuity – along with unique classes and feats that drive the agents of the B.P.R.D. in their mission to wipe out supernatural threats.
When creating your agent, you’ll have a range of skills to choose from. Will you specialise in science, technology, investigations, or become an expert in the study of the occult? Making the most of your special skills will be key in piecing together the clues and completing the case.
As you create your unique agent, you must first choose their origin, including:
 Remarkable human – The Bureau attracts skilled people from around the world with a range of training that will be vital in the field.
 Psychic – Some individuals have supernatural powers that defy explanation.
 Ghosts – Bound to the mortal realm, these agents can interact with the physical world and use their ectoplasmic powers to turn the tide.
 The Cursed - From the undying, to the demonic (horns are optional), the vampiric, and the favoured servants of supernatural entities, the cursed have unique boons…but also banes.
 The Fae - Ranging from those who have gained the unseen kingdom’s favour, such as Alice Monaghan, or the replaced individuals who remain supplanted by the shapeshifters and servants of the Fae, they have insight to illusions and old magics and tales.
With your origin and role chosen, you will also be able to fully customise your agent using a selection of unique feats. Ranging from combat to supernatural and even B.P.R.D. specific, the variety of feats on offer will allow you to add truly distinct characteristics and flavour.
Of course, you’ll be heading into the field, so make you sure you prepare adequately. The equipment chapter offers a wide range of tools to aid an agent’s investigation. There is also a unique requisition and inventory system to make your gear selection run smooth and simply.
Can't make it to your RPG session? Don't worry, with the Backup Agents system you can still be involved with the game. Just like the board game, Backup Agents can be called in when things are getting tough to help the team. 
As well as a new agent, fresh to the B.P.R.D. there is also the option to play as legendary characters, like Abe Sapien, Liz Sherman, Johann Kraus and, of course, Hellboy himself! These are all pre-generated characters and are a great place for newcomers to start, especially if they’ve never experienced an RPG but want the thrill of punching a frog monster with the Right Hand of Doom.
As the GM, you’ll be able to create smaller case files or an entire chronicle, packed with twists and turns. Tell your own adventures set within the inspirational Mignola-verse and use your favourite Hellboy: The Boardgame miniatures of iconic villains to represent the monstrous challenges you must face, like the insidious frog monsters or Rasputin himself. 
During play, the GM and players will be able to add to the narrative through the innovative Doom and Ingenuity system. Doom is generated when players fail certain tests and gives the GM a pool of resources they can spend to advance the Grand Conspiracy or provide a narrative twist. Meanwhile, Ingenuity shines when agents pass a test with a stroke of brilliance. Ingenuity has a range of uses to help players solve the mission.
Just like the boardgame, you’ll have all you need to begin your adventures in the world of Hellboy and the B.P.R.D. The 240-page book contains all the rules you’ll need for learning 5th Edition, along with detailed instructions on creating your character and an epic Case File to play through. Check out the chapter breakdown below to see what’s inside. 
Get a taste for the game with the quick start, which includes an example scenario and pre-generated characters ready to hit the tabletop. The quickstart is a great taste of the full Hellboy: The Roleplaying Game experience and, although it doesn't contain all the unique and special rules that make the RPG so engaging, it provides a fantastic starting point.
 Here you can find what will be inside the full version of the game.
 Join Mantic, Needy Cat Games and Red Scar in our play through of the scenario from the quickstart. Watch the highlights or enjoy the full play through!
Shipping is NOT included in your pledge and will be calculated/charged once the campaign has completed. We recommend waiting until the pledge manager to add the exact amount required. There is a risk that shipping may increase if any new tariffs or taxes are imposed for certain countries. See below regarding import duties and taxes.

We are dedicated to our retail partners worldwide therefore we are delighted to offer you a retail pledge for our new Kickstarter.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are a number of risks with any Kickstarter project, especially getting accurate timings for such complex products with so many components. With this project, the writing is almost finished but will need final sign off from Dark Horse Comics and Mike Mignola. Once signed off, it will them be laid out and that will also need to be signed off. We have worked with Dark Horse and Mike Mignola on Hellboy: The Board Game, so don't anticipate this being an issue. The dice need to be tooled and then manufactured, the miniatures are already tooled and will just need to be manufactured. 

We predict that we will begin shipping in May 2021 - however, the exact timing is impossible to predict and there is always the potential for delay with products produced in China. We will of course keep our backers up to date as best we can once the project closes. 

To date, we’ve successfully fulfilled 18 Kickstarter campaigns: Kings of War, DreadBall, LOKA, Mars Attacks: The Miniatures Game, Deadzone, DreadBall Xtreme, Dungeon Saga, Kings of War 2nd Edition, Deadzone: Infestation, The Walking Dead: All Out War, DreadBall Second Edition, Star Saga: The Eiras Contract, Warpath, TerrainCrate, Kings of War: Vanguard, Hellboy: The Board Game and TerrainCrate 2. We currently have just one outstanding Kickstarter: League of Infamy (due to ship in November and currently in production). 

REFUNDS
Upon request full refunds may be given within 14 days of the campaign ending, including fees. Following that time, refunds may be given minus Kickstarter and payment fees. In order to request a refund you must contact support@manticgames.com

TERMS AND CONDITIONS
By backing this campaign you acknowledge that the components, artwork and game elements may change in the final edition. This means some elements may differ from those shown here following the Kickstarter campaign. Some elements are also subject to change due to licensor approval.

If you do not complete the pledge manager within the time specified when the pledge manager is sent, you agree that your contribution to the campaign was a donation and your pledge is fulfilled. Of course, we will use our discretion on a case by case basis. Completing the pledge manager is the ONLY way for us to confirm your shipping address and pledge details, as well as making sure we hit the production timelines.

By pledging on this Kickstarter you agree that you will pay for any shipping and any import or other duties required in your country. If you refuse to pay customs or duties and do not accept the package, it will be destroyed and you will not be eligible for a refund. You also accept that you are liable for providing us with the correct shipping details upon request and we are not responsible for items lost in transit if sending to an incorrectly provided address. We also cannot ship to PO boxes and you must provide an alternative shipping in this circumstance. There is a risk that shipping may increase if any new tariffs or taxes are imposed for certain countries.

Although we are aiming to deliver Hellboy: The Roleplaying Game to Kickstarter backers before the game is available at retail, production and shipping delays can lead to delivery at the same time or following the retail release. If you do not agree to these terms, then please purchase the product once it's available at your friendly local gaming store in 2021.

Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Reusability and recyclability
"A message from our manufacturer:

At Panda, we have a commitment not only to produce the best quality games in the industry, but to operate in a sustainable and ethical manner.

We believe in producing the highest quality games in the industry, so you, your friends, and your family can play them for years to come. We also believe in reducing the environmental impact of producing games. Some steps we’ve taken in that direction include using eco-friendly inks, glues, varnishes, and wraps, as well as sourcing wood from providers who use responsible forestry practices.

We also feel strongly about recycling. Our standard cardboard components are made from 30% recycled material, our shipping cartons are crafted from 100% recycled paper pulp, and we take great care to recycle all excess plastic and paper materials instead of simply discarding them.

We are committed to continuing the push toward more sustainable manufacturing."

campaign.story:
Becoming a comic book professional isn’t like becoming a doctor or a lawyer. There’s no license you can obtain or standard path for you to follow. The business of comics is chaotic and complex and can riddle you with questions like:
How much money do I need to publish my comic?
  How much money should I charge for my comic?
  Does social media matter?
  How can I work with comic shops to market the comics?
  How do I select a printer for your books?
  THE BUSINESS OF INDEPENDENT COMIC BOOK PUBLISHING answers these questions and more. Organized in three easy-to-read parts (pre-production; production; and post-production) with chapters devoted to topics including intellectual property management; production; distribution; sales and advertising; marketing; and everything in between.
THE BUSINESS OF INDEPENDENT COMIC BOOK PUBLISHING explains the business and legal concepts of the comics industry so you can maximize your creativity. By minimizing doubt and frustration around the business end of things, you can get back to the thing you love: publishing and creating comics!
Gamal Hennesey
Comic book attorney and business consultant Gamal Hennessy taps into more than 2 decades of experience to break down the complex comics business into layman’s terms. When he’s not practicing law, Hennesey writes novels and provides both practical business advice and inspiration.  THE BUSINESS OF INDEPENDENT COMIC BOOK PUBLISHING is edited by Aftershock editor-in chief Mike Marts, and features a foreword from writer and Heavy Metal executive editor Joseph P Illidge. It’s a book by pros, for pros and aspiring creators alike. If you’re serious about a career in comics, this book is an essential read. After all: who wouldn’t want to create the next Superman (and retain ownership of the intellectual property)?
The book will guide you through the following:
Turning your creative ideas into published comics
  Developing intellectual property that you own and control
  Creating a business plan tailored for your specific publishing goals
  Finding and hiring a professional team to create your book and support your business
  Understanding the distribution process
  Creating comics—that you can be proud of—on time and under budget
  Using your comics to generate multiple streams of revenue
  Building a long-term relationship with your readers
  As acclaimed writer and editor Joseph P Illidge writes in the introduction to THE BUSINESS OF INDEPENDENT COMIC BOOK PUBLISHING:
“We are living in the time of a global paradigm shift, from a business culture that wanted to marginalize, trivialize, and ignore the stories and lives of people from diverse communities, lifestyles, life conditions, and gender identifications, to a global corporate complex that invites new stories, diverse narratives, and creators of different cultures.
The business relationships of the future will be determined by an understanding of mutual value between the creator and the publisher, making it more important than ever that both sides are armed with the knowledge to protect their intellectual properties.
THE BUSINESS OF INDEPENDENT COMIC BOOK PUBLISHING is the roadmap to a secure creative future, a journey that begins with personal and tough questions.Questions requiring the aspiring entrepreneur to be self-aware and honest….
The comic book industry, and business of intellectual properties based on characters and worlds, can be both exciting and perilous. A journey of great importance and substantial reward is best undertaken with the aid of a guide, and the dawning clarity of a clear path.
You have found your guide, and the means through which to illuminate your path.”
Comic Pros & Cons' Derek Becker, Gamal, and Dirk Vanover of Vanover Legal, LLC
Testimonials for Gamal Hennessey
“Hard-working, patient, keen eye to detail, and always on your side. That’s just a few words that described my experience with Gamal and his services. I felt very positive with the work he did and when the need comes about, I would go to him in a heartbeat.”— Tim Smith, acclaimed artist for Black, Marvel, DC and Archie Comics
“Gamal has provided me with excellent advice on potential publishing contracts on several occasions, and he steered me away from some deals that just weren’t right for my own goals. As a result, I was able to place my creator-owned properties in better situations. I highly recommend Gamal for any comics creator facing the legalese of a publisher contract.”— Rob Anderson, Writer of Creature Cops, Rex the Zombie Killer and My Little Pony
“Deadline oriented expert. Innovative, strong and detail oriented professional. He is not only a responsible and hard working General Counsel but also an inspiring professional. I have had the pleasure of working with Gamal since we both left CPM and I have seen him turn his passion into his profession. It's amazing to work with such a person.”—Sara Erickson, Creative Director Design & Development, Hasbro
“Gamal was the first attorney who bothered to explain my contracts to me. He wasn’t just interested in tweaking language, he wanted to increase my understanding of contracts going forward.”— Andy Schmidt, President of Comics Experience
“Gamal is very knowledgeable about IP and Entertainment law and very professional, but that’s just the minimum. He went above and beyond the call and he took the time to make sure I felt listened to and not only that I understood things, but that I felt understood as well. I have already recommended several people to talk to Mr. Hennessy and I hope to work with him for years to come!”—Ian Powers, President of Dragon's Gate Entertainment, Ltd.
“I went to Gamal to help me a create work for hire contract and to give me a legal analysis to protect my work. He was incredibly helpful and explained things thoroughly in my consultation. He was also reasonably priced in comparison to many others that I’d inquired after which was a huge help for a small business owner.”—Jack Wallace, President of Disposable Fiction Inc.
“I hired Gamal to help me put together a boilerplate contract for use as a freelance writer, so I would have clear terms to hold clients to. Gamal directed the conversation, asked me the right questions about what was important to me, and helped me put together a contract that has since served me well (and that I haven't once had to enforce). He was quick, responsive, and far more affordable than just about any other lawyer you're likely to find. I would absolutely recommend his services.”— Brandon Carbaugh, Author of Black Knight and The Wish
"Highly recommended."—  Chris Lewis, Author of Karma Police
Why We’re Bringing This Project to Kickstarter
The plan was to release THE BUSINESS OF INDEPENDENT COMIC BOOK PUBLISHING at New York ComicCon. It’s unlikely there will be cons anytime soon, so we’re turning to Kickstarter to release the book. Think of this campaign as a debut at a digital Artist Alley!
We’re raising money to help offset printing costs and marketing costs associated with this book.

campaign.story:
Once an age, a mystical wind lifts the veil that separates the spiritual realm from our physical world. Whimsical seraphs, drawn to the vigor of an ancient forest, descend through the clouds, once again, to play their centennial game. This time, however, the moonlight beams reflecting on the foliage will draw the seraphs deep inside the forest, to get a glimpse of the unseen. An enchanted world brightened by a gleam of moonlight hiding the most ancient spirits in the dense forest waits to be discovered.
Spirits of the Forest: Moonlight is an expansion for the base game that adds a scenario based co-op mode that can also be played in solitaire, and an alternative multiplayer variant that can be played up to four players.
Join the Thundergryph family! Interact with us to earn Thunders and redeem them for rewards while planting trees. We are excited about this opportunity to engage more with you and we are looking forward to reveal everything we have planned for the future!
If you are part of the club, use this special code "MOONLIGHT" to get 500 Thunders!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
TIMELINE IS EVERYTHING.

Shaping the games together with our backers is one of the most interesting things of being a Kickstarter creator, but all of this additional content needs to be meticulously calculated before the campaign starts to add enough buffer time to the communicated timeline, while still being unaware of how successful a project will be.

Revising the timeline affects your perception towards us and affects the company stability by postponing future releases. We commit to do our best to fulfill as previously calculated.

Unforeseen problems like the current Pandemic can happen and we commit to be transparent and thorough with our progress.

MAKING A GAME TOGETHER.

When you back one of our campaigns, you are not pre-ordering a product, you are really helping us make the game happen. This is a feeling we don’t want to lose, but we also understand that a game needs to be fulfilled at the right pace.

For Spirits of the Forest: Moonlight, we segmented the potential success of the project into four different outcomes and we have decided to establish the proper buffer based on the best-case scenario. This gives us room to listen to our community without compromising what we love the most about launching on Kickstarter: shaping a game together.

WE LEARN. WE HEAR YOU.

Starting 2019, we decided to split our team into groups. We would be working at the same time on different projects and we would request help from freelancers if needed, without compromising our main tasks as a team.

Today, after 7 campaigns under our belt, we are much more solid as a team, having a greater confidence on facing the challenges that the future holds, and we owe all of this to you and your support towards our projects.
We will always be grateful and we will always be prepared to listen and learn from your advice.

campaign.story:
Update on VAT & Sales Taxes
We've spoken to 3 international region-friendly VAT/tax experts, and guess what? It's complicated, confusing, and all about to change in 2021 when our game ships and the tax assessments need to be made. Loopholes are closing, regulations are tightening, previous tax-minimization schemes are disappearing, but we can say we're happy to help out as much as possible. Here's how:
We will pay for any VAT / tax fees on any shipping charges. Backers will only pay required sales/VAT taxes for their Core or Deluxe game purchases (and any add-ons). This avoids the dreaded double-tax stack-up that many backers face when including shipping charges into the tax equation.
Retailers in the UK/EU: you may have to pay VAT on your 6-pack bundle, but this is a recoverable expense, and will also depend on whether your store and our chosen distribution partner's warehouse are located in the same country. We should have better information on that when the pledge manager opens and once our final EU/UK distribution partner is selected.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our team of creative professionals has combined decades of experience in developing products for mass production. Even though this may be our first tabletop game, we're being advised by some of the top leaders in the industry who have helped guide our every step. Of course, we're also using top-tier manufacturing and fulfillment partners. 

That said, we live in a dynamic world which is currently being tested like never before. Changes in manufacturing partners, paper costs, shipping fluctuations, global economics: all can affect our final outcome and schedule. But be confident that all issues that may arise during our development process, from schedule delays to component quality, will be quickly and clearly shared with our backers via frequent updates. We're in this together now!

DISCLAIMER: as we continue to develop the game for mass-production, the artwork, components, names, and likenesses shown in the above illustrations are subject to change.

campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
By having a highly expandable and upgrade-able game system, The Shivers will always be new and evolving. The game has an intrinsic quality that will last through generations, not a quick fad that gets played a couple times then sits on a shelf (or worse, goes into the trash).
Sustainable materials
Our paper pop-up constructions and manuals will use FSC-type paper certified by FSC (Forest Stewardship Council), which ensures proper sustainable forest management is used to harvest trees for paper.
Environmentally friendly factories
Our pop-up manufacturing factory is accredited by FSC.org to ensure sustainable forestry and conservation practices to support their paper supply chain.
Something else
Our unique Story Card system of creating new episodes allows for players to print episodes on their own home printers (this functionality will be enabled on future expansions). This means no burden to supply chain or environmental impact from international shipping, as printing of new episodes will be on-demand, local, and with much less environmental impact.

Welcome to the Kickstarter campaign for the second volume of Supercade!

Introduction
Two decades ago, I embarked on a journey to create the most comprehensive resource on the history of video and computer games... a passion project that evolved into Supercade and slowly consumed my life.
Cover and poster frame Dan McCoy/Rainbow
Supercade: A Visual History of the Videogame Age 1971-1984 was the first book of its kind, a detailed history of the era with profiles of games and their creators, full-color images of vintage arcades, 8-bit home consoles, promotional ads, and 80s pop culture that transported readers back to the golden age. 
The first volume of Supercade was published by the MIT Press and was well-received, with accolades in such diverse publications as Bookforum and Playboy, a five-star Amazon review from Defender creator Eugene Jarvis, and an excerpt in Wired magazine. It was named one of the Top Ten Books of 2001 by LA Weekly, has been used as a primary text at leading game design programs, made the annual Editor’s Choice list on Amazon.com, was nominated for an IPPY Award, and fueled the retrogaming renaissance that has since steamrolled mainstream culture. 
Supercade also triggered a new wave of classic game books and theory that transformed the perception of videogames from kids' toys into a medium finally taken seriously as an art form, with several games profiled now in the permanent collection of MoMA. 
After its release, I was asked by readers and retro game fans when I’d do a sequel. I honestly never thought it was important... until now.
In the years since Supercade was first published, the next generation of gamers have come of age. They were raised in the aftermath of the crash, the grand arcade palaces of the early 80s replaced by battered Neo Geo cabinets in laundromats and the few remaining game parlors begging for play. These are the children of the Nintendo Entertainment System — the home console that saved the US game industry after Atari effectively destroyed it — who grew up on DuckTales, New Coke, and America Online.
Over the past two decades they’ve expressed an intense passion for the games of their youth — Street Fighter, Space Harrier, and Super Mario — which are now equally, if not even more relevant than the games of the golden age. So to celebrate them I propose... 
The new volume will chronicle the next era of gaming history, beginning with the NES and including the release of Sega Master System, SNES, Genesis, TurboGrafx-16, Amiga, Game Boy, Atari Jaguar, N64, PlayStation, Xbox and more, as well as the companies, creators, and technologies that drove us into the digital future.
Image courtesy Nintendo of America Inc.
I’d been negotiating with the previous publisher for years to do the sequel, though we were sadly unable to agree upon terms. Fortunately, I retained the rights and am free to publish the book myself... but I'll need your help.
Supercade was an expensive book to print and I don't want to compromise on quality. The next volume needs to be even BETTER than the original.
I'll be establishing a new publishing imprint to release Supercade v.2 and hopefully more books in the future with a focus on games and dedication to awesome design... if this campaign is successful there will be more to come, including a series of visual histories of iconic game developers and franchises. 
Cover image will be revealed to Kickstarter backers after launch
I wanted to launch the new book on Kickstarter not only to help offset the costs, but also to build awareness and allow the gaming community to be a part of the process this time. There were some serious omissions in the first book (ahem, Quantum) that may have been avoided if more eyes were on the content. Your feedback will be critical to the evolution of the book and the greater the participation, the greater the next volume of Supercade will be.
Please help make this book a reality! 

Overview
The next volume of Supercade will chronicle the period from 1985-2001 and will be even more comprehensive than the first with over 450 full-color pages. I'll work closely with backers and contributors to ensure everyone's favorite games and systems are included. The book will be similar in style and format to the original, though with more radical 90s flair, so the two volumes will make a matched set.
Planning to ship the books in Fall 2021 to coincide with the 20th Anniversary of the original Supercade, which was released in September 2001.

P R I N T I N G
I've partnered with one of the premier art book printers in Europe to ensure that this volume will be of even higher quality than the original... from the design to the printing, no expense will be spared in the production.
Here are the specs:
10" (25.4 cm) square
450+ pages
4C process throughout
Premium coated paper
Matte cover lamination
Perfect binding
4 lbs (2 kg)
Featuring premium paper stock with stretch goal upgrades including metallic foil, gloss varnish, PMS spot colors, and gatefold inserts, this volume will level up in every conceivable way.
For the text we've selected 135gsm GardaMatt Smooth, a woodfree coated paper with an ultra smooth surface and exceptional whiteness that's acid-free, dramatically reducing the likelihood of age-related damage.
The first volume of Supercade contained some unfortunate printing errors which may have been prevented if I’d been permitted to go on press. Be assured that I will be there at every step of the process to ensure there are no missing pages (seriously, that really happened... look closely at "1979") or other production issues.
I’ll be on site this time, laptop in hand, to correct problems as they arise.
The only real criticism of the first book was inconsistent image quality, the result of receiving low res jpegs at the last minute for some features and not having enough time or resources to source better scans. For this volume I've planned a longer schedule, will recruit a photo editor to help wrangle art assets, and will take extra care to make sure all images are of the highest fidelity for optimum print quality.  
We will be printing an open Softcover Edition, total run to be determined by backer support (minimum initial run of 1000 copies), plus an EXCLUSIVE limited Hardcover Edition for campaign backers with premium end papers and Smyth-sewn binding. Rare hardcover copies of the original Supercade sell for over $250 online.
Hardcover Edition will not be sold on Amazon!

F U N D I N G
One of the biggest struggles with the first volume of Supercade was not having an adequate production budget... I made up some of the difference personally, but still lacked the resources or support required to produce the book I had envisioned. I’d designed the original Supercade with spot colors and gatefold inserts that were omitted from the final product. This is one of the reasons I chose to self-publish and launch the sequel on Kickstarter.
I wanted the next volume of Supercade to not only meet, but EXCEED expectations.
The initial funding goal is set at the dead minimum required to produce the lowest print run of books and rewards with fulfillment, taxes, and Kickstarter fees (8-10%) added. It includes no compensation for my time or additional costs. That said, the more this project surpasses that goal the more awesome it will be... stretch goals will allow me to expand the scope, upgrade the specs, and increase the print run.
Most important, funds raised beyond the production requirements of the press will go toward the stewardship of the Supercade Collection, supporting the preservation and restoration of rare games and allowing me to produce more public exhibitions.

Contributors
As with the original Supercade, I'll ask leading academics, influencers, and journalists to write about their favorite games and systems... some familiar names will return and new friends will be invited. So far I have recruited "Art of Atari" author Tim Lapetino, Edge magazine contributing editor Chris Schilling, "I Am Error" author Nathan Altice, Kotaku co-founder Brian Crecente, "Play Anything" author and game designer Ian Bogost, "The Art of Video Games" author and curator Chris Melissinos, Funomena founder Robin Hunicke, Arcade Tokyo's Roland Ingram, "Power-Up" author Chris Kohler, Boss Fight Books founder Gabe Dunham, Starlords developer Mike Mika, former Kill Screen editor Chris Priestman, Boing Boing co-creator Mark Frauenfelder, and YACHT frontwoman Claire L. Evans, among others.
This time I also plan to reach out to more modern game developers to discuss the games that most influenced them, as well as some celebrities with a profound love of games. These features will be presented as sidebar interviews or included as part of the Epilogue. So far I have commitments from Tim Schafer (Brütal Legend), Tomonobu Itagaki (Dead or Alive), Eugene Jarvis (NARC), Masaya Matsuura (PaRappa the Rapper), John Romero (Doom), Warren Spector (Deus Ex), and Invader.
That's just a start.
It was devastating to lose contributor Ralph Baer, creator of the Magnavox Odyssey and author of the Foreword to the original Supercade, who passed away in 2014. I was so fortunate to spend time with him, poring through his archives and hearing his amazing stories first hand.
Although it would seem an impossible task to find someone worthy to follow, I'm thrilled to share that the Foreword to the next volume will be written by Xbox creator Seamus Blackley... the omega to his alpha.
Content
Picking up where the original Supercade left off, the sequel will cover the years 1985 through 2001, with a focus on the Nintendo Entertainment System, Sega Master System, SNES, Genesis, TurboGrafx-16, Game Boy, 3DO, Amiga, Atari Jaguar, the launch of Sony’s PlayStation, Sega Saturn, Virtual Boy, N64, sixth gen consoles, the rise of PC and online gaming, 90s arcades, and so much more. 
Image courtesy Sony
This volume will explore the profound shift that occurred during this era as home consoles met and rapidly surpassed the technical ability of arcade games to become the dominant force in interactive entertainment.
It will be similar in style and design to the original Supercade, loaded with full-bleed spreads of game imagery, profiles of developers and publishers, interviews with game designers, and essays on the most significant games and systems of the era, as well as obscure games that were critically and historically influential.
Each year will highlight the companies, home consoles, franchises, computers, arcade games, technology, media, and cultural events that defined that moment in time.

Creator
I'm the author of Supercade: A Visual History of the Videogame Age 1971-1984, former production director and contributing editor of Wired, curator, creative director, and steward of the Supercade Collection.
What started as an effort to preserve all of the games and consoles featured in the pages of Supercade has morphed into an arcade museum of sorts in Los Angeles, and the collection has since been featured at Flynn's Arcade in California Adventure, on The Big Bang Theory, at the Strong Museum of Play, and in the pages of Time. 
Images of the Supercade Collection
The games have featured prominently in exhibitions curated for Soho House titled ARCADIA and at BEYOND THE STREETS, the definitive survey of graffiti and street art, for which I also contributed the essay Graffiti X Games in the exhibition catalog.   
I've written about videogames, art, and technology for myriad publications over the years — Wired, Electric Playground, Official US Playstation Magazine, Gear, Electronic Gaming Monthly, Time Out, and Retro Gamer to name a few — served as an awards judge for E3, and organized or hosted panels at classic gaming conventions and game industry events including DICE and GDC.
Games are my lifelong passion and I'm so grateful for the opportunity to share this project with you. Thanks!

Risks and challenges
As the former production director of Wired magazine and prepress consultant for Wired Ventures publishing division, HardWired Books, I have extensive experience in high-end print production and have successfully shipped and delivered millions of books in my career on time and on budget.

That said, there are inherent challenges in a project of this scope... missed deadlines, contributor issues, press problems, cost overruns, shipping delays, acts of god... therefore I've added extra time into the schedule, increased budgets, and secured commitments from all print, logistics, and rewards partners in advance in hopes of mitigating potential headaches.

The global pandemic of Covid-19 may also further complicate production and logistics, though I've been assured by my partners that operations will not be seriously impacted. 

The target shipping date is September 2021, but bear in mind that this is only an estimate and there may be delays. Due to the logistics of international shipping, backers in different countries may receive their rewards sooner than others. Some countries may also not be deliverable owing to Covid-19 shipping restrictions. I'll be working with an experienced fulfillment provider with warehouses in the USA and UK to minimize delays as much as possible. 

Please be sure to check in throughout the campaign for updates to this page. I will diligently communicate any and all issues to backers as quickly as possible and will do everything I can to stay on schedule and have books delivered in time for the holidays.

Thank you so much for your support...

campaign.story:
The dreaded Black Death has descended upon the town of Bristol. You are racing down the streets, desperate to escape into the safety of the countryside. If your cart is the first out of town you and your cart-mates win! Or do you? Some villagers on your cart may secretly already have the plague. If you leave town with a plagued villager on your cart, you will catch the plague and lose! What will you do to make sure that doesn’t happen? And who will you trust (or betray) along the way? 
Bristol 1350 is a social deduction and light strategy game for 1-9 players. Learn in 10 minutes and play in 20-40 minutes.
 Thank you to all of our backers for an incredible campaign!
If you missed the campaign you can make a late pledge here until fall 2020.
Backers can view project updates for information about delivery and add-ons.
Please visit our website or Facebook for the latest information on Bristol 1350.
We are excited to offer a Deluxe edition of the game! Depending on later demand, this Deluxe edition may be exclusive to Kickstarter, and at most it will be in rare distribution or only available at conventions. Beyond the core Standard edition of the game (+9 extra Kickstarter characters + stretch goals) the Deluxe edition includes: 
The 6 Deluxe coins to scale.
Every Kickstarter backer of Bristol 1350 (Standard or Deluxe) will receive 9 extra character cards in a special foil pack to add to their core copy of the game (for 18 total characters!) These characters will not be available after Kickstarter and are our way of saying thank you. We will reveal a new character every few days in the section below!    


We have upgraded every single component in the game with the space available in the box. Each upgrade represents our dedication to making high-quality and high-performing games at an affordable price. While we hope to include most of the upgrades listed above in future editions, they are only guaranteed for this first Kickstarter Standard and Deluxe printing of the game.   
The level of textural detail on the book, front and back, is kind of mouthwatering.
Bristol 1350 is a social deduction (lying & backstabbing) and light strategy game for 1-9 players. Learn in 10 minutes and play in 20-40 minutes. The game is enjoyable at all player counts, with lower counts leaning towards strategy and higher counts leaning towards social deduction, lying, and trust.
In the game each player begins in one of the three carts behind the starting line. Your goal is to be on the first cart to escape from the town. However, if anyone on your cart has the plague when you finish, everyone on that cart dies of the plague! Play continues until an all-healthy cart crosses or until everyone has the plague.   
You can view the full rules and print and play at this link. Note that the rulebook design is still underway, and if you want to play the print and play you'll need to construct your own dice and carts.
You can play for free online with Tabletop Simulator or with Tabletopia. 
As they become available, translations of the rulebook will be available on our website. We currently have translations available in French, German, Spanish, Italian, Dutch, and Greek. 
Some of the intriguing mechanics are discussed by The Board Game Critic in this video. 
A full playthrough of a 5-player game can be seen at this link. 
A full playthrough of a 1-player game can be seen at this link. 
Bristol 1350 is Volume 4 in the Dark Cities Series! Each Volume is a stand-alone game that comes in the same sized faux book box, focuses on a particular city and year, and includes a dark or mysterious element in its game play. Each game accommodates at least 2-9 players. 
Games in the Dark Cities Series have already sold over 150,000 copies and are now played around the world! We're already hard at work on Volume 5, and we will continue expanding the series. We know your game closet is a mess. Start your bookshelf collection of games with the Dark Cities Series! Each of these games is available in certain reward levels and as add-ons.
You can add an unlimited number of copies of any games in the Dark Cities Series to your pledge! Just add the amounts listed above and after the campaign you'll select which extra games you'd like to be added to your order based on how much extra money you pledged. If you have any questions, please see the FAQ section, post a comment, or shoot us a message. 
Your shipping cost does not increase for add-ons regardless of your location or the amount of extra games you order. You will receive all add-on games at the same time that all of the Kickstarter rewards are received (estimated delivery April 2021).  
The 18 original character paintings by Sarah Keele are available to purchase! The paintings are 8 x 10 inches and made with mixed media acrylic on masonite board. You can see some of the intricate details below. Email sarahmkeele@gmail.com for more details or to check availability of a specific character.    
Though this is not an add-on you can get through the campaign, the people at Next Level Board Gaming are selling 3D-printer files so that you can create an EPIC 3D version of the Bristol 1350 board that you can use with your copy of the game. You can see more details by clicking the picture below.
Regardless of order size or add-ons, shipping costs are $6 USA, $8 UK/EU, $10 Australia/Canada, $12 for the rest of the world. We work hard to find the best shipping rates out there, and we subsidize some of the shipping costs so that you don't have to pay as much. 
To avoid extra VAT or customs fees, games will ship to depots around the world (USA, UK, EU, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, Hong Kong) before being shipped to you. For non-depot countries, in most cases there will not be extra VAT costs because the price of our games is low enough to avoid the duties threshold.
If your order is lost or returned due to unforeseen circumstances, we will attempt to reship your game one time, free of charge. If you provided incorrect shipping information, you will be responsible for the reshipment fee. Due to unreliable mail systems, we will not perform reshipments destined for Brazil, Ukraine, Russia, or South Africa. 
These days there are many projects that wait to charge shipping until AFTER the campaign ends in order to shift the risk from the creators to the backers. We have "done our homework" in regards to shipping costs and are prepared to take on unexpected risk. What you pay now for shipping is ALL that you will pay for this reward.
DISCOUNTED PRICE | Normal MSRP of the Standard Edition will be $25. If we release the Deluxe Edition to the public it will be at least $45. We also offer the best shipping prices we can during the Kickstarter campaign.
KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE CARDS | The 9 Kickstarter Exclusive character cards (for a total of 18 characters in your game) will never be available again and will be unavailable to the public. Additionally, campaign stretch goals, as well as the Deluxe version, are only guaranteed through Kickstarter.
EARLY ACCESS | Receive and play the game before anyone else in the world. 
JOIN OUR TEAM | Get first-in-line knowledge and insight into the project, and a direct line of communication to us as the creators. We will take your feedback into account before launching production.
We fell in love with the Kickstarter community when we launched our first game, Salem, back in 2015. Those backers are the ones that allowed us to quit our day jobs and make games full time. We've had more great experiences with the launch of Tortuga 1667 and Deadwood 1876. The feedback, support, trust, and positivity from the community is incredible. We consider each Kickstarter backer to be a close ally in our game-making endeavors and we'll do everything we can to protect your trust in us.
Our thoughts are with those around the world suffering from Covid-19. We have been planning and preparing for this launch for over two years, but it has coincidentally lined up with the pandemic that our world now faces. We considered delaying the project but after a lot of thought and encouragement from our community we ultimately decided to launch. As with all our games, part of this game's purpose is to educate about the history of the world. Bristol 1350 explores the history of the worst pandemic our world has ever faced: the Black Death. The people of 1350 faced huge challenges, and today those challenges are perhaps more relatable than ever. We will be donating $3,000 from our own pockets to Action Against Hunger to assist in getting food and medicine for those most in need. (Per Kickstarter regulations, funds raised within Kickstarter will not be directly donated and have no effect on the donation amount).
This project is promoted by Green Inbox
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our 4th project, and our first 3 have been delivered on time and as promised. Our factory is at full capacity and our shipping partners are optimistic that by next year when this is delivered there will be no insurmountable issues in regards to Covid-19. However, these are unique times and we will keep our backers updated on any unforeseen issues that may arise. As you can see from our photos, samples of the game have already been produced by our manufacturers and designs are complete. We just need to raise the funds and say go! 

Salem 1692: "I have backed over 46 projects and I just wanted to say this project has been an absolute delight to have been a backer for. Your updates have been insightful, but not overbearing. You clearly put a lot of time, thought, and effort into this game and it really shows. I was impressed with how fast this project came together. It was a fast, well organized campaign. Kudos to you and thank you for a wonderful end product. I couldn't be happier." -Snuffles00

Tortuga 1667: "I backed this and another project that ended a day prior. The way things have gone with the other project have given me an even greater appreciation for not only the great game you made, but the well executed Kickstarter. Thank you again!" -Bored Gamer

Deadwood 1876: "Thank you again for such a wonderful campaign and game! All your games are creative, refreshing, and each have unique mechanics that keep the fun going for hours. The historical component too makes for an added boon. Thank you also for a unique genuineness you bring to your customer experience. It is a prize how you answer each customer individually and how you care about the quality of your interactions as much as you care about the quality of your product and gameplay. I’m excited for the fourth city and experience!" -Steph Troyer

After the campaign we will use a pledge manager system called CrowdOx to send a survey to the email associated with your Kickstarter account. You will be able to choose your add-on orders and provide your shipping information at that time. If you change addresses before we ship your rewards, you will be able to access your survey up until a few weeks before we ship. Please never hesitate to message us directly with comments, concerns, or suggestions.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
We use high-quality components (wood pawns, neoprene playmat, magnetic book box) so that the game will last a long time.
Reusability and recyclability
Unlike most games, Bristol 1350 uses zero punchboards or plastic pop-outs. Nothing that you receive in the game needs to be thrown away.
Sustainable materials
Our factory uses recycled materials to produce the game box.

campaign.story:
HEL: The Last Saga is a cooperative fantasy adventure viking board game, created by the duo behind SMOG: Rise of Moloch by CMON, game designer David Rakoto and art director Christophe Madura.
The game offers players the chance to lead a small group of Heroes, each with their own rank, occupation and background. Despite all these differences, these survivors will have to cooperate if they want to survive the cold, hunger and hostile threats, but they will also have to unveil the mysteries surrounding the disappearance of the colony founded by their lost King to be worthy of the Saga that will retain their name.
HEL: The Last Saga is a highly narrative campaign game, with paragraphs to read according to what the players accomplish. The game mechanisms mix exploration, tactical combat with resource management. Storytelling and background are ubiquitous and replayability comes from the unique way you have to replay a failed mission.
Click on the image to know more about the HEL-in
Click on the picture to know more about this add-on
Click on the picture to know more about this add-on
Click on the picture to know more about this Add-On
Click on the picture to know more about this Add-On
Click on the picture to know more about this Add-On


 NARRATIVE ALL THE WAY
Tell. Listen. Choose or test. Everywhere. Anytime. The game engine is based on the discovery or the triggering of events that lead to narrative chapters. These events can be hidden on the game board, placed on the turn track or on any other game component. The story  unfolds as you resolve these chapters by making choices, performing tests or simply listening.
UNIQUE HEROES
Play strong characters. Each Clan member has their own story, strengths and weaknesses. You will learn about them as you play them, by acquiring new individual Hero cards in a non linear way. Some of these cards will be the result of choices you made during the adventure.
SCENARIO BASED 
Conquer a mysterious land, found a colony and resolve mysteries. Scouting missions, search or rescue parties, raids, escape, defence, investigation, or intrigue. Whether it's located on the modular and expandable wilderness game board or in the colony camp, each scenario provides a new challenge to overcome in order to gain access to the next scenario.
PREDATORS & PREY 
Face hidden threats, which are controlled by a predation-based AI system. Use your perception and your pets to detect these threats before you face them, as an ambush can be fatal. Your enemies are vicious enough to target the most vulnerable or the highest ranking members of your group.
WORSHIP SYSTEM
Beg your gods to help you. Use your willpower, offerings, and the fervour of your companions to obtain permanent modifiers that will benefit all who share your faith.
SURVIVAL... 
Exploit scarce resources to survive and keep your clan together. Hunt for food. Collect that precious wood that will be a source of heat and an essential material for your constructions. But above all, maintain high morale to avoid sinking into defeat.
...HORROR
Night will eventually fall. For months. Second half of the campaign will take place into darkness. But only for Heroes who survive long enough to see the sunset. Forget every little knowledge or petty victory acquired. New rules. New threats. New objectives.

The USA, European Union, Canada, Australia, and UK will be “Shipping Friendly”. Backers from these countries will not pay import taxes.
Shipping is not charged as part of this Kickstarter campaign but is instead done so on the pledge manager after the campaign ends. The shipping price you will pay is based on the weight of your pledge and the country to which it is to be shipped.
The above is a list of rough estimates for shipping. These estimates are based on the costs for our previous campaigns and an estimated final weight of the Core pledge at 5kg. Keep in mind that adding optional buys or additional pledge levels will raise the weight of your pledge and may also then raise the final shipping price.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
General

This is our ninth Kickstarter and we’ve learned a lot from our previous eight. Producing thousands of products and coordinating their delivery to homes across the planet is a complex business, and there are many things which could go wrong. This is why we build in as much time for the unforeseen as possible. We want to ensure that we have the space to deal with any unexpected setbacks and still get your game to you before the estimated delivery date.

To give you a frame of reference for exactly when you will get your game, Mythic Battles: Pantheon, Time of Legends: Joan of Arc season 1 and Reichbusters: Projekt Vril have been delivered. Super Fantasy Brawl is being printed and ongoing for a delivery by the summer, Solomon Kane, a big scope project, is at the printer and will be delivered in two waves this year. Time of Legends: Joan of Arc season 1.5 is on track and the first elements will be soon sent to production. Enchanters: East Quest development is finished and is going to production now and Steamwatchers is on track and will go to production this summer.
For all our games, we communicate with our backers with regular updates at least once a week, plus our posts on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and our videos on YouTube.

Please note that the components, component counts, quality and rules, are all work in progress and subject to change.

Delivery

Our experience in our previous KS has shown us that there can be variances in terms of timing and remaining in schedule when it comes to anything produced in China, such as:
Production delays
Shipping delays
Customs delays
At the same time there are also the unpredictable factors; recently it was the Coronavirus outbreak, but there can be others such as weather conditions, strikes and others.

So, you've got a game and you want to get it into the world and onto people's tables. You want to run a Kickstarter campaign, but you don't know where to start. Or maybe you've run a campaign before, but you want to get better for the next time around.
Well, this is the book for you.
In these pages, you'll find wisdom and advice from some of the most successful Kickstarter creators of all time. And they'll show you how to go from zero to funded.
