campaign.story:
A coming of age story and illustrated novel inspired by the South Pacific.
Good for an adventurous someone of any age, "Naiya and the Foxdragon" explores the magic of leaving childhood behind, and that of when you finally start to realize the world around you is more intertwined than you first thought.
Naiya is a young teen who has been hiding from her past and her unkind uncle most of her life until she befriends a foxdragon named Aru. When the last of the magic orbs that once powered their city is depleted, she faces her fears and embarks on an unexpected journey into the heart of the jungle to save her home.
Along the way, Naiya discovers her own self-worth as she and her foxdragon friend navigate the treacherous jungle and learn about her own relationship with the world’s magic.
Aru (left) & Naiya (right)
 Naiya - An independent young teen of 14 years, Naiya loves to spend her time outside. She finds freedom in climbing rooftops and hidden passageways on her errands within the city as a house servant to a spice merchant. Always curious about the greater world, she enjoys learning through books. Naiya has a soft spot for animals, caring for those she finds abandoned in the city.
Aru - A young foxdragon brought to the trade city of Ora, Aru has no recollection of his past. His curiosity and fondness for food can, at times, get him into a bit of trouble. Aru is a loyal friend & companion. 
 While Naiya and Aru's story can stand on words alone, the illustrations throughout the book add glimpses into their world for a more immersive experience.
Each chapter begins with a unique full-page textile pattern, and the following spreads contain a variety of vignette, half and full-page spread illustrations to complement the text.
The book is a standard comic book size at 6.625 x 10.5 inches, chosen for comfortable chapter reading as well as an immersion into imagery that flows from page to page. "Naiya and the Foxdragon" is 282 pages long, 24 chapters and 78,000 words.

The outlining stage of "Naiya and the Foxdragon", my studio space and a thumbnail sheet of all the pages + illustrations in the book.
About Naomi VanDoren: I am a visual artist and author based in Northern California. For the past six years, I have been working independently as an artist on creator-owned projects like my yearly art books, which I have Kickstarted in the past.
In my storytelling, I strive to capture the adventures of my youth in the jungles of Indonesia and pay homage to the beautiful culture in which I spent over 14 years. "Naiya and the Foxdragon," and the tropical world of Antarah in which it takes place, was born out of a desire to fully dive into storytelling and create an immersive world using inspiration from where I grew up. It also was born from a love of the fantasy genre, epic quests that sweep you off your feet and endearing characters you feel a deep connection with.
If you're curious about my writing style I encourage you to check out the first chapter of "Naiya and the Foxdragon" which takes place 10 years before the rest of the book, when Naiya is still a young child.
If you're a fan of the Ghibli films, Avatar the Last Airbender, and even The Hobbit, I think you'll enjoy this book too.
Why an illustrated novel? I've loved reading and writing just as much as I love art. Rather than create a book that was art-focused, or heavily writing focused I decided I wanted a book that celebrated both in a way that allowed a reader to escape deeper into the world that I've created.
 This project is going to print as soon as the Kickstarter campaign ends!
I've spent the last 2+ years working on this project so that I can bring you something that is nearly complete and ready for print. As a Kickstarter backer myself, I appreciate creators that are transparent about the status of their projects. In that spirit, here is what has been done with "Naiya and the Foxdragon", what is being wrapped up, timelines for printing etc.
Writing: All of the writing from outlines through the final draft of the book are complete. I've worked with a professional developmental editor twice to perfect the story, run the project through beta readers and had a copy editor proof the book. The only thing that I plan to do in regards to the text is one final round of quick copy editing (1/2 way through already) for that last look as well as adding any words I find to complete the appendix page.
Illustrations: All of the illustrations have been designed and are in their final form linework-wise. This involved reference gathering, some 3D designs for some of the locations, character design, and lots of time for the composition and inking process - all of which are now complete. I'm going through the bulk of each illustration and adding the final touches of color to each (1/2 way through this process at this point). I estimate this to take 2 weeks while the campaign is live. Check-in on the status here.
Design: The full book has been designed from a rough draft to the final draft. While I have a background in graphic design, this book is being handled by a designer that has publishing experience. The only thing that remains in this stage of the project is to typeset the file and export it for print.
Printing: I'm working with a printer currently and finalizing files once the campaign is over. I've received a blank sample copy of the paper that will be used with the book along with the cloth for the Special Edition.
Timeline after the campaign ends: The timeline for the book production begins after this Kickstarter campaign is complete and I receive the Kickstarter payment from the campaign to make the order (which is usually 2 weeks after it ends, on or around the first week in April). Once I receive it, I am able to move ahead with printing. The estimated time for printing is 3 months from handing files over to the printer in April until books being physically at my door in July. I'm allowing a month for shipping your rewards out with the exception of books with remarque sketches which I have allowed for additional time to complete. I will be preparing shipping materials as well as any additional rewards during the waiting period for the books to arrive.
Shipping: Will be collected after the project is complete and the books are printed and ready to ship in or around June or July. Please see more about shipping in the "Shipping" section at the bottom of this project page.

This allows me to better estimate how much shipping will be with a physical sample book as well as not inflate the Kickstarter funding goal which is for printing.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will be the third Kickstarter that I've run. My previous two were designed similarly with a project that was already complete and both were delivered before their estimated due dates. This project is, however, a much larger project. I've done my best to simplify some aspects of it and thought ahead in regards to printing timeline, shipping, packaging etc. I have added some padding in the fulfillment timeline to be able to stay on target.

While there are many things I can plan out ahead of time I realize there are always unforeseen circumstances that may arise in regards to working with such a large order of books that are out of my control. I plan to be transparent about the status of the project along the way so backers will be the first to know if anything comes up.

In order to keep backers up to date on the project, I've included the "project status" as well for extra transparency.

campaign.story:
Presenting  5 euro-styled games, part of our new Matchbox Collection. All games have been created along Italian authors and the illustrators that you have already seen in our previous titles. Each game has its own identity and the boxes are as small as 12x8 cm. You can carry them with you, slide the matchbox and play in just 20 minutes with cards and small bits that will make the whole experience so satisfying!
Natural phenomena have had an odd behaviour lately, seasons seem to have been disrupted and animals are migrating in the wrong direction. The 24 East Asian traditional solar terms are out of sync. Your seasons must find their alignment so the sun can find its route again and set the order right among all living things.
In 15 days, players will take alternating turns. Each turn choose 2 out of 4 possible actions, trying to receive the  animals pawns for special abilities and completing sets of Season cards for the most points at the end of the game.
Menace is approaching you. There seems to be a way out, but as a Samurai your first move is to reach for your weapons. Your basic instincts to run and hide have dissolved since the only option left is to fight for your honour. You are a rock and will hold tight, fighting the opponents face to face, using your weapons until the the very end.
Eiyo is a fast paced game where you need to strategically manage your weapons to defeat hordes of enemies. You will need to survive the attacks while gaining honour points that will be crucial at the end of the game.
After relentless days spent diluting solvents and heating liquid mixtures in vials, the air is damp, while the old and overused books stored in the library of your laboratory smell of humidity and dust. The end of the day is approaching and you have just found the perfect transmutation. You decide to stay a little longer, but you know the candles will stay on until they consume completely.
Rebis is a 1–4 player game. To win, you have to play your alchemistic ingredients wisely in order to brew the best elixirs and find the right time to brew them to get the most points.
The multiverse has spoiled you given the vastness of incredible places and creatures to meet and observe. You smell spices from miles away, your pores dilate, your gills tickle and your three stomachs are growling like an echoing symphony. You get to the source of the tasty fumes faster than a ray of light, your taste buds start working as a glowing sign shows up on the horizon: “Serving succulent food and spicy, quenching potions during satellite setting hours.”
Space Lunch is a 1-2 players, short, set-collection game. To win, you need to grab your preferred dishes before it’s too late by choosing Food cards from the table. However, beware! Your opponent might interfere with your plans.
The new surface of Earth is at its most bleak appearance. It may seem completely infertile and arid, but on the horizon promising mountains of mud and clay arise higher and higher. Golems, the magical mutable creatures, are being summoned with synergies among the resources of the earth.
Golems is a card collection game where you can use every card in two different ways. You have to decide whether you want to boost your Golem for victory points or save the resource to summon further Golems. With the use of Gems and special Runes you will be able to maximize your strategy to become the best Golem summoner.
We have always created games that we really enjoy playing and the Matchbox Collection is no exception, but every time we launch a new line of games, it is fundamental for us to understand if our vision resonates with you.
After a year since our last campaign, we are very excited to share a brief moment with you to shape this new creation together; and this is among the most interesting and rewarding moments for us.
Kickstarter and retail are two very different worlds and both of them are extremely important for us, but sometimes you want to create something regardless of the production boundaries, and Kickstarter is the best place to shape the games we dreamt of exactly the way we envisioned them.
Thundergryph exclusive is a new way for us to experiment, understand the product better and find the best way to make it work; and while we are not offering a retail option, it doesn’t mean that this line won’t have a possibility of hitting retail.
These games might become a collectible exclusive to this campaign, but they could reach more players in the future as well. For now, this campaign is the best chance we have to offer them to you directly at an honest price and make these games happen.
We really appreciate your support and we thank you for being the foundation of our imagination.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As this is our 7th campaign, we feel that it is important for us as creators to share with you what we have learnt throughout all the other campaigns and during 2019.

TIMELINE IS EVERYTHING.

While we always set important goals for the year, revising the timeline is something we have been doing for the past 3 years, and it was not a surprise for us that Tang Garden was about to create an important change in our timeline for 2019. 
Shaping the games together with our backers is one of the most interesting things of being a Kickstarter creator, but all of this additional content needs to be meticulously calculated before the campaign starts to add enough buffer time to the communicated timeline, while still being unaware of how successful a project will be.

Revising the timeline affects your perception towards us and affects the company stability by postponing future releases.

NEW WORKFLOW AND KICKSTARTER.

When you back one of our campaigns, you are not pre-ordering a product, you are really helping us make the game happen. This is a feeling we don’t want to lose, but we also understand that a game needs to be fulfilled at the right pace.

For the Matchbox Collection, we segmented the potential success of the project into four different outcomes and we have decided to establish the proper buffer based on the best-case scenario. This gives us room to listen to our community without compromising what we love the most about launching on Kickstarter: shaping a game together.

**Please refer to our timeline section on Kickstarter, where we show how we have organized the production and freight for the Matchbox Collection.**

A SETTLED PIPELINE IS MANDATORY.

Starting 2019, we decided to split our team into groups. We would be working at the same time on different projects and we would request help from freelancers if needed, without compromising our main tasks as a team.

Today, we are much more solid as a team, having a greater confidence on facing the challenges that the future holds, and we owe all of this to you and your support towards our projects.
We will always be grateful and we will always be prepared to listen and learn from your advice.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Cole and Julie continue their adventures in the unknown, and the things that go bump in the night!

Help keep independent art alive!

campaign.story:
My Inspiration
Celara is a little autobiographical, and is a love letter to all the geek girls, young and old, whom I have met and talked with over the years. When I was 16, I saw The Little Mermaid in its original run in the theater. I had always been a fan of Disney movies, but for some reason that one struck a chord in me. When I got home that night, all I could think about was that film, particularly the scene of Ariel in her grotto, singing about wanting more. I kept picturing how her hair moved in the water, how beautiful the color and light was, and how much I related to that song. I listened to the soundtrack on repeat and spent hours drawing that character. That movie was what made me want to be an artist.
In the past few years, being a Pop Culture artist and attending comic book conventions, I have been thinking a lot about what makes people become a fan of characters and stories from books, movies, games, or music. I have also been thinking about how and why people express themselves as ardent fans. They imagine themselves in these stories by cosplaying, through Disneybounding, by creating fan-art, or in writing fan-fiction. They attend conventions to share and celebrate their passion for these stories with other people. I feel like all of his is a way to bring the magic out of our favorite stories and into our real lives. This was the original inspiration for Celara: a little fangirl.
Some of my own personal favorite fictional characters are Ariel, Elsa, Tiana, Princess Leia, Anne of Green Gables, Dottie Hinson, Buffy, Wonder Woman and Hermione. These characters resonated with me for many different reasons, but above all, because they were creative, strong-willed and they never quit. I have art on my walls and Funko Pops on my shelves of all of these characters, not just because of how fun they are, but also to inspire me in my own life to go after my dreams and to not give up or give in to self-doubt. This is what inspired my "She-Series," an ongoing collection of portraits that I have been working on for the last few years. 

The Title:
I was a student at Ringling School of Art Design (now Ringling College) back in the mid-'90’s. I spent two years in the Resident Assistant program, as an alternate and as a full-fledged R.A. I learned a lot from that program and at the end of it, our mentor gave us each a small rock that had words engraved on them. Mine said “Never, Never Quit.”  Twenty-three years later, that rock is still on my desk. It has moved with me to multiple states and multiple homes, and is always right where I can see it as a constant reminder. I thought it would be a great title and message for my first children's book. When I was an elementary school Art teacher, I taught Kindergarten through 5th grade. All of these enthusiastic little six years old would throw themselves into their art, just happy to be creating. But as I watched them get older, they would start to judge themselves because they didn't think their drawings were "good enough" and eventually they stopped drawing altogether. 
At first when I created Celara, it was to show off my love of being a “fangirl.’  But with this book, which is her origin story, I wanted to take that one step further. I wanted to try to encourage children not to quit when things get too hard.  I also wanted to share what inspires me and what keeps me from giving up when pursuing my dreams gets hard. I hope kids will take away from Celara's story that’s it’s OK to like things, to be passionate about things, to celebrate that and get excited about it. It’s OK to be a geek or a fangirl and to showcase that. And when you are chasing your dreams, it is important to believe in yourself and know that everyone experiences doubt, fear, and frustration, but to still take risks and know that it won’t come all at once. Be patient with yourself. Practice, practice, practice, and never, never, EVER quit. 

Synopsis
Celara is a creative little girl with a huge imagination. Her little orange friend is named "Reverie". She loves whimsical adventure stories with mazes and strange creatures, music that makes her feel like she is under the water with a mermaid, and movies that take place in magical, far away lands. She loves stories in all forms, be it books, films, games, and songs. She dresses up and acts out scenes from her stories, sings along at the top of her lungs to her favorite songs and loves to draw her favorite characters and hang them around her room. One day, while daydreaming, she has a great idea. What if she created her own stories, her own characters? She sits down to work, only to discover it might not be as easy as it sounds.  She gets frustrated, maybe she’s not good enough? Maybe she can’t do it. It's hard. It’s so scary to create something new, what if no one likes it? But, she discovers that if you practice, if you don’t quit, and you aren’t too hard on yourself, that’s when the magic happens…..

Sample two page spreads
This book will be aprox. 9 1/4 inches by 9 1/4 inches. At the moment, it is 22 full page spreads, the blue line in down the middle of these pictures is the spine of the book. My goal is to have the book finished and to the printers by the end of June.





Thank you so much to my friends and  family for all the love and support, and to everyone who has been following my work on social media, coming to my tables at conventions, supporting my Patreon and Etsy store! You made this possible, and I am so grateful. <3
Thank you to Heather Antos, Aaron Sparrow, Joey Spiotto and Brian Kesinger for your advice and critique.
Special thanks to:
 My sister Amy for keeping me in line, and my brother-in-law Matt for logistical support. 
My brother Jeff and my soon-to-be sister-in-law Brandi for their music, graphic design and late night gaming sessions.
My boys Ryan and James for for just being their wonderful selves. 
My best friend, my love, and my partner in everything, Brandon. <3

campaign.story:
I want to start by bringing attention to Kickstarter United, a collective of Kickstarter workers who have come together to create a union in their workplace. A vote was recently held to determine whether or not they will be successful, and during this process they are staying off social media, but I would urge you to stay informed by checking out their website and to be prepared to take action if they call for it in the future. 
This zine is made up of three different games. They're all based off the same single-player system, which uses a deck of cards and a six-sided die to generate prompts for the player to expand on. 
cover art from Alone Among the Stars
Alone Among the Stars is a solo adventuring game about exploring strange and fantastic planets and experiencing wondrous sights. I wrote it in the summer of 2018 while I was playing a lot of No Man's Sky really late at night. If you'd like to check it out before backing the zine, it's available for PWYW on my Itch.io page here. 
page 1 of my example playthrough of Alone Among the Stars
cover art from Alone in the Ancient City
Alone in the Ancient City was the first hack of AAtS that I wrote. It's about wandering through an old city with new eyes, and was inspired by trips to cities such as Venice and Montreal. If you'd like to check it out before backing this zine you can find the plaintext version on my Itch.io page here. 
Alone Among the Twisting Trees is a new game I'm writing for inclusion in this zine! It's about getting lost in a mysterious forest and the strange artifacts that you find inside. It was originally conceived through playstorming with Quinn Vega and Avi Margolis as an adaptation of another game I wrote, Alone on the Rocky Beach (not included in this zine).
In addition to these games, there are a ton of other hacks that have been inspired by Alone Among the Stars. If this zine doesn't stick out to you but you're still looking for a cool single-player experience, I'd recommend checking out the rest of these hacks! I've tried to compile all of them in this Itch collection, Alone at the Table. 
I think anyone can make a game, and hacking is a great way to get started. A number of the hacks in the Alone at the Table collection were made by first-time designers, and in order to make hacking the game even easier I'm including a template that you can fill in to make your own hack in the back of the zine, as well as a page or two of useful design tips to get you started. You could even use the journaling pages to start playtesting!
"In Alone in the Ancient City, designer Takuma Okada translates the melancholy, No Man’s Sky-esque galaxy-wide wandering of Alone Among the Stars into a more humble joy, one of discovering a city on your own. Ancient City captures the feeling of traveling through a place with a history and weight belonging to others, but wholly unfamiliar to you. Okada eschews the oft-trod territory of metropolitan tourism and spectacle in the pursuit of a more intimate exploration. This game is Urban Pastel at its finest." - Caro Asercion, designer of i'm sorry did you say street magic 
"Are you playing Alone Among the Stars? And following the Twitter account? Get on it. @among_stars_" - John Harper, designer of Blades in the Dark
Alone On A Journey: a collection of solo adventuring games is a 28 page zine featuring this amazing cover art by Shannon Kao. It will include these three Alone games in a new layout by Quinn, a blank template of an Alone game with some pointers so you can make your own hack, and blank journaling pages in the back of the book so you can start writing right away. 
the cover for the zine!
 The zine is 5.5"x8.5" and will be printed through Mixam. The cover will be color on 110 lb. paper with a matte finish, and the inside pages will be black and white on 80 lb paper. 
In the spirit of Zinequest, I've tried to keep the budget low while paying collaborators fairly. The total comes out to $500 given a 50 print run. 
$225 for printing, shipping, and fulfillment: This should cover a 50 zine print run and shipping related costs for a mix of US and International orders. 
$75 for the cover art by Shannon: The art is already paid for and completed, but this covers the amount that I paid out of pocket for it already.
$150 for layout by Quinn: This is a tentative layout budget for about 20 pages, some blank journaling pages, and a cover.
$50 for fees: This is to cover Kickstarter fees!
As you may have noticed, I haven't really budgeted for paying myself. This is partially because I've already made some money off these games selling them on Itch.io, but it's also because I really want this project to fund and put it out in the world. If it funds over the goal, the first thing I'll be doing is paying myself and upping the print run to 100 copies. Beyond that I've been throwing around some ideas for stretch goals but haven't settled on anything yet, and I don't really want to assume a huge overshoot given the nature of Zinequest. If it looks like we will though, I may announce some extra goals on this page. 
Hi! My name's Takuma Okada, and I'm a Japanese American writer, musician, and game designer. I started making games almost two years ago now, and I'm really excited to finally have the chance to make one of my first games into a physical zine! Some of my other games include Stewpot: Tales From a Fantasy Tavern, Chess: Two Kingdoms, and Etude of the Evening. I love beautiful places and strange objects and try to make them easy to find in my games.
Quinn Vega is a queer game designer, graphic designer, and musician based out of Portland, OR. Her games include For The Honor, Lightning Kissed, and cowriting Songs for the Dusk with Kavita Poduri. When she is not making or playing games she works making microphones and leading her band, The Variants. You can find her on twitter @Mx_quinn and her work at mxquinn.itch.io.
Shannon Kao is an artist from Seattle who works in comics and illustration. She's interested in stories about how places—real & imagined—shape the people in them. You can find more of her work on her website!

Hi y'all! As of just now, you should all be able to submit your reward surveys. We're still a bit away from fulfillment, so you'll be able to change your addresses for a while, and I'll post a reminder update once we get close. 
Speaking of fulfillment, I know we're behind again. Moving alone took a lot out of me, and there were some issues with my courses in order to graduate and that took some time to detangle. Since my sublet was only for two months I needed to find another place for August as well. I'll be in Portland and be able to work with Quinn in person, but I'll most likely only be there for another two months. This makes fulfillment a little tricky, because I'll be flying out and can't bring stacks of zines with me. Optimistically, I could send zines out by the end of September, but if that isn't possible I may not be able to order the physical copies until October, and fulfillment would take place in late October-early November.

campaign.story:
Welcome from Jeff, John and Kathy to our latest Kickstarter campaign!
Jeffrey Alan Love has teamed up with us at Flesk Publications again to create his latest art book The Mountain of Smoke! This book is being offered as an affordable hardcover and as  a premium signed deluxe edition. 
We are thrilled to bring back the Love library by offering new paperback editions for his recently sold out books, Notes From the Shadowed City and The Thousand Demon Tree. We even have luxurious signed prints available. Enjoy the samples and details below. Thank you for visiting!
Update: Thank you for making this campaign possible! We appreciate everyone for giving us the chance to bring these books and prints to life!
All copies of the deluxe edition of The Mountain of Smoke, plus the paperback editions of Notes From the Shadowed City, and The Thousand Demon Tree come signed by Jeffrey Alan Love! Plus, you get a free postcard set when you pledge for a book. Stretch goal #1 is unlocked!  Please see the details below.
The Mountain of Smoke: A Jeffrey Alan Love Sketchbook trade hardcover book cover.
The Mountain of Smoke: A Jeffrey Alan Love Sketchbook is 128 pages at 11.75" wide x 9" tall. On offer is a hardcover edition, a deluxe signed hardcover edition, and only 20 copies of a deluxe signed hardcover edition with an original painting included.
The Mountain of Smoke is a collection of 51 paintings completed in acrylic, ink and pencil by Jeffrey Alan Love. These works are reproduced directly from Jeff’s sketchbook, which took him seven months to complete. Jeff is now sharing these personal works for the first time. The viewer follows along as the artist loses himself in his practice of letting his mind wander to see what it unveils. The result is a fantasy collection where you create the story.
The collection has been professionally photographed to showcase Jeff’s textures and paint strokes to give viewers the intimate feeling that they are holding the actual sketchbook. Over half of the paintings are accompanied by the artist's captions and initial pencil sketches. Details of 19 paintings are showcased.
The Mountain of Smoke--Deluxe Signed Hardcover Book
This deluxe hardcover version comes with a quarter binding (custom  material wrap to spine area that extends into the front and back covers)  with spine stamp. In addition, a unique page with a reproduced piece of art exclusive to this edition will be printed and bound into the book and  signed by Jeffrey Alan Love. This edition will only be available direct from us.
The Mountain of Smoke--Deluxe Signed Hardcover Book, Plus Original Painting

This deluxe edition with original art is limited to only 20 copies. It includes the deluxe edition book, plus it comes with an acrylic and ink original painting on 5" x 6"  Stonehenge paper. Note that the art is not painted inside the book.  It's on a separate piece of paper. The art subject matter is left to the  discretion of the artist. All art will be shipped at random. No  requests please. Jeff is making these originals available at a special lower price as a thank you to those who support his books.
Example of original painting. Only 20 available. The subject matter of all paintings are left to the discretion of the artist.
Three signed luxurious 13 x 19" museum quality giclée prints are available. The first print "The Long Watch" features a brand new painting by Jeffrey Alan Love. The second and third prints feature the artwork "Barbarian" and "The Dragon's Gift" from the interior pages of The Mountain of Smoke. These three prints utilizes 290 gsm acid free matte paper that is water resistant and is printed with archival and fade resistant inks. Note: The line down the middle of "Barbarian" and the "The Dragon's Gift" are intentional as they are the spine area of Jeff's sketchbook.
If you would like more than one print simply add its cost to your pledge  for each additional print. Feel free to message us if you need help.
The Jeffrey Alan Love Library: Notes From the Shadowed City and The Thousand Demon Tree Paperback Books! All Copies Come Signed! 
We would like to bring Jeffrey Alan Love's previous books, Notes From the Shadowed City and The Thousand Demon Tree, back in print as new paperback editions. Jeff will sign all copies of these two books exclusively for our Kickstarter supporters! 
"A wonderfully strange and atmospheric journey." — Joe Abercrombie
"What is there to say? Jeffrey Alan Love is just plain brilliant." — Mike Mignola
Notes From the Shadowed City is the travelogue of a young man  who sets off on a journey to research magical swords. He finds himself  stranded in a land he does not know and enters a city with no name over  which looms an ominous floating citadel. As he seeks a way home, he  fills his notebook with drawings and observations of his life in this  strange place. It is full of masked swordsmen, cities that walk, ancient  gods, swords made from petrified trees and dragons that move mountains.  There’s also a mysterious woman who captures his heart.
“The Thousand Demon Tree is incredible. What Jeffrey Alan Love has done with this book is to firmly cement himself as one of the most important artists making ominous and fantastical narrative work today. Full of shadows and terror and razor-sharp edges, this gorgeous book will sweep people into its dark and paralyzing world.”—Gerard Way
“This is one for the ages.”—Bill Sienkiewicz
The Thousand Demon Tree: Drawn into a strange quest by a bird and a sword, a lone warrior travels across a silent landscape of smoke and dirt and bone. Transformed by what he encounters along the way, he searches for the Thousand Demon Tree, and the hope of a new world that lies beyond it.
All book pledges come with a set of six 4 x 6" postcards featuring art from The Mountain of Smoke! This is just one way we would like to thank you for supporting us! This bonus item is limited to one per backer.
Additional bonus: All copies of Notes From the Shadowed City, The Thousand Demon Tree, and The Mountain of Smoke deluxe edition will come signed by Jeffrey Alan Love.
Stretch goals are a way for us to offer an additional thank you as the campaign grows. If we are lucky enough to hit our initial goal to make these books and prints a reality, we will be pleased to offer the following if we hit certain benchmarks.
Stretch Goal #1 is Unlocked! Thank you! We will include an 8 x 10" mini-print, one different mini-print for each of the three books. A total of three bonus prints if you get all three books! 
All Kickstarter stretch goal bonus items are limited to one per backer.
Add-on anything to anything! An Add-On lets you pledge for more than one  tier by adding the price of any additional tier to your existing  pledge. Say you want to include an extra signed book? Simply add-on the additional price of the book to your pledge and let us know. You will also need to add the extra shipping charge. Please contact us and we can provide you with a total. If you have any questions we are here to  help.
We expect to have  your pledges shipped to you in March 2020. All three books are complete. We will send  everything to the  printer within two weeks after this campaign ends if we hit  our goal. It takes approximately three and a half months for everything to be  printed and then to  be delivered to us. We will ship them to everyone  in March 2020  immediately upon their arrival at our Flesk warehouse  in Santa Cruz,  CA.
All books are shipped within the U.S.A. by USPS Mail and will include  tracking. Premium signed giclée prints shipped in  the U.S.A. will ship  by USPS First Class mail (small prints) or  Priority Mail (larger  prints or packages with multiple prints) and will include tracking.
The items shipped to our international friends usually take 3 weeks  for delivery  to your local post office, but can sometimes take up to  3-6 weeks  depending on the country. Note that customs for your  local country may  hold on to packages for a week or longer and incur  additional charges that is the responsibility of the backer. We will not  mark items as a "gift." We know that shipping  overseas is  very expensive and we wish it was cheaper, too! We help by subsidizing  some of the shipping cost. We make no money from the shipping charges collected.

Why you should trust Flesk Publications? John Fleskes answers:

I pride myself on having an 18 year record of delivering nearly 100 books of the highest quality. I've run over ten previous Kickstarter campaigns with artists such as Brom, Frank Cho, J.A.W. Cooper, Jeffrey Alan Love, Gary Gianni and Mike Mignola (Hellboy: Into the Silent Sea Studio Edition), Petar Meseldzija, Richard and Wendy Pini (Elfquest), Mark Schultz, and Daren Bader and Lance HaunRogue. Most of these have been on time. We are very open with our backers and communicate through updates often to keep you up to date.

In some cases, things don't always go exactly as planned in the publishing world. Much of the time they do, but sometimes an unexpected problem or delay arises. In the rare case that this happens, simply put, I deal with it and find a way to get the job done. I am very open about any challenges and like to share in the process so people know what's going on. I don't like surprises, and don't feel anyone else should either. I respect the artist, and our supporters too much to let them down. The good thing is that I've published nearly 100 books and I know how to get them shipped and delivered, and I know how to manage a schedule and keep projects on track, and I will stay motivated and energized to get the books into your hands.

I can't thank everyone enough who has supported us before. You directly help us to make these beautiful books.

campaign.story:
The Snap Forward: New Thinking to Win the Climate Fight

 We’re witnessing an extraordinary moment: a time when millions of people around the world are finally taking our planetary emergency seriously.

 There’s a palpable energy growing now. The Green New Deal. The scientists of the IPCC demanding that the world take the urgency of the 1.5ºC target seriously. Greta Thunberg’s school strikes for climate. The acceleration of clean energy technologies. The growing divestment movement. U.S. presidential candidates embracing the need for action. A resurgence of climate journalism. Even the survival of the Paris Agreement, despite Donald Trump’s bluster and threats. More people than ever before are serious about winning the fight to stop our climate emergency from becoming a full-blown catastrophe.

 For those of us who’ve been in this fight a while, these are thrilling days.

 These are also terrifying times, though. Most of us know that despite our growing momentum, we’re still losing the fight. Fossil fuel companies and other dirty industries are still using their political clout, propaganda of denial and predatory delay to slow progress and block the bold actions we need.

 And we know what losing means: Rising seas. Burning forests. Rivers running dry. Ferocious Storms. Wars and collapses. Trillions of dollars in damage, year after year. Hundreds of millions of people on the move, looking for somewhere safe. Losing the climate fight means terrible and tragic losses for our kids and their kids and generations to come. Losing the climate fight might mean losing civilization itself.

The clock is ticking. Faced with a set of dire problems that get worse every day, winning too slowly becomes basically the same thing as losing outright. Many of us worry we just can’t win fast enough.

 You know what? We’re right to worry. Despite all our new momentum, our old strategies are largely failing us.

 That’s because our strategies are based on old thinking, and old thinking is dangerous now. We’re going through what futurists call a “discontinuity” — a time when previous experience can’t ready us for what is coming — precisely at the moment when we’re all being forced to make a bunch of hard, serious choices.

 It's not easy to figure this stuff out for yourself. Much of what we read, see, hear and learn about the planetary emergency is out-of-date. When our thinking suddenly catches up to the scope, scale and speed of the problems we face, we often get a sort of mental whiplash. I call this experience "the snap forward."

 However, once we see the disruptive new forces emerging around us — once we snap forward — the moment we’re in begins to look less like a long losing battle and more like a set of opportunities for breakthrough victories. This short book shows how fresh thinking can help us win the climate fight, and win it fast.

 In it, I share the tools to make that leap. I explain the nature of this discontinuity, and unlock the secrets of climate foresight. I unpack why the Carbon Lobby’s apparent power is in fact a front for fragility. I explore the ten core new strategies available to us, right now, for winning fast. Most of all, I give readers the tools to make a bigger difference in their own work, communities and political lives.

The Snap Forward is the book this moment needs. In fact, I started writing this book two years ago precisely because I saw this moment coming. And I'm rushing to get it out this summer because speed matters now.

 I've spent years on the front lines, learning how to see the planetary future and make moves that matter. I've worked as a journalist, NGO leader, futurist and strategic advisor on five continents. This is the most important work I've ever done.

Here's the thing: I need your help bringing it to the world.

 I’ve got a manuscript. I need a couple months to polish it — with the help of my colleague Justus Stewart — and some financial support to help me hire an editor and designer to get it to publication. Once done, I'll deliver it as an e-book and in print-on-demand hard copy.

 Please help launch this important set of ideas into the world. 




About Me:
 My work explores the future of humanity and the fate of the Earth. I ask how we can better understand the connections between nature and human systems, how we can imagine the powerful solutions we need, and how we might build a sustainable civilization.

 I’ve been pushing the boundaries of climate foresight and disruptive sustainability for years, as a writer (Carbon Zero), editor (Worldchanging), and strategic advisor to some of the most forward-thinking groups and businesses in the world.


Here’s what others say about my work:

“Alex Steffen… lays out the blueprint for a successful century.”
     —The New York Times 

"You really, really should be reading Alex Steffen. Really. He’s telling the story of the future.”
     —Bill McKibben

 “There are two kinds of futurists. The first explore the variations of what exists and project the future from those tea leaves. The second, and by far the rarer, peer around the curve of time and reimagine the future as much as foresee it. Alex Steffen is the latter!”
     —Paul Hawken, Project Drawdown

 “When CEOs want to navigate the world's mega-challenges and prepare for a volatile world, they look to business strategists like me. And when business strategists want to challenge and hone our own thinking about the future, we look to Alex Steffen.”
     —Andrew Winston, author The Big Pivot and Green to Gold

 "Alex Steffen is an extraordinary visionary."
     —Rebecca Solnit

 “Alex Steffen delivers foresight that's powerful even for professional futurists. His ability to envision the underlying structures of change brings clarity, purpose and inspiration out of the fog of future possibilities.”
     —James Goodman, Director of Futures, Forum for the Future

 “Alex Steffen is one of the most insightful futurists on our struggling planet. He brings compelling and wide-ranging ideas about staying relevant and he is alert to new opportunities. He synthesizes what is known, what the new trends are on the horizon—a terrific intellect offering up deep and thoughtful considerations critical to modern leadership success.”
     —James P. Cramer, Chairman, Design Futures Council

I don't foresee any of these tasks being difficult or unusual jobs, but they all present opportunities for delays or errors. Therefore, I've given myself a generous timeline for delivery—and I hope to be able to move faster than that!

We want The Snap Forward to have a real impact in the climate debate. One way to do that is to reach a bunch of great folks, quickly.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
IDW Games has successfully Kickstarted 8 campaigns and has already fulfilled 7 of those campaigns. Our only outstanding campaign is Nickelodeon Splat Attack, which is on track to deliver in February.

IDW Games, a division of IDW Publishing, has been publishing games into retail via standard distribution channels for over 5 years.

All of our games are manufactured in China, and as such there are a few issues that could potentially slow the delivery of our campaign. The most common issues are production delays due to plastic quality, shipping delays due to vessel schedules and weather, and customs clearance when the goods come into America. There is always the potential that one of these things could cause a delay in the delivery of pledges of this campaign to backers. When these types of delays do affect campaigns, we're quick to update backers with the current situation.

Finally, while it's unfortunate, it isn't uncommon for first printing of games, whether they're Kickstarted or not, to have small typos and print errors. While we work hard to avoid those, there's always a chance they may come up. In the past, we've reprinted and replaced cards with errors at our cost, but we may not always be able to provide that service.

updates.update_content:
Hey there, shellheads!
As we mentioned in today’s subject line, we’ve just received the news that our EU TMNT shipments have successfully cleared customs and will be delivered to our fulfillment partner on Tuesday! Remember, you’ll have time to try out your games before late pledging for BTAS -- even if that takes us past the September 25th Backerkit closing. 
While you’re here, what do you say to a bit of Mutanimals fun? We just received approval to share a certain crowd-favorite character’s sculpt, so today’s mini dev diary is all about Herman!

Hey there, shellheads. 
As you’ve probably gathered from the subject of today’s update, the boat carrying all of our EU pledges safely arrived in port earlier this week. We’ll be popping in with a quick additional update as soon as we get confirmation that the games are through customs. On a related note, the pledge manager for BTAS will be closing on September 25th for anyone debating a donning of the cape and cowl. With that being said, let the weekend pizza party commence! 🍕

Cowabunga, dudes!  🐢
EU backers, your games are due to be pulling into port by the end of August! It will take about two weeks to clear through customs and get the shipping process started dockside, so you’ll be hitting the tabletop in true turtle fashion by mid to late September.

campaign.story:
La Mancha is a storytelling card game for 3-5 players based on Miguel de Cervantes’s classic 1605 novel Don Quixote. 
Players take turns revealing the steps of an epic journey: everything from angry innkeepers to virtuous love interests. To overcome each challenge, players use Chivalry cards in their hand (based on books that Don Quixote read in the novel) to tell stories of their deeds, with the best storyteller winning strength-enhancing Treasure cards. Players can then use these Treasures to perform great Feats such as slaying fearsome giants (or are they windmills?) and dueling their rivals. The player who has performed the most Feats by the end of the game is the winner!
Over 2 years in development, the gameplay of La Mancha is closely based on Cervantes' classic novel, where a nobleman plays at knighthood after reading one too many books about chivalry. Whether you've read Don Quixote multiple times or are a newcomer to Cervates' world, absurdity, adventure, and fun game nights await! 
What are people saying? 
"Storytelling games are always a blast but I enjoyed the different take this game has. This is a very simple and easy to learn game but it also has a lot to it" 
"You don't have to be intimidated if you don't know the story of Don Quixote because the game itself and how it plays is so much fun." 
~ Flavor Text Game Reviews, Nov 25, 2018
"Really great handpainted art...a light fun game. Great if you're a gaming group who likes to tell stories..." 
~ Lollygagger's Podcast, Nov 5, 2018
"There's something indescribably delightful about a game where players engage in combat one moment and compose 17th century love poems to woo one another the next. La Mancha is an exquisitely researched and beautifully illustrated game that celebrates creativity, originality, and a love for the super-meta."  
~ Kelli Dunlap, PsyD - game designer
"La Mancha is so fun to play, so many hilarious situations! Best of all, it got me to read the book!"
~ Matthew Farber, Ed.D., Assistant Professor, University of Northern Colorado
"A touch of strategy, plenty of fooling around, and it had beautiful artwork and respect for the novel."  
~ Mike Treanor, game designer and Assistant Professor, American University
 La Mancha comes with these components:
THE CHIVALRY DECK: Contains 90 cards with words and phrases from books of Chivalry such as Tirant lo Blanch, Amadis of Gaul, and Don Quixote itself. 
THE TREASURE DECK: Contains 50 cards that adds to a knight's strength. Contains armor, weapon, shield, steed, and helmet card types. Also includes the Knight's Gear cards for players to start with.
THE JOURNEY DECK: Contains 54 cards, consisting of the following card types
22 Encounter cards - Cards that feature situations that players respond to by making up stories with Chivalry cards. 
16 Love cards - Characters from Don Quixote that players may win the favor of by making up poems using Chivalry cards. These characters each grant special effects. 
16 Feat cards - Special cards used to win the game. Drawing one triggers a Feat round, where players compete to overcome a challenge with their strength and win the card. 
1 6-SIDED DIE

1 TURN CARD
INSTRUCTION BOOKLET
Box dimensions: 8.2 x 4.7 x 1.4 in
The cards feature hand-painted watercolor illustrations by the game's designer. 
Basic summary  
The game has 3 decks: Journey, Chivalry, and Treasure. Players hold a hand of 5 Chivalry cards, which each have a phrase from a book of Chivalry on them and sometimes a special effect. Players draw cards from the Journey deck and each card features a thing they need to react to with a story made up of text from their Chivalry cards: this sets the pacing and main action of the game. The Treasure deck contains objects that players can win by telling the best stories to become more powerful.

Players choose the length of the game by deciding how many Feat cards, cards that have players compete using their knight’s strength, will be drawn from the Journey deck before the game ends: 3, 5, or 7. The player that has won the most Feat cards after that many Feats have been drawn and resolved (i.e. best of 3, best of 5, etc.) is the winner.   
Gameplay description  
Players each start with 3 Knight’s Gear cards; which represents their starting weapon, steed, and helmet; that may be replaced as they win better equipment. One player draws a card from the Journey deck, which contains people, things, and situations encountered by Don Quixote and Sancho Panza in the book. The player who drew the card becomes the judge, and the other players tell stories, which must include phrases from their Chivalry cards, about how they would react to these situations. 
“Do you see over yonder, friend Sancho, thirty or forty hulking giants? I intend to do battle with them and slay them.”
The number of Chivalry cards the player must use and the type of story varies based on the type of card drawn from the Journey Deck. If it is an Encounter the player must tell a story that includes text from 1 of their Chivalry cards. The judge chooses the best story and the winner gets to draw from the Treasure Deck. If the card drawn from the Journey deck is a Love card, then each player must recite a love poem to the character on the card that includes text from 3 of their Chivalry cards. The judge, playing the part of character on the card, decides who has won their favor and gives the Love card to the winner, granting them strength and special abilities. In both situations, the judge is compensated by getting to take any Chivalry card they wish from those played by other players.  
After a player has turned over a Journey card and the card is resolved, all players draw or discard Chivalry cards until they have a hand of 5. The turn token is then passed to the player on the left and they may draw a Journey card.  
Feats  
The Journey deck also includes Feat cards, which have a challenge for all of the knights to undertake. Each Feat card includes a difficulty rating. Starting with the player who drew the Feat card, players take turns rolling a die and adding the result to their total strength rating from all of their Treasure and Love cards. If the total is higher than the difficulty of the Feat, then they have made a successful feat attempt. Players may block one another’s feat attempts by playing Chivalry cards from their hand that have special effects useful during this phase of the game.  
“Thou hast seen nothing yet.”
The first player to make 2 successful feat attempts wins the Feat and gets to keep the Feat card. The player with the most Feat cards after the agreed number of Feat cards has been drawn from the Journey deck wins the game.

$20,000 - We will add tuck boxes for the game's decks to the packaging

 La Mancha has already won several awards from international tabletop competitions! 

As a designer, I’m very interested in finding connections between games and the arts, so as I recently read Don Quixote by Miguel de Cervantes, all I could think was, “I want to play this, but I don’t know HOW.” One day, I received an e-mail from a member of our tabletop group: everyone should design a new game and we will play the outcomes at our next get-together. This was my chance!   
Throughout the novel, Don Quixote imagines that his mundane surroundings are things that he read about in books of Chivalry: windmills are giants, inns are castles, and so on. Wouldn't it be fun for players to do the same? I wanted the game to feature everything I love about deep storytelling and role-playing games, but in an approachable package that anyone could pick up. 
My first prototype was an Apples to Apples-style game where players respond to short prompt cards featuring everyday situations with reaction cards containing Chivalric text. The first playtests went okay, but I quickly discovered that the more fun prompts were those closer to the novel itself. Soon players were waving invisible swords in the air, declaring their undying love to one another, and butchering classic Broadway songs (yes, there is a card that references Man of La Mancha.) Beyond being a fun and approachable storytelling game, La Mancha is a deep storytelling engine, letting players experience Cervantes in a new way, and even add their own spin to his classic tales. 
ABOUT PIE FOR BREAKFAST STUDIOS
Pie For Breakfast Studios is an award-winning Northeast Ohio-based game development studio and advocacy organization creating experimental projects that combine games with the arts and humanities. The studio creates digital and non-digital game projects and is part of Pie for Breakfast, LLC, whose services include working with museums and cultural institutions to create events celebrating the artistic achievements of the game industry.  
Pie for Breakfast's projects include serious and educational games, commercial games, and works that have been featured in art museums around the world.

We've set up a generous release window between the Kickstarter and the delivery date (July) so that we can account for the rest of production, as well as proofing, printing, shipping, etc.

campaign.story:
Inspired by the legendary tales of horror, myth and folklore by Mike Mignola, Hellboy: The Board Game is a fully cooperative experience for 1 to 4 players. You become a member of the Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defence (BPRD), ready to investigate occult threats that threaten our very existence. You will explore gothic locations, hunt down clues, discover artefacts, fight horrific creatures and face off against terrifying bosses.
For more details about the 'Box Full of Evil' click here.
For full details of what's included in the Darkness Calls expansion, click here.
 For full details of what's included in the Hellboy in Mexico expansion, click here.
RESIN MINIATURES
For more details on the resin miniatures, please check here.
Designed by James M. Hewitt - the brains behind the likes of Blood Bowl 2016, Necromunda: Underhive, and Warhammer Quest: Silver Tower - Hellboy: The Board Game features incredibly detailed, pre-assembled PVC plastic miniatures that capture the unique look and feel of Mike Mignola’s visionary work.    
Miniatures supplied unpainted.
Hellboy: The Board Game gives you the chance to take control of an iconic member of the BPRD. Choose from Hellboy, Abe Sapien, Liz Sherman and Johann Kraus before equipping your agent with additional items that will help in the mission ahead. Each trinket, charm or weapon costs money though, so you’ll need to spend wisely.    
Artwork and text subject to approval.
Each of the missions in the core game begins by reading a BPRD Case File. This will set the scene for the investigation ahead and give hints about what threats you may encounter. The contents of each Case File are top secret, so the first time you play you'll have no idea what you're about to face!   
Miniatures supplied unpainted.
During play, agents must carefully balance the Information Gathered track against the ominous Impending Doom track. Information Gathered represents the clues you uncover about the monster you’re hunting, while the Impending Doom track marks how close humanity is to the brink of destruction.   
Artwork and text subject to approval.
Do you spend valuable time investigating the scene to find a vital piece of the puzzle that could expose a crucial weakness of your foe, but risk the Impending Doom track reaching its devastating finale? Or do you forget the clues and rush through to a final confrontation before the monster has gathered its strength? No one said being a BPRD Agent would be easy.   
Miniatures supplied unpainted.
Ahead of the climatic battle, you’ll have to face all manner of creatures that lurk in the shadows, ready to pounce at a moment’s notice. When the chips are down, it’s time to fight back using an intuitive system of custom coloured dice. Each BPRD agent has a range of special abilities they can use to defeat their enemies, or they can team up when things get really tough.   
Artwork and text subject to approval.
What’s more, no two missions will ever play the same thanks to the terrifying Deck of Doom. Each turn players unveil a Deck of Doom card, which could trigger a new onslaught from the arcane horrors hiding in the location, initiate a special event or simply move the Impending Doom track closer to its dramatic end.     
Artwork and text subject to approval.
No matter what your decisions are during the course of the mission, each play through will always end in an epic final confrontation with one of Hellboy's most notorious adversaries. The board itself changes to reveal the boss' lair and then all gloves are off for a desperate struggle against the forces of evil.  
Kickstarter exclusive box artwork drawn by Mike Mignola!
We currently estimate Hellboy: The Board Game (core game) will contain the following components*:
10 double sided room tiles (2.5mm thick, a mix of 2x2 and 1x2 with a linen finish)
4 Agent Cards
50+ cardboard tokens (damage counters, HQ board markers, target priority counters, furniture, doors, flame markers, etc., 2.5mm thick, with a linen finish)
13 custom dice
Three narrative Case File scenarios (tarot card sized, 310GSM, lined finish, each scenario includes between 6-8 cards)
Card HQ Board (linen finish)
74 Mini Cards (310 GSM, linen finish, Encounter Cards, Back-Up Agent details, Equipment and Starting Items)
48 Standard Cards (310GSM, linen finish, Deck of Doom Cards and Enemy Cards)
18 plastic cubes (Agent action tokens and generic black tokens)
Coloured bases to fit on Agents
Rulebook
*these are given as a guidance because the game is currently in development. We will keep backers updated with any changes to components
BPRD ARCHIVES EXPANSION
Also included in your pledge is the BPRD Archives expansion. This is an opportunity for you to create your own BPRD Mission Case File. You start by choosing the location – will it be an abandoned mansion, spooky graveyard, or something more sinister? Then select the foe you want to face in the final confrontation or just leave it to chance, so it's a mystery until the dramatic climax!
Work in progress Case File cards. Artwork/text subject to approval.
Once you’ve created the Case File, it’s time to make the accompanying Deck of Doom. You’ve got complete control to make the game as easy, or as challenging as you want by selecting the Deck of Doom cards and then shuffling them together. These will then be drawn as you're playing through the mission.   
Artwork and text subject to approval.
Finally choose your Encounter Cards. These will dictate what's inside each room and what monsters you will face. Combine these with your  Enemy Cards to battle against wild creatures, hideous Frog Monsters or Nazi soldiers. The choice is yours!  
Future releases and expansions will feature elements that can be combined with the BPRD Archives, so the experience will keep growing and the gameplay will keep changing long after you've finished your first adventure.
   MINIATURES
We've worked extremely hard to capture the style of the Hellboy comics. Each miniature has been approved by Mike Mignola himself and we've taken his feedback on board to make them as stunning as possible.
PLAY

Each miniature will be made from high quality grey PVC plastic and will be pre-assembled, so they're ready to go straight from the box. As you can see in the image below some of the miniatures are huge and will look amazing during play.  
 The videos below use the prototype components we have been using for playtests. The designs/components used are definitely not final but will give you an idea of how the gameplay works.  

Shipping is NOT included in your pledge and will be calculated/charged once the campaign has completed. We recommend waiting until the pledge manager to add the exact amount required. See below regarding import duties and taxes.   
We currently estimate that the shipping costs for the pledges will be approximately:
UK: £9

Rest of World: £25
All add-ons outside the core pledges will have their shipping calculated and charged in the Pledge Manager after the campaign has finished.
Please note, we are unable to ship to these countries: Russia, Ukraine, Kazakhstan and Afghanistan.
We are dedicated to our retail partners worldwide therefore we are delighted to offer you a retail pledge for our new Kickstarter.    
Information about the Hellboy retailer pledge can be found here.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are a number of risks with any Kickstarter project, especially getting accurate timings for such complex products with so many components. 

With this project, the rules are currently in testing and will require more playtesting, however we have a dedicated team of playtesters to help with this. Many of the miniatures are already designed and approved by Mike Mignola but some are still in concept stage. Once we have all the miniatures designed, the next part of the process is the tooling and production. We predict that we will begin shipping in February 2019 - however, the exact timing is impossible to predict and there is always the potential for delay with products produced in China. We will of course keep our backers up to date as best we can once the project closes.

To date, we’ve successfully fulfilled 11 Kickstarter campaigns: Kings of War, DreadBall, LOKA, Mars Attacks: The Miniatures Game, Deadzone, DreadBall Xtreme, Dungeon Saga, Kings of War 2nd Edition, Deadzone: Infestation, The Walking Dead: All Out War and DreadBall Second Edition.

We currently have four outstanding Kickstarters awaiting completion: the remaining Warpath vehicles are shipping to backers now, wave two of Star Saga: The Eiras Contract is currently going into production and is expected to ship shortly afterwards, TerrainCrate will begin shipping in May/June, and for Kings of War: Vanguard the miniatures are in tooling and resin is already in production ready for later this year.

REFUNDS

Upon request refunds may be given within 30 days of the campaign ending, including fees. Following that time, refunds may be given minus Kickstarter and payment fees. In order to request a refund you must contact support@manticgames.com

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

By backing this campaign you acknowledge that the components, artwork and game elements for Hellboy: The Board Game are subject to approval by Dark Horse Comics and Mike Mignola. This means some elements may differ from those shown here following the Kickstarter campaign.

If you do not complete the pledge manager within the time specified when the pledge manager is sent, you agree that your contribution to the campaign was a donation and your pledge is fulfilled. Of course, we will use our discretion on a case by case basis. Completing the pledge manager is the ONLY way for us to confirm your shipping address and pledge details, as well as making sure we hit the production timelines. 

By pledging on this Kickstarter you agree that will pay for any shipping and any import or other duties required in your country. You also accept that you are liable for providing us with the correct shipping details upon request and we are not responsible for items lost in transit if sending to an incorrectly provided address. We also cannot ship to PO boxes and you must provide an alternative shipping in this circumstance.

Although we are aiming to deliver Hellboy: The Board Game to Kickstarter backers before the game is available at retail, production and shipping delays can lead to delivery at the same time or following the retail release. 

If you do not agree to these terms, then please purchase the game once it's available at your friendly local gaming store in 2019.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Calling all Agents,
We're in the final 24 hours of the Hellboy: The Board Game expansions Kickstarter. This is your chance to get the all-new The Storm and The Fury expansion, plus three expansions based around the B.P.R.D. graphic novels.
We've also unlocked some great stretch goals, including The Wendigo, Gruagach, new Kickstarter Exclusive Case Files and we're on the cusp of unlocking Ashley Strode as a playable Agent! Check out the pledge below.

updates.update_userinfo: Hellboy: The Board Game back on Kickstarter
updates.update_content:
Calling all Agents,
Just in case you've missed it, Hellboy: The Board Game is back on Kickstarter to fund four new expansions, featuring new agents, new bosses and new minions.
We've already unlocked some great Board Game content, including the terrifying Wendigo, two all-new Case Files, Nimue's Champion and we're on the cusp of unlocking another hugely requested character... Gruagach.

updates.update_userinfo: Hellboy returns to Kickstarter Tuesday, April 27th!
updates.update_content: Calling all Agents!

updates.update_userinfo: Hellboy: The Board Game Part Two coming to Kickstarter soon!
updates.update_content:
Calling all B.P.R.D. Agents,
Today we're getting in touch to let you know that Hellboy is returning to Kickstarter to fund four new expansions... and a family-friendly, push-your-luck dice game. The Kickstarter will be launching later this month and you sign up for an alert when we go live here.
NEW EXPANSIONS!

updates.update_userinfo: Unexpected Plot Twist! Plus, info on the next Hellboy: The Board Game Kickstarter
updates.update_content:
Calling all B.P.R.D. Agents!
Today we've got two exciting pieces of news. The first is a collaboration with the team behind the upcoming Mike Mignola documentary, Drawing Monsters, which is currently being funded on Kickstarter.
MIKE MIGNOLA: DRAWING MONSTERS is a feature-length film that tells the story of how Mike Mignola came to create a world-renowned comic book universe.  The film includes never-before-seen interviews conducted with the legendary creator at his studio, drawing demonstrations, behind the scenes footage from workshops and comic book conventions, and interviews with some of the most influential people in entertainment.

updates.update_userinfo: Final 24 hours for Hellboy: The Roleplaying Game
updates.update_content:
Calling all Agents,
There are less than 24 hours left to back Hellboy: The Roleplaying Game on Kickstarter! Give your minis and board game items a whole new lease of life with an RPG that allows you to create your own Case Files and play them with friends.
What's more, there are rules in the book for integrating the board game into the RPG. Not only can you use the board game dice for generating Doom/Ingenuity, but there are also rules for using the Back-up Agent cards to add extra members to your team, guides for how to use the tokens, tiles and the Deck of Doom can be used by the GM to add some narrative points to the storyline. So potentially even the GM doesn't know what's going to happen!

updates.update_userinfo: Hellboy: The Roleplaying Game now on Kickstarter
updates.update_content:
Calling all Agents,
Hellboy: The Roleplaying Game is live RIGHT NOW on Kickstarter. We’re delighted to be bringing this project to life as we love Hellboy here at Mantic. In fact, since working on Hellboy: The Board Game we started chatting about how great a Hellboy RPG would be… we just needed someone to help us write it.

Calling all B.P.R.D. Agents,
Today we wanted to let you know about an exciting new collaboration between Mantic Games, Dark Horse Comics and Mike Mignola. This summer we'll be bring Hellboy: The Roleplaying Game to Kickstarter.

updates.update_userinfo: GIANT ROBOT HELLBOY IS HERE TO SAVE THE WORLD...
updates.update_content:
Calling all B.P.R.D. Agents,
We are pleased to announce we are working with Dark Horse Comics and visionary comic creator Mike Mignola to help raise money for charity with the release of Giant Robot Hellboy–a new playable character for Hellboy: The Board Game. 
During the COVID-19 outbreak, Mike Mignola has been entertaining fans with new illustrations nearly each day. These range from characters from the Mignolaverse to icons in popular culture. However, one of the most eye-catching was Giant Robot Hellboy–a massive mechanical version of Hellboy.

updates.update_userinfo: Missed out on Box Full of Evil? Plus new Hellboy busts!
updates.update_content:
Calling all B.P.R.D. Agents
It's been a while but we wanted to let you know that Box Full of Evil - which was previously only available via the Kickstarter - is now available in limited quantities via the Mantic website. When we place an order for Kickstarter pledges we always order a few extra for spares and missing bits - which means we sometimes have a few left for shows and special events.
